loans.name: Seefa's Group

texts.en:
Seefa has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing center business. She is a very talented businesswoman. She not only teaches the community girls sewing skills but also sews clothes for her customers. Managing her sewing center along with her household works very well. She gives the required time to her work. Seefa’s husband is also a tailor by profession and he sews gents' clothes on order.  

Seefa will invest the loan in buying an electric sewing machine which will help her finish the orders on time and increase her profits. She is very confident about her business success after this loan investment.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine for her sewing center business

loans.name: Alexie

texts.en: Alexie is 47 years old. She is married to a farmer. They have three children. She owns a boutique and has spent 25 years in the business. With the loan, she wants to add more items such as cooking oil, sugar and soaps to sell. The profits from the business will be used for saving.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and soaps to sell.

loans.name: Lang

texts.en:
Lang, age 43, is a resident of Kompong Cham province, where she was born and grew up on the family farm. She has been a rice cultivator for ages with a good farming practice. Besides rice, Lang also grows some types of vegetables for additional income for the family. She is glad because her husband is very helpful and supportive in the maintenance of the rice field. 

Lang wants to achieve financial stability and attain her goals in business, so she is asking for a loan of 2,000,000 riels to add to her savings to purchase a piece of farmland. She hopes to obtain a good harvest in the next season with this expansion. She will use her generated income to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of farmland.

loans.name: Patricie

texts.en: Patricie is 37 years old. She has been selling different items for the past two years in her boutique. With this loan, she wants to add more items such as sugar, soap and lotions to increase the volume of sales. The profits from the business will be used for savings.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, soap and lotions to sell.

loans.name: Dieu Merci 1 Group

texts.en:
Therese, age 50, is married with 3 grown children. She has one child in college. She is representing the Dieu Merci 1 group. 

Therese runs a restaurant in Brazzaville. She will use the loan to buy food and supplies for her restaurant. Her business strategy is to keep a clean and welcoming atmosphere in her restaurant. She understands that customers want to spend time in a place that is pleasing. 

Therese has received 4 previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. She has a good repayment record. She hopes to continue to improve her restaurant and expand to selling fish as well.

loans.use: to pay for food and supplies for the restaurant.

loans.name: Serina

texts.en:
Serina is married with four children. She is 55 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, Serina has a rice palay buy-and-sell business. She has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns approximately  5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). 

Serina has been a member of PMPC for six years. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to be used to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. In the future, Serina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Ligia Sofia

texts.es: Con su primer crédito Kiva, Ligia compró ropa en general como jeans, bermudas  en tela de dril y en lycra, blusas y otras prendas femeninas al por mayor que vendió a su clientela dando respuesta a los pedidos que tenía.  Con esto, pudo obtener precios más bajos por pronto pago y volumen que le generaron mayores ganancias.  Con el nuevo crédito quiere seguir comprando con esta modalidad ya que ha visto muy buenos resultados, comprará un mayor surtido de ropa para así conquistar nuevos clientes.  El mensaje para sus financiadores es el siguiente: “Los felicito por apoyar a personas honestas, trabajadoras y humildes en todo el mundo.”
texts.en:
With her first Kiva loan Ligia bought general clothing like jeans, cotton and lycra shorts, shirts, and other women's garments at wholesale, which she sold to her customers in response to their orders. With these purchases she was able to get lower prices by paying promptly and for the volume, which generated greater profits. 

With the new loan she wants to keep buying under this method, as she has already seen very good results. She will buy a good supply of clothing to win over new customers. Her message to her financial backers is the following: "I wish you well for supporting honest, hardworking and humble people all over the world."

loans.use: to buy clothing: jeans, shirts, etc. for sale.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en:
Olive is 32 years old. She has two children and both go to school. She has been in the boutique business selling different items for the past seven years. 

With the loan she will add more items in the boutique such as rice, sugar and cooking oil. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en: Eugenie is 39 years old. She is married with five children, all who go to school. She sells bananas and has been in the business for the past ten years. With the loans from the business, she will buy more bananas to sell. She wants to use the profits from the business for pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Son is 52 years old, married, and has four children. She operates a farming business in a village of Kompong Cham province. Every day, she works in the field cultivating rice alongside her husband. She aims to provide a better living to her children. The important thing for her is to create good opportunities for her children’s future education.

As of now, she is asking for a loan amount of KHR 600,000 to pay for the outstanding loan to the food suppliers who cooked for her children’s wedding last time. This loan will help solve a hard situation in the family. She hopes that our lenders won’t reject her loan and she is very grateful for your support.

loans.use: to pay for the outstanding loan to the food suppliers who cooked for her children’s wedding last time.

loans.name: Rosta

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 8 filhos dos quais 5 frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta mais 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ela.
Tem um negócio próprio de venda de produtos alimentares, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material (ferro, cimento, pedra, blocos, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa.
No futuro pretende concluir a obra da sua casa e mobilar, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é o alto custo de vida e a saúde da sua família.
texts.en: Rosta is married and is the mother of 8 children, 5 of whom are in school.  She lives in her own home with her family and also supports 2 nephews who live with her.  She has her own business selling food products.  With this loan, she will buy iron, cement, stone, bricks, etc., to continue work on her home.  In the future, she hopes to continue work on her home and to furnish it.  To do this, she promises to make her payments on time so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.  Her challenge is the high cost of living and her family's health.

loans.use: to buy materials (iron, cement, stone, bricks, etc.) to continue work on her home.

loans.name: Albino

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 2 filhos ainda menores, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Trabalha na Bananalândia como carregador de bananas, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material (areia, cimento, pedra, blocos, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa.
No futuro pretende concluir a obra da sua casa para melhor confortar a sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é crescer profissionalmente para melhorar o seu salário.
texts.en: Albino is married and is the father of two young children.  He lives in his own home with his family and doesn't support anyone else besides them.  He works at Bananalândia loading bananas.  With this loan, he will buy materials (sand, cement, stone, bricks, etc.) to continue work on his home.  In the future, he hopes to finish his home to improve his family's comfort.  To do this, he promises to make his payments on time so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.  His challenge is to grow professionally so he can increase his salary.

loans.use: to buy materials (sand, cement, stone, bricks, etc.) to continue work on his home.

loans.name: Salomao

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 15 filhos dos quais 1 ainda frequenta a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta mais 4 netos que vivem com ele.
Trabalha como agricultor dono de machamba, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar semente de tomate, repolho, pepinos, e adubos para reforçar a sementeira.
No futuro pretende reactivar o seu tractor para dar continuidade a sua actividade e ajudar algumas comunidades nas sachas, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é comprar um novo tractor para auxiliar na sua actividade e aumentar o nível produção.
texts.en: Salamao is the father of 15 children, one of whom is in school.  He lives in his own home with his family and also supports 4 grandchildren who live with him.  He works as a farmer on his own land.  With the current loan, he will buy tomato, cabbage, and cucumber seeds and compost to improve his seedbed.  In the future, he hopes to use his tractor to continue working and helping some communities that use hand tools.  To do this, promises to make his payments on time so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.  His challenge is buying a new tractor to help with his work and to increase his level of production.

loans.use: to buy tomato, cabbage, and cucumber seeds and compost to improve his seedbed.

loans.name: Ernestine

texts.en: Ernestine, aged 36, is a mother of six children, and all are enrolled in school. She has been selling foodstuffs for the past four years. With the loan, she wants to buy more rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more rice to sell in the market.

loans.name: Coutinho

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 5 filhos todos ainda frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
É militar do Ministério da Defesa, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar um televisor plasma para oferecer melhores condicoes de vida a sua família.
No futuro deseja subir a sua patente profissional, assim como melhorar a sua casa, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar mais e terminar a sua faculdade aumentar a sua renda mensal para melhora a vida familiar.
texts.en: Coutinho is married and the father of 5 children, all of whom go to school.  He lives in his own home with his family and doesn't support anyone besides them.  He is in the military and works for the Ministry of Defense.  With this loan, he will buy a plasma television to offer better living conditions to his family.  In the future, he hopes to rise in the ranks professionaly so he can make improvements to his home.  To do this, he promises to make his payments on time so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.  His challenge is to work more and to finish college and increase his monthly income to improve his family's life.

loans.use: to buy a plasma television to offer better living conditions to his family.

loans.name: Mirna Senayda

texts.es:
Mirna tiene 30 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, vive en una colonia de San Pedro Sula, Cortes.
Mirna hace 7 años estableció su propio negocio de pulpería. Ofrece productos de primera necesidad, como harina, frijoles, azúcar, huevos, lácteos, carnes, pan, productos enlatados, productos de abarrotería, etc.  Ella manifiesta que este negocio es muy rentable ya que son productos que se venden a diario. Mirna es una señora trabajadora se levanta desde muy temprano para atender a sus clientes.
Esta solicitando a ODEF un préstamo de 10,000 para poder invertir en la compra de productos alimenticios  como Frijoles, harina, manteca, carnes, lácteos, embutidos etc. Para seguir ofreciendo a los clientes los productos que demandan.
Su meta es trabajar siempre en su negocio y con el tiempo pueda ser mas grande para tener ingresos con los que pueda darle el estudio a sus hijos y una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Mirna is 30 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in a subdivision of San Pedro Sula, Cortes.

Seven years ago, Mirna established her own grocery business. She offers basic necessity products such as flour, beans, eggs, dairy products, meat, bread, canned goods, and other grocery products. Mirna says that this business is very profitable since her products are sold on a daily basis. She is a hardworking woman who wakes up very early in order to serve her customers.

Mirna is requesting a loan of 10,000 HNL from ODEF so that she can invest in the purchase of food products such as beans, flour, lard, meat, dairy products, canned goods, and other items so that she can continue to offer her customers the merchandise they demand. Her goal is to keep working in her business and see it get bigger over time so that she can provide her children an education and a better life.

loans.use: to buy food products to restock her business.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.es:
Marjorie es una mujer de 53 años, quien vive en la provincia de Puntarenas, cantón de Golfito, distrito de Guaycara, en el sector de Río Claro.
Ella se dedica a la comercialización de articulos de catálogo tales como cosmeticos, perfumes, ropa interior, los cuales vende en su comunidad Bambel III, mediante el sistema de pagos desde hace ya varios años; este préstamo lo invertira en los mismos articulos que comercializa, lo que hara ahora sera aprovechar los descuentos que ofrecen los proveedores cuando se hacen compras de contado, logrando de esta forma obtener un margen de ganancia mayor.
Marjorie es madre de dos hijas, quienes todavía estan estudiando y su deseo es poder ayudarlas a continuar sus estudios, para que por medio de ello logren mejores oportunidades de las que ella tuvo.
texts.en: Marjorie is a 53 years old woman, who lives in the province of Puntarenas, Golfito canton, Guaycara district, in the Río Claro area. She has been selling catalog products such as, cosmetics, perfumes and underwear, in her community, Bambel III, through a payments system, for several years now. She will invest this loan in the products she sells, what she will do now, is take advantage of the discounts offered by suppliers when cash purchases are made, which will allow her to get a higher profit margin. Marjorie has two daughters who are still studying, and she wishes to be able to help them to continue their studies, and that thanks to that they will get better opportunities than she had.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfumes and underwear

loans.name: Jeanne D'arc

texts.en: Jeanne D’Arc, 46 years old, has five mature children. She has operated a business selling beans and sorghum for 20 years. Jeanne D’Arc has requested this loan to buy more beans and sorghum to sell. She plans to use the profits for paying her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Dieu Merci 2 Group

texts.en:
Aubierge, age 32, is married and has 4 children whose ages range from 2 months to 18 years old. She also cares for her elderly father. Aubierge is representing the Dieu Merci 2 group. She has operated a business selling clothing in a local market for 4 years. Aubierge will use the loan to buy bales of clothing from her supplier. In Congo, it is common to buy used clothing in large bales and then the vendor sorts and sells the clothing.

Aubierge has received 4 previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. She has a good repayment record. She hopes to be able to travel to China and buy merchandise for her business one day.

loans.use: to pay for bales of clothes.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with seven children. She runs a kerosene selling business. She buys kerosene on a  wholesale basis and resales it to retailers for the local market. She has been operating her business for the last five years.

Fatuma has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Kiva partner Yehu Microfinance to improve her retail business by buying more kerosene. She is focusing on expanding her kerosene business significantly to be able to earn enough income to meet her growing family’s needs, especially the education of her children.

Fatuma says high competition from kerosene sellers remains her greatest limitation.

loans.use: to purchase kerosene for resale.

loans.name: Burn

texts.en:
Burn, 41 years old, lives in a rural village located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. He has four children who are dependent on him. Burn and his wife earn a living through farming rice and raising pigs. To better support the family and earn more income, his wife sells rice soup and cakes in the market. Burn has been in this business for ten years, earning around 20,000 KHR per day from it. 

This is Burn's second loan with VisionFund. He successfully repaid his first loan which has enabled him to better support his family. Burn is now requesting a loan of 4,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizers for his farmland and feed for his pigs. With this loan, he hopes to grow his family's business and earn more income to better feed his children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pig feed

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr:
MADAME COUMBA EST MEMBRE DU BANC VILLAGEOIS DE TAMBACOUMBA CRÉE LE 19 OCTOBRE 2001. ELLE S ACTIVE DANS LA VENTE DE CREVETTE SÉCHÉES.

MADAME COUMBA EST MARIÉE ET MÈRE DE 10 ENFANTS. ELLE EST ÂGÉE DE 44 ANS ELLE PARTICIPE A LA PRISE EN CHARGE DE SA FAMILLE

ELLE COMPTE S APPROVISIONNER DANS LES VILLAGE ENVIRONNANT POUR ALLER REVENDRE DANS LES GRANDES VILLES DE LA RÉGION

ELLE VA ACHETER 375Kg DE CREVETTE A FRAIS ET 800Kg QU ELLE FAIT SÉCHÉ POUR LA REVENTE.

LES PROFIT SERVIRONT A ACHETER DES DENRÉES ALIMENTAIRE POUR SA FAMILLE.
texts.en:
COUMBA is a member of the TAMBACOUMBA Banc Villageois, which was created on October 19, 2001. She is in the business of selling dried shrimp.

COUMBA is marreid and mother of ten children. She is 44 years old, and she participates in caring for her family.

She plans to stock up in the surrounding villages and then sell her goods in the region's larger cities.

She will buy 375 kg of fresh shrimp and 800 kg that she will dry before reselling.

The profits will allow her to buy food for her family.

loans.use: to buy dried shrimp

loans.name: Lucia Margarita

texts.es:
Lucia, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, ya que desea continuar trabajando en su negocio, manteniendo un negocio surtido de verduras frescas como zanahorias, güisquiles, papas, repollo, tomates, y otras en general que son necesarias para poder ofrecer a la clientela.
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior fue un gran aporte para ella, pues hasta el momento se ha mantenido con sus ventas en el mercado, pues le facilito los recursos económicos para crecer en el inventario, con la nueva deuda espera tener tambien una buena experiencia.
texts.en: Lucia, is asking for a new loan, since she wants to continue working in her business, keeping it well-stocked with fresh vegetables such as carrots, chayote, potatoes, cabbage, tomatoes and others, which she needs to have available to offer to her customers. She considers the previous loan has been a big contribution for her, since it has allowed her to continue selling in the market up to now, by providing the financial resources needed to increase the inventory. She expects to have a good experience with the new loan as well.

loans.use: to buy carrots, chayote, potatoes, cabbage and tomatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more meat to expand his meat roasting business

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim, 30 years old, is an industrious father of a lovely young child. He lives with his wife and child in Ang Snoul district, Kandal province. Lim and his wife met each other in a garment factory, where they work to earn their livelihoods. Together, they are able to earn approximately US $10 per day to cover their daily expenses.

Due to lack of capital to get the construction of his house finished, Lim would like to borrow a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy construction materials and to pay for labor costs. In the future, Lim anticipates having a clothes shop in his commune where he can provide tailoring services to local people.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Amour Du Prochain 1 Group

texts.en: Jean Pierre is married with two children. He also cares and provides for his elderly father. Jean Pierre is representing the Amour du Prochain 1 group. He sells sandals in a local market. He has been operating this business for over five years. He will use this loan to buy sandals to reinforce his merchandise. His business strategy is to open his business early and on a consistent basis at a consistent time. He also feels it is important to keep his area clean and organized for the customers. Jean Pierre has received four previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. He has a good repayment record. He wants to grow his business into a large shoe store.

loans.use: to pay for sandals.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Age 53, Mary is a widow living with her six children in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She still has three children dependent on her; one of them is still in school, while the others work in a garment factory. Cassava and cashew planting is the primary source of her family's income to support their daily living. She has been in this business for six years. She is challenged to feed her children nutritious food with the income earned from the business. 

Mary has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles and successfully paid back the loans. She used the loans to better support her children with nutritious food. With a need to support her business, she is requesting a loan from VisionFund of 2,000,000 riels. She wants to use this loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland and will use a portion of it for labor and to plow the land. She hopes to make more income and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to pay for labor and plowing the land.

loans.name: Saina

texts.ru:
Сыйне 59 лет, вдова, воспитала 8 детей. Будучи активным человеком, Сыйна смогла дать образование своим детям - 2 дочери стали учителями, сын – строитель. В качестве источника финансирования для ее семьи, Сыйна с 1982 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний  день в хозяйстве Сыйны имеется 10 овец  с приплодом, выручка в продажи мясных продуктов составляет около 8,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сыйна обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Сыйна планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Siyne is 59 years old, widowed, and has raised eight children. An active person, Siyne was able to provide an education for her children; two daughters are teachers, and one of her sons is a builder. To provide for her family, Siyne has been raising livestock since 1982. She started her business with 10,000 somi (KGS); today her business includes 10 sheep with offspring, and the monthly earnings fron selling meat products comes to about 8,000 somi.

To develop her business further. Siyna has turned to Bai-Tushum & Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 somi (KGS) to buy more livestock. Siyna plans to invest the proceeds from the loan into the further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Ruth Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Ruth” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders seeking a loan of 1,200,000 Sierra Leonean leones each in order to invest in their businesses.

Halima is the leader of this group. Halima is 45 years old. She is married with six children attending primary, secondary and tertiary institutions. Halima sells market food – Maggi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), dried fish, pepper, etc. She has been a businesswoman for many years now. With the help of this loan, Halima will invest in her business by buying the above mentioned items in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy Maggi, dried fish, pepper, etc., in large quantity to add to her current stock

loans.name: Balbino De Jesus

texts.es:
Balbino, administra una tienda, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, el negocio surgió por el apoyo de su familia, junto a su esposa realizaron la inversión, no tienen un horario establecido para atenderlo.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos de primera necesidad, ya que surtirá el negocio de productos como arroz, frijol, aceite, queso, entre otros que son necesarios para poder mejorar la disponibilidad de mercadería, esta compra le permitirá crecer y mejorar la atención a los clientes.
La aspiración de Balbino, es a través del préstamo, lograr el mejoramiento del negocio, una buena inversión, que le ayude a mantenerse en las ventas, proveyendo siempre para su familia lo necesario.
texts.en: Balbino manages a store; he lives with his wife and his children. The business started thanks to the support of his family. Together with his wife, they made the initial investment. They don't have a fixed schedule for opening hours. He requests a loan to buy convenience store items, to stock the business with products, such as rice, beans, oil, and cheese among others, that are needed to improve the availability of merchandise. This purchase will allow him to grow and to better satisfy his customers. Balbino's aspiration is to use the loan, to improve the business and make a good investment that will allow him to keep up the sales, and support his family.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil and cheese

loans.name: Daysi Marina

texts.es:
Daysi, es una persona de hogar, vive con su esposo y un hijo, ella junto a su esposo realizan las labores agrícolas, sembrando maíz y frijol para el sostenimiento del hogar.
Actualmente iniciará la siembra de invierno para esto solicita la compra de abono, semillas, herbicidas, y la preparación del terreno, ya que junto a su pareja desean iniciarlo, este préstamo les ayudará para tener lo necesario y poder fortalecer y prevenir el cultivo de las plagas.
El objetivo de ella es apoyar a su esposo y a su hijo a través de su trabajo, de este cultivo espera tener una abundante producción que le pueda generar ingresos a su familia.
texts.en:
Daysi is a homemaker who lives with her husband and son. She and her husband handle the farm work, growing corn and beans in order to sustain their household. Daysi is about to start the winter planting, so she is requesting a loan in order to buy compost, seeds, herbicides and to pay for the preparation of her land. She and her partner would like to get started so this loan will help them acquire what is needed to strengthen their crops and prevent pests.

Daysi's goal is to support her husband and her son through her work with these crops. She hopes to have an abundant production so that she can generate income for her family.

loans.use: to buy compost, seeds, herbicides and to pay for the preparation of her land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Jose Fernando

texts.es:
José, es agricultor, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 7, 9 y 12 años de edad, él realiza los cultivos de maíz y frijol, desde hace 15 años, trabaja todos los días desde las seis de la mañana hasta las tres de la tarde.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono y herbicidas, para el cultivo de maíz y frijol, este préstamo será una gran ayuda para José, pues contara con los recursos económicos para poder mejorar el cultivo, ya que le permite tambien prevenirle al cultivo de las plagas.
La aspiración de él es ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios, a través del trabajo, pues le ayudara para que ellos se superen.
texts.en:
José is a farmer who lives with his wife and three children who are 7, 9 and 12 years old.  He has been growing corn and bean crops for the last 15 years.  He works every day, from 6.00am to 3.00pm.  

José is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and herbicides for his corn and bean crops.  This loan will be a great help to José as it will give him the financial resources he needs to improve his crops.  It will also enable him to prevent pests from attacking his crops.

José's aspiration is to work hard in order to help his children with their studies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides for his corn and bean crops

loans.name: Gaybullo

texts.ru: Гайбулло кредитуется с нашей организацией уже несколько лет, но в течении 2 лет он не получал у нас кредит. Теперь когда дети выросли и потребностей  стало больше, он вынужден продолжить развивать свой бизнес.Гайбулло занимается выращиванием скота.Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже 25 лет.Этому бизнесу его научил его отец.Он покупает скот с рынка скотов и откормив, продает на том же рынке уже по дороже. В настоящий момент он получает кредит для увеличение поголовья скота.Он планирует купить коров чтобы одновременно продавать молоко. В конце осени он продаст корову и купит мелко рогатый скот,  который легче держать и ухаживать зимой.
texts.en: Gaybullo has received loans from MDO Arvand, LLC, for several years, but has not received any loans for the last two years. Now that his children have grown up and their needs have increased, he has had to keep develop his business further.  Gaynullo has a livestock business, and has been doing this type of work for 25 years. His father taught him the business: he buys animals at the livestock market, fattens them, and then sells them at the same market for a profit. He has asked for a loan to increase his number of livestock. He plans on buying a cow so he can sell the milk. At the end of autumn, he will sell the cow and buy a goat or sheep, which will be easier to keep and take care of during the winter.

loans.use: purchase of livestock

loans.name: Nonvignon 2 Group

texts.fr: «NONVIGNON 2» est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la représentante (celle qui a le doigt levé sur la photo) est nommée Sylvie Marie-Rose. Les membres du groupe résident dans le même quartier. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Âgée de 42 ans, Sylvie Marie-Rose est mariée à un certain Karim. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sylvie Marie-Rose assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Sylvie Marie-Rose vend depuis une douzaine d’année, des ustensiles de cuisine et de l’huile végétale dans un quartier du Bénin, ce qui lui permet d’assurer les besoins de sa famille. Sylvie Marie-Rose achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Sylvie Marie-Rose et aux autres membres du groupe «NONVIGNON 2», de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
The «NONVIGNON 2» group has three members.  The group's representative (who is raising her finger in the photo) is called Sylvie Marie-Rose.  The members of this group all live in the same neighborhood.  With the aim of increasing their working capital, they are requesting their first loan from ALIDé.  

Sylvie Marie-Rose is 42 years old and married to Karim.  The couple have four children who all attend school and are still in their care. Sylvie Marie-Rose and her husband jointly cover their household expenses.  Sylvie Marie-Rose has been selling cooking utensils and vegetable oil in a neighborhood in Benin for around 12 years.  She buys her products in a market in Benin.  

This first loan will allow Sylvie Marie-Rose and the other members of the «NONVIGNON 2» group to boost their businesses, increase their number of customers and increase their income.

loans.use: to buy cans of oil and cooking utensils

loans.name: Rumlas

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Rumlas is a 43-year-old widow of one son. To make a living, she has been planting cassava and rubber trees for eight years. With her current business, she is able to earn around 33,000KHR per day to pay for daily expenses.

Rumlas is now requesting her first loan with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, to buy fertilizers for her farmland and pay for land plowing. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to achieve better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es:
Doña Blanca, sigue laborando como analista de estadistica, como objetivo ha sido las mejoras  a su casa, que ha venido mejorando por ciclo, siendo posible a corto plazo, con financiamientos otorgados en Afodenic.
Con el credito anterior logro reparar la mitad del techo de la casa, aun seguira en la reparacion de la otra mitad,  asi como instalar aguas negras para una mejor higiene, seguridad de su familia. comprando laminas de zinc, perlines, tubos de pvc,  pega, para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Doña Blanca continues to work as a statistical analyst.  Her goal is to make improvements to her home, which she has been improving in cycles, which is made possible with loans from Afodenic. 

With her last loan, she repaired half of the roof of her house, and now she would like to repair the other half.   She would also like to install a wastewater system for better hygiene and security for her family.  She will purchase zinc sheeting, roofing beams, pvc pipes, and glue to begin the work.

loans.use: to purchase zinc sheeting, roofing beams, and pipes.

loans.name: Gulzada

texts.ru:
Гулзаде 32 года, вдова, одна воспитывает  2 детей – школьников. Гулзада работает учителем в школе  и в качестве дополнительного источника финансирования своей семьи, занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес в 2000 году. Благодаря упорному труду, Гулзада начав с суммы в 10,000 сом смогла развить хозяйство с 20 головами мелкого рогатого скота, 
что приносит ей ежемесячный доход в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS).  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулзада обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Гулзада планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства, чтобы сделать накопления на будущее образование для своих детей.
texts.en:
Gulzada is 32 years old. She is a widow and bringing up two children of school age on her own. Gulzada works as a secondary school teacher, and, as additional source of financing, she also raises livestock, having launched this business in 2000. Thanks to Gulzada’s hard work, her farm, which had been  started with 10,000 KGS, has grown. Now Gulzada has 20 heads of sheep and goats, which brings in a monthly income of 10,000 KGS. 

In order to develop her business further, Gulzada turned to “Bai Tushum & Partners” for a loan in the amount of 135,000 KGS for purchasing additional livestock. Gulzada plans to invest the resulting revenues into  expanding her farm further, so as to be able to save some money for the education of her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Koeun

texts.en:
Koeun, a 26-year-old mother of a lovely young child, resides in Kampong Chhnang province where she grows rice, a legacy she received from her ancestors. Her husband provides motorcycle repair services from their house, earning around USD 6.00 per day to support the family.

Due to the financial difficulties, Koeun has decided to seek employment as a laborer in a neighboring country, working through a company that provides vocational training to Cambodian people and sends them to work in their partner countries. She is therefore requesting a loan of KHR 2,000,000 to pay for a passport and visa, which will allow her to enter and work in those countries.

Koeun hopes that she can earn a good income there to better her living conditions and be able to provide for the future education of her child.

loans.use: to pay for a passport and visa, which will allow her to enter and work in a neighboring country.

loans.name: Santos Evaristo

texts.es:
Santos, solicita un nuevo préstamo, con la intensión de obtener los recursos económicos para poder iniciar la siembra de maíz, ya que inicia los trabajos en la preparación de una manzana de terreno en la cual estará realizando la milpa, por esta situación necesita de un préstamo para comprarse el abono, los herbicidas y otros materiales que son parte importante en su trabajo, pues estos le ayudan a proteger la plantación de las plagas.
Con el préstamo anterior, manifiesta haber tenido una buena experiencia, de la cual pudo mejorar la producción de maíz, reparo la cercas del terreno; en su núcleo familiar, su único problema ha sido la enfermedad de su esposa, pero hoy en día esta recuperada.
texts.en: Santos requests a new loan to have the financial resources necessary for planting corn, as he is beginning the work to prepare a plot of land where he will establish this cornfield.  Because of this situation, he needs a loan to buy the fertilizer, herbicides and other materials that are an important part of his work, as these help him protect the plants from plagues.  He states that he had a good experience with the previous loan, which allowed him to improve his production of corn and repair the fences on the land.  The only problem within his family nucleus has been his wife’s illness, but these days she is recovered.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides and other materials.

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
Lucia tiene 26 años, es una mujer buena y amable. Su pareja, hace 6 años, es William, de 38 años, con quien tiene un hijo de 2 años. Viven en casa de la madre de él, y ahí educan a su hijo, a quien desean dar una mejor calidad de vida.

Su negocio es el alquiler de su auto para taxi, a diario acude un conductor y por dicho alquiler recibe un monto diario que le ayuda a cubrir algunas necesidades en su hogar. Pero para eso su herramienta de trabajo debe estar en óptimas condiciones, desde la limpieza externa hasta la supervisión, verificación y comprobación que todos los sistemas funcionan correctamente. Esta labor lo realiza con ayuda de un técnico automotriz; también se encarga de que toda la documentación de circulación esté vigente para no generar en ningún problema con las autoridades de tránsito. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 2 años, el auto que pone al servicio público pudo comprarlo después de tanto esfuerzo y lucha constante en su anterior negocio que era la venta de comida y venta de ropa.
Le gusta su trabajo porque le permite dedicar su tiempo libre al cuidado de su bebé. Al realizar eventualmente otros trabajos sus ingresos económicos también mejoran, esto le permite mejorar su nivel de vida. Pero no todo le fue siempre tan favorable, ya que al principio fue muy complicado porque no conocía mucho del negocio, pero con el tiempo fue mejorando sus capacidades y ahora se siente tranquila por todo lo que está consiguiendo. Para el futuro espera poder comprarse otro auto, y poco a poco consolidar una empresa grande.

Este es su segundo el crédito con MFP y está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Asimismo, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo anteriormente. Y además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1200) comprará algunos repuestos, llantas y la revisión técnica vehicular que le hace falta a su auto. También actualizará los documentos de circulación, el seguro y refaccionará algunos detalles.
texts.en:
Lucia is 26 years old and a good, friendly woman.  Her partner of the past 6 years is William, 38, with whom she has a 2-year old son.  They live in his mother’s house, where they educate their son; they want to give him a better quality of life.

Her business is the rental of her car as a taxi.  She rents to a driver on a daily basis, from which she receives an amount that helps cover some of the necessities of the home.  However, to do this, her tool for work must be in optimal condition, from the cleaning of the outside of the car, to supervising, verifying, and proving that all the systems are working properly.

She carries out this work with the help of an auto mechanic, and also ensures that all the vehicle registrations are valid so there will be no problems with the transit authorities.  She has been doing this activity for 2 years, and was able to buy the car after a great deal of hard work and constant struggle in her previous business of selling food and clothes.  

She enjoys her work because it allows her to dedicate her free time to caring for her baby.  After doing other work, her income has increased, which allows her to improve her standard of living.  However, everything was not always so favorable; at the beginning, it was very complicated because she didn’t know much about the business but, over time, her ability improved and she now feels calm about everything she is receiving.  In the future, she would like to buy herself another car and, little by little, create a large enterprise.

This is her second loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know she has a means of financial support since this lets her feel more secure in growing her business.  Likewise, she once again commits to making her loan payments on time the way she did before.  She is also very glad to belong to her cooperative bank, as all the members are very responsible and united.  With the amount requested (1200 Peruvian soles), she will buy some replacement parts, tires, and do the mechanical checkup that her car is lacking.  She will also obtain the registration documents, insurance and will refurbish some details.

loans.use: to make repairs and obtain vehicle registrations for her car.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 56 años, es una mujer luchadora, optimista, servicial y muy trabajadora. Se encuentra separada del hombre que fue su pareja por muchos años y con quien tuvo cinco hijos, todos ellos ya son mayores e independientes. Actualmente vive en su casa propia junto a su hija y a su nieta de 8 años llamada Juliana, quien se ha convertido en su motor de vida. 

Su trabajo consiste en la venta diaria de bebidas (gaseosas y cervezas). Vive en una zona en la que el calor extremo juega a su favor, ya que sus clientes acuden a su local para refrescarse y calmar la sed. Acondicionó un pequeño local, en su casa, para realizar esa labor, pero también ofrece, ocasionalmente, en alquiler para eventos especiales como cumpleaños, despedidas de solteros o matrimonios. Los fines de semana, también ofrece el delicioso “ceviche”, esto se convierte en otra oportunidad perfecta para continuar con la venta de sus bebidas, lo cual hace con la ayuda de su hija. Lleva trabajando en esta actividad 28 años y ello le ha permitido brindarles a sus hijos todo lo necesario.
Le esta yendo muy bien, gracias a los buenos clientes que ha logrado consolidar con el paso del tiempo. Al principio le fue complicado porque tenía la dificultad de la inestabilidad del fluido eléctrico y el costo muy elevado de comprar una refrigeradora le impedía tener sus bebidas heladas, afortunadamente pudo solucionarlo y ahora todo marcha bien y sus planes de crecimiento continúan.

Este es su crédito número 5 con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Y además le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece, ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias entre sí.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 2500) comprará bebidas gaseosas, al por mayor, ya que sus clientes le piden productos de marcas específicas y quiere complacerlos totalmente.
texts.en:
Teresa, 56 years old, is an optimistic, helpful, hardworking female fighter.  She is separated from the man who was her partner for many years and with whom she has five children, who are all independent adults.  She currently lives in her own home with her daughter and her 8 year old granddaughter Juliana, who has become her life's motivation.

She works every day selling drinks (sodas and beer).  She lives in an area in which the extreme heat works in her favor, since her customers come to her place to refresh themselves and quench their thirst.  She renovated a small space in her house to do this work.  She also occasionally rents it out for events, such as birthdays, bachelor parties, or weddings.  On the weekends, she also offers delicious ceviche, which is another perfect opportunity to continue selling her drinks, which she does with help from her daughter.  

She has been doing this work for 28 years and it has allowed her to provide her children with everything they needed.  It is going very well, thanks to the good customer base she has made with the passage of time.  At the beginning, it was complicated because she had trouble with the instability of the electricity and the high cost of purchasing a refrigerator for her drinks.  Fortunately she was able to solve these problems and now everything works well and her plans for growth continue. 

This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she is thankful for the opportunity and trust that they put in her.  She promises to make all of her payments punctually.  She is also grateful to be part of her community bank, since she has seen that the members are responsible and supportive people.  

With the loan requested (S/.2500), she will purchase sodas at wholesale since her customers request products from specific brands and she wants to please all of them.

loans.use: to purchase sodas at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando tiene 49 años, es un hombre trabajador, honesto y muy responsable. Su pareja desde hace 22 años es Maximiliana, de 41 años, con quien tiene cuatro hijos, dos de ellos menores de edad; Giovani de 13 años y Alison de 3 años, ellos son su razón de trabajo y sacrificio.

Su trabajo consiste en la venta de abarrotes. Ha establecido una pequeña tienda en su vivienda, la misma que se encuentra en una zona muy concurrida de la ciudad, lo que hace que siempre exista una clientela fluida. Lleva realizando este trabajo desde hace 11 años y desde que se inició siempre ha tenido el pleno apoyo de su pareja. Además de trabajar en su bodega, también se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas y cerveza, y eventualmente se dedica a trabajar en su motocarro. 
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite generar ingresos desde la comodidad de su hogar, además que puede trabajar a lado de su pareja. Los ingresos que a diario recibe por las ventas son alentadores y espera aumentar la variedad de sus productos, ya que le faltan algunos artículos. Para más adelante le gustaría construir un minimarket y ofrecer mayor variedad de e productos a sus clientes.

Este es el crédito número 5 con MFP y está muy contento de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más seguro de avanzar con su trabajo. Asimismo, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo anteriormente. Y además está muy contento de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios entre sí.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1000) comprará productos para su bodega, bebidas, lácteos, arroz, azúcar y etc.
texts.en:
Rolando is 49 years old and a hard working, honest and very responsible man.  His partner of the past 22 years is Maximiliana, 41, with whom he has four children.  Two of them are still minors, Giovani who is 13 years old and Alison, 3.  They are his reason for working and sacrificing.

His business is the sale of groceries.  He has established a small store in his house, which is located in a very busy part of the city.  This helps him to always have a consistent clientele.  He has been doing this work for 11 years and, since he began, he has always had the full support of his partner.  In addition to working in his store, he also dedicates himself to selling soft drinks and beer, and he eventually works with his motorcar.

What he enjoys about his work is that it allows him to generate income from the comfort of his own home, as well as the fact that he can work at the side of his partner.  The daily income he generates is encouraging, and he hopes to augment the variety of products he carries.  Looking ahead, he would like to build a mini-market and offer more products to his customers.

This is his 5th loan with MFP, and he is very happy to know he has financial support since it makes him feel more secure in advancing his business.  Likewise, he commits to once again making his loan payments on time like he has done before.  He is happy to belong to his cooperative bank because all the members are responsible and united.  With the amount requested (1000 Peruvian soles), he will buy products for his store such as beverages, dairy products, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.use: to buy more products to supply his grocery store.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is 39 years old and married with five children, three sons and two daughters. Other than her eldest son, the children are getting their education.  Naseem's husband operates a utensils sales business. He sells different kinds of utensils like steel and plastic, etc. His collection of utensils is very famous among his clients, and due to this he receives regular orders every month.
 
Naseem herself is an ambitious lady. She handles her sewing & embroidery business at her home. She gives due justice to both her household work and to her business. She is a very responsible person and performs her responsibilities with great care. Her family and her clients are very satisfied with her managing qualities. 

She will invest the loan in the buying of an embroidery machine. Earlier, she embroidered dresses by hand, but now in order to receive more orders and finish them on time she requires an embroidery machine. She is very confident that her business will be well established after this loan investment.

loans.use: To buy a new embroidery machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Amour Du Prochain 2 Group

texts.en:
Guy, age 37, is married with 2 children, ages 3 and 5. He also cares for his elderly mother. Guy is representing the Amour du Prochain 2 group. He sells sandals and bags in a local market in Brazzaville. He has had this business for 10 years. He has been able to acquire valuable customers over the years. 

He will use the loan to buy more sandals and bags to sell. His business strategy is to reduce the price for new customers in order to gain their loyalty and favor. Guy has received 4 previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. He has a good repayment record. He wants to eventually own a large sandals boutique. He hopes that as his business grows he will be able to better provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: to pay for sandals and bags.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan, 34 years old, has been a hardworking farmer for almost 16 years. She is married to a man who works in the same type of business. Rice husbandry is the main source of the family’s income, which she uses to satisfy the family’s living needs and cover her household expenses. Despite this, she aims to improve her rice farming business to support her two school-age children. She wants them to earn a degree so that they will be employed someday. 

To ensure high production, Chan is asking for additional capital of KHR 1,300,000 to pay for laborers transplanting her rice and to purchase 10 sacks of fertilizers. She has the strong determination to ensure high production. She hopes that she will have a fruitful harvest this coming season.

loans.use: to pay for laborers transplanting her rice and to purchase 10 sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La Sra. Alicia se inscribirá a un curso de belleza lo cual le ayudara a tener mas ingresos y ayudar a su esposo.  Además de que la Sra. Alicia, se sentirá bien desarrollando un negoció el cual le beneficiara y dice le ayudara a sentirse plena en el desarrollo personal al brindar un servicio de belleza.
Su esposo trabaja como carpintero  para una empresa pero realiza trabajo en su tiempo libre,  la Sra. Alicia trabaja cuidándole  sus hijos a una vecina, la cual  le apoya económicamente para esto. El propósito de la Sra. Alicia es terminar su curso y quedarse en su casa con sus hijos de edad escolar.
texts.en:
Alicia wants to take a beauty course, which will allow her to have more income and to help her husband. In addition, she will also feel good having a business which will benefit her, and says that it will help her feel that she is developing herself personally while providing a beauty service.

Alicia’s husband is a carpenter who works in a company, but he also does work in his spare time. Alicia herself works looking after a neighbor’s children, which gives her financial support. Her goal is to complete the course and stay at home with her school-aged children.

loans.use: To pay the registration fee for a beauty course.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es: LA SEÑORA LETICIA TIENE SU PROPIO NEGOCIO DE ABARROTES AL QUE ELLA TODOS LOS DIAS LE DEDICA TRABAJO Y ESFUERZO PARA MANTENERLO SURTIDO Y ASI OBTENER SUS PROPIOS INGRESOS. LETICIA NECECITA HACER UN LOCAL PEQUEÑO PARA MOVER AHÍ SU NEGOCIO Y AMPLIAR EL LUGAR DE TRABAJO Y SURTIRLA MAS, VE EN EL CREDITO LA POSIBILIDAD DE HACER REALIDAD LO QUE SE PROPONE Y ASI ELLA Y SU ESPOSO QUE ES PENSIONADO OBTENER MAYORES INGRESOS PARA LA FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Leticia has her own grocery business.  She devotes herself to the business every day by working hard and putting forth great effort in order to keep it stocked.  This is how she gets her own income.

Leticia needs to build a small place to move her business in order to expand her working area and stock it more.

In the loan she sees the possibility of making her proposal a reality.  This way she and her husband, who is retired, will get greater income for the family.

loans.use: to build a place for her business.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María, Está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poderlo invertir en la tienda comprándose artículos de primera necesidad que han disminuido hasta el momento, pastas, papel higiénico, productos de aseo personal, arroz,  azúcar, que son necesarios y demandados por los clientes.
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudó para mejorar la variedad de productos y la atención a los clientes, hasta el momento se ha mantenido estable y sus ventas de la misma manera.
texts.en:
María is requesting a new loan to invest it in her activity. She will buy basic necessities such as pastas, toilet paper, personal hygiene products, rice and sugar, as her inventory has decreased and these are products her customers need and request more often.
She says her previous loan has been a great help for her as she has been able to improve the variety of her products and the service she offers to her customers, and at the moment her activity remains stable.

loans.use: To buy pastas, toilet paper, personal hygiene products, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is married with six children, four sons and two daughters. Other than her two youngest, the other children are involved in different work. Her husband is a salesman and in particular he sells electric items called energy savers. This product is very much in demand because it consumes less electricity. He has been in this business for over 12 years and getting good profits. 

Nasreen herself has a sewing business, but she also gives the required time to her household works as well. She does sewing work to supplement the income of the family. She has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will invest the loan in buying energy savers in bulk quantity for reselling. She is very hopeful that her husband’s sales will be improved a lot after this loan investment.

loans.use: To buy electric items (energy savers) for reselling.

loans.name: Zahara

texts.en: Zahara is a hardworking and entrepreneurial woman. She sells mahamri (dumplings) for a living, which she sells from home every day. She has been engaged in this activity for about 2 years. Zahara is married and has four children, and she works hard for them.  She cites the price fluctuation of goods in the market to be her highest challenge. She dreams of establishing a vegetable stall in the future. With the loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Timap Strong Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Timap Strong” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Abubakarr is the leader of this group. She is a forty-two-year-old, and she is married with four children, two of whom are attending secondary school. She sells chairs, foam, pillows, etc. and has been doing this business for ten years now. With the help of this loan, Abubakarr  will invest in her business by buying the above mentioned items in large quantities to add to her current stock of goods.

loans.use: to buy chairs, foam, pillows, etc. in large quantities to add to his current stock of goods.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a hardworking woman who is married and has five children, two of whom are adults and already graduated while the other three still attend school. She has been selling food supplies, specifically coconuts, in the local market. She will use the loan to buy coconuts in order to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts.

loans.name: Prak

texts.en:
Prak is 65 years old, widowed, and a mother of four children, residing in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a local rice cultivator. She has been involved in this business for a long time. Aside from this, Prak is skillful in making bamboo baskets that most housewives usually buy and use in the kitchen. 

With the amount she has requested, she would like to renovate her house. She will purchase building materials needed for the construction and pay for the laborers performing this construction. She hopes to have a comfortable house soon. And she is very thankful for your full support.

loans.use: to purchase building materials needed for the construction and to pay for the laborers performing this construction.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a hardworking and enterprising woman. For five years she has been working selling mahamri (dumplings) and flat bread in Likoni, Kenya. She will invest the loan to purchase wheat flour, cooking fat oil and coconuts for use in cooking dumplings.

She is married and has two children for whom she works very hard with her husband. Her goal is to have a large business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking fat oil and coconuts

loans.name: Tamaraneh Group

texts.en: Aminata is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Aminata was born in Bombali district, in northern Sierra Leone forty-five years ago. She is married to a motor mechanic and the couple has four children, two of whom are attending primary and secondary schools. For many years now, Aminata has been selling palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), salt, onions, fish, etc. This is the first loan that Aminata and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Aminata will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business. She will buy the above mentioned food stuff in bulk to add to her current supply.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, salt, onions, fish, etc. in bulk to add to her current supply.

loans.name: Vilma Esperanza

texts.es:
Vilma, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para poderlo invertir en el negocio del cual depende toda su familia, en su venta de lotería, ella para cada semana necesita invertir en la compra de billetes el cual este préstamo le servirá para tener la disponibilidad económica y continuar ofreciendo a los clientes el juego de la lotería.
Ella se ha mantenido en el negocio y considera que es a través de los préstamos, porque muchas veces no tiene el recurso económico para realizar las compras de los billetes, teniendo una mayor oportunidad de venta y de poder recibir ingresos.
texts.en:
Vilma is requesting a new loan to invest it the activity all of her family depends upon, that is her selling lottery tickets. She needs to invest weekly in the purchase of tickets, and this loan will help her in owning the money she needs to continue offering lottery tickets to her customers.
As most of the time she hasn’t got enough money to buy the tickets, she thinks she has been able to keep her activity stable through the loans, as they have given her a greater opportunity to sell tickets and to consequently earn money.

loans.use: To buy lottery tickets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a masters level course in food processing to expand his knowledge as a teacher

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair a wall in her house.

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para poder iniciar la siembra del nuevo cultivo de la temporada de invierno, realizándolo en dos manzanas de terreno, para lo cual deberá incurrir en el gasto de insumos como el abono, los herbicidas y también el pago de alquiler de la tierra.
Con el préstamo anterior él manifiesta haber mejorado la producción de maíz, ya que se le brindó lo necesario en recurso económico para que él adquiriera los materiales que le fueran útiles, para obtener una mejor cosecha, esto le ha ayudado también a mantener el alimento necesario para su familia.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan to start planting his new crop in the winter season. He will sow two “manzanas” (approx. 3.36 acres*), and he will need to buy supplies such as manure and weed-killers as well as to pay rent for his land.
He says that he has succeeded in improving his corn production thanks to the previous loan, as he received the economic resources he needed to buy the most useful supplies for his activity in order to obtain a better harvest; this in turn has helped him in keeping on providing for his family.

<cite>*(one manzana = 1.68 acres)</cite>

loans.use: To buy manure and weed-killers as well as to pay rent for his land.

loans.name: Dalila Sarai

texts.es:
Dalila, solicita un préstamo, pues necesita comprarse los materiales para el negocio, como lo es la compra de maíz, leña y gas, que son los indispensables para el funcionamiento del negocio, este préstamo será una gran ayuda para continuar vendiendo.
Ella manifiesta que el préstamo anterior, le ayudo a mejorar el inventario y de esa compra se ha logrado mantener en este tiempo, realizando una buena labor para poder proveer a su familia lo necesario.
texts.en:
Dalila is asking for a loan because she needs to buy supplies for her business, such as dried corn, firewood, and gas, which are indispensable for the operation of her business.  This loan will be of great help so that she can continue to sell.

She says that her previous loan helped increase her inventory and she has been able to maintain this type of business, as well as maintain a good income, and provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy dried corn, firewood and gas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for expenses related to obtaining her degree.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes,pollos y chanchos,la socia los hace crecer y engordar y leugo los vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en el cusco,la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta als 5:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de crianza de animales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar alimentos y animales como chanchos,cuyes y pollos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Leonor keeps on engaging in breeding animals such as “cuyes” (“cuy” is Quechua for Guinea pig), chickens and pigs. She raises and fattens them to then sell them in the different fairs of the Cusco area. She works from 9 am to 5 pm and thanks to this activity she can provide for her children. She wants to expand and improve her animal breeding activity, and she is requesting a loan to buy animal feed and animals such as pigs, cuyes and chickens.

Leonor is happy about the loan and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and animals such as pigs, cuyes and chickens.

loans.name: Dalil

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 57 years old, married and has one child. Dalil has owned a shop since 2000 selling electrical supplies and construction materials. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

Dalil is requesting $2500 to pay the annual rent for his shop and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy another buffalo for a dairy business

loans.name: Maria Ayde

texts.es: Maria Haydee de 29 años de edad, trabaja como docente, recibe la ayuda del padre de su hijo para los gastos familiares, según referencias ella es una docente muy responsable, honesta y muy trabajadora.   Solicita el credito, para invertirlo en compra de zinc para cambiarle el techo  a su habitación, su mayor sueño en la vida es que su preciosa familia goze de dalud, que no les falte lo basico en el hogar y poco ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y de su familia
texts.en:
Maria Haydee is 29 years old and works as a teacher.  She receives assistance from the father of her child in order to cover the family expenses.  According to her references, Maria Haydee is very responsible, honest, and hardworking.  

She is requesting her loan to invest in the purchase of zinc sheets for replacing the roof of her home.  Her greatest dream in life is for her previous family to enjoy good health and not lack any basic necessities in their home.  She also wants to gradually improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for replacing the roof of her house.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Doña Luz Marina se desempeña como docente de primaria desde hace 28 años donde ha demostrado gran responsabilidad y honestidad, ella además de su salario recibe la ayuda económica de su hijo mayor quien tiene un taller de mecanica y le ayuda con los gastos de la casa.   Doña Luz solicita su 9no crédito para poder terminar la construccion de un cuarto en su casa, pues con el credito anterior solo logro hacer una parte, y ahora quiere poner el piso y repellar el cuarto para asi brindar mayor comodidad a su familia,   su sueño en la vida en la vida gozar de mejores condiones en el hogar, que sus hijos tengan un trabajo digno y gozar de salud.
texts.en: Luz Marina has been working as an elementary school teacher for 28 years.  She has demonstrated great responsibility and honesty in her work.  In addition to her salary, she receives financial help from her eldest son who has an auto repair shop and helps with the household expenses.  Luz is requesting her ninth loan so that she can finish building a room in her house.  She only managed to build part of the room with her previous loan and now she would like to lay flooring and plaster the walls so that she can make her family more comfortable.  Her life's dreams are to enjoy better living conditions in her home and for her children to have decent jobs and enjoy good health.

loans.use: to finish building a room in her house

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 44 years old, married and blessed with four children that he supports. He has run a boutique shop for the last 12 years making a monthly income of 100,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). He has applied for a loan of 100,000 KES from KADET which he plans to use to restock his boutique shop with more clothing materials and some ready-made clothes and shoes for resale. The anticipated profits will be reinvested to support his business operations. His future dream is to develop residential houses.

loans.use: to purchase clothing materials and ready-made clothes for sale

loans.name: Donald

texts.es: Donald, tiene la edad  de 19 años, está soltero,  vive con sus padres   actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar herramientas e insumos como abonos y fumigaciones  y ayudarse con la mano de obra. El tiene pensado comprar  herramientas como cuchillos, palas, pelines, para asistir mejor el cultivo de café y con los insumos mantenerlo en buenas condiciones y  poder generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Donald is 19 years old, single, and currently lives with his parents. With this loan, he aims to buy tools and materials like fertilizers and fumigants and to help pay for laborers. He is thinking about buying tools like knives, spades, and shovels to help improve his coffee crops. With these materials he can keep his crops in good condition, be able to generate more income, and achieve a better quality of life and economic stability. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had any previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with greater ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy tools and materials and to pay for labor

loans.name: Omar

texts.es: Omar, tiene la edad  de 39 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar una sierra pequeña para asistir la finca y ayudarse con la mano de obra. El tiene pensado comprar esta máquina para  derramar los arboles que se encuentran en el cafetal y además  la va a utilizar para apodar el café grande  para que se mantenga en excelentes condiciones y hacerlo de una forma más ágil y rápida  y  poder generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Omar is 39 years old, married, and currently lives with his wife. With this loan he will buy a saw to assist the workers on his coffee farm. He has been planning to buy a machine like this to prune the existing trees on his farm, and he also intends to use it to cut back the larger coffee trees to keep them in excellent condition, doing so more easily and quickly. This will generate more earnings and result in  a better quality of life and economic stability.

This is Omar's 1st loan through FUDECOSUR. He has never had any other loans from state banks. FUDECOSUR is offering the loan on the best possible terms with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy a special saw for pruning both shade and coffee trees on his farm.

loans.name: Maura Del Carmen's Group

texts.es: La Sra. Maura  tiene 43 años de edad su actividad económica es una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, ella tiene catorce meses de tener el negocio propio, la experiencia la adquirió de su familia la cual tenía una distribuidora desde hace 17 años, ella se inicia en el negocio propio para obtener mejores ingresos para el bienestar de su familia. Sus sueños y metas es invertir capital de trabajo como la compra de: granos basicos, arroz, frijoles, azucar, aceite, jabon, detergente, huevos,entre otros. para ver  crecer su negocio día a día hasta convertirlo en una distribuidora, en la actualidad ha ido creciendo gracias al apoyo que fundación león 2000 le ha brindado.
texts.en: Maura is forty-three years old. She runs a small business located in her home. She has had her own business for the past fourteen months. She gained experience through her family, which has had a distribution company for the past seventeen years. She started her own business in order to attain a better income for the well-being of her family. Her dreams and goals are to invest work capital in order to buy basic grains, rice, beans, sugar oil, soap, detergent, egg, etc. in order to see day to day growth in her business to the point that it is converted into a distributing business. Her business has been growing recently, thanks to the support that Fundación León 2000 has provided her.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, rice, beans, sugar oil, soap, detergent, egg, etc.

loans.name: Edith Roxana

texts.es:
La señora Edith tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y tiene cinco hijos. Ella posee un comedor a la orilla de la laguna en donde vende desde pescado hasta carne asada. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, también se dedica a la panadería, saliendo a vender todos los días la mercadería horneada en la mañana. Ella compra el pescado a los pescadores de la zona y la otra parte de la mercadería la compra en una ciudad del oriente del país. 

Edith ya es cliente KIVA, hoy en día esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo para comprar 12 mesas y 48 sillas cada una de madera, que será para equipar el comedor, ya que por el momento no tiene para que los clientes coman ahí, sino solo para llevar. De esta manera la señora podrá servir comida en el lugar, teniendo la ventaja de que el comedor esta ubicado a la orilla de la laguna y con gran cantidad de sombra, para los clientes que prefieran comer en su comedor y no llevar la comida. Ella comenta que se le presentara una gran oportunidad con el préstamo ya que hay personas que compran la comida para degustarla ahí mismo y les toca comer en unas rocas que están en el patio del comedor, por falta de mesas y sillas. 

A ella le gustaría construir una galera, para protegerse de la lluvia y para mayor comodidad de sus clientes en época lluviosa.
texts.en:
Edith is 27 years old, married, and has five children. She has an eatery at the edge of the lake where she sells food from fish to grilled meat. She has always done business and also sells bread going out every day with the baked goods in the morning. She buys fish from the local fishermen and the other part of her inventory is bought in a city from the eastern part of the country.

Edith is an existing KIVA client. Today, she requests a new loan to buy 12 wooden tables and 48 wooden chairs that will be used to equip her cafe. Currently, she cannot offer a place for her clients to eat there, but only for takeaway. With the dining area, she will be able to serve food there with the advantage that it's located at the edge of the lake. It provides enough shade for her clients who prefer eating there instead of takeaway. The loan will provide her with a great opportunity since there are people that buy the food to eat there and they have to sit on some nearby rocks due to the lack of tables and chairs.

She would like to build a covered porch to protect herself from the rain and for the added commodity of her clients in the rainy season.

loans.use: to buy 12 tables and 48 chairs made out of wood.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: La Sra. Reina de 50 años edad tiene como actividad económica la venta de ropa usada y mercadería en general,  Reina ha tenido créditos anteriores con fundación león 2000 lo cual ha demostrado ser una persona responsable, trabajadora y con solvencia de pago, en esta ocasión ella está solicitando el financiamiento para la construcción de una recamara en sus casa de habitación desde hace un año ella tiene el deseo de construir dicha recamara la cual no había podido debido a las limitantes  económicas, en la actualidad ella ha mejorado su nivel de vida gracias al apoyo que fundación le ha brindado, con el crédito ella comprara  material de construcción como :  cemento, hierro, cal, zinc, arena, clavos entre otros.
texts.en:
Reina, 50, sells used clothing and general merchandise.  Reina has had previous loans with Fundación León 2000, which has shown her to be a hardworking and responsible person who is reliable with her payments.

This time she is requesting the loan for the construction of a bedroom in her home.  For a year she has wanted to build this bedroom, which she had not been able to do because of economic limitations.  Currently she has improved her living conditions thanks to support from the foundation.

With the loan she will buy construction materials such as cement, rebar, lime, corrugated metal roofing, sand, nails, and others.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, rebar, lime, corrugated metal roofing, sand, nails, and others.

loans.name: El Tule Sur Group

texts.es: EL  Banco  El Tule Sur, está conformado por 8 integrantes que son mujeres emprendedores que cada uno tiene una actividad económica diferente pero formaron este grupo , ya que se conocen y son responsable, y además que son las misma localidad. María Magdalena su negocio es básicamente la venta de dulce tradicionales que es muy buscado por su clientela. María Magdalena está solicitando crédito para poder invertir en el negocio para las compras de los diferentes dulces como: cajetas, leche burras,bollo de coco, bollo dulce,cajeta de leche ,leche burras entre otros : y poder ofrecerles a sus clientes variedad de sabores.
texts.en: Banco El Tule Sur is composed of 8 members, all resourceful women each engaging in a different activity; they have formed this group because they know each other and they come from the same community on top of being all responsible people. María Magdalena sells traditional sweets, greatly requested by her customers.
