María Magdalena is requesting a loan to invest it in her activity by buying different sweets such as “cajetas” (a sweet gelatin), “leche burras” (toffees made from milk), “bollo de coco” (corn wrap with coconut, sugar and anise, “bollo dulce” (corn wrap with anise) and caramels made with milk, in order to offer sweets in different flavors to her customers.

loans.use: To buy different traditional sweets to sell them to her customers.

loans.name: Mujeres De Fortaleza Group

texts.es: Mujeres de Fortaleza  esta conformado por ocho integrantes que son: Dinora, Petrona,Rosa, Nubia, Meydin, Juana, Mirna, Ivania todas tienen actividades económicas diferentes  pero se apoyan mutuamente para salir adelantes con sus familias, las cuales ha demostrado ser responsable, trabajadoras, con solvencia moral, Dinora es la coordinadora de grupo  ella se dedica a  la crianza y venta de cerdos los cuales los ofrece al  los habitantes de su localidad para las diferentes usos en la comida como nacatamales, frito, churrascos, chicarrones entre otros.
texts.en: Mujeres de Fortaleza (Women of Fortitude) is a group composed of eight members: Dinora, Petrona, Rosa, Nubia, Meydin, Juana, Mirna and Ivania. They all engage in different economic activity, but they help each other to provide for their families. All of the members have proven to be responsible, hard-working and trustworthy people. Dinora is the group coordinator. She engages in breeding pigs: she then sells them to customers in her community, who use them to prepare various dish, such as “nactamales” (a typical dish made of corn and pork), fried pork, “churrascos” (grilled pork) and “chicharrones” (pork cracklings) among other dishes.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a young client aged 21 years old and newly married.

Salam has owned a food market since 2010 selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken and fishes and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a good understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $1200 as a youth loan to buy a small generator and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a small generator and to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Naada

texts.en:
Naada is thirty four years old and married with four children. She runs a general shop and has been in this business for seven years earning a monthly income of nine thousand, four hundred and eight shillings.


This will be the first loan with KADET, and she plans to use the money to purchase sugar, rice and other goods. She plans to use the profit to purchase more stock for resale. 


She hopes to have a better life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice and other goods for her business

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахноза с малых лет мечтала работать в салоне красоты и открыть бизнес. Закончив среднюю школу она пошла учиться в г. Ташкент. Освоив профессию она арендовала здание для бизнеса,  столкнулась с большой конкуренцией, капитал был небольшим не позволял расширить деятельность по этим направлениям. Узнав он проведении курсов в ООО МЗО «Имон Интернешнл» «Женщина предприниматель- добейся успеха» она приняла активное участие и обучилась основам  бизнеса. Братья находятся в Российской Федерации не могут пока помочь ей материально, ее родители пенсионеры. Она очень хотела заняться предоставлением услуг парикмахера, и данный момент намерена открыть свой салон красоты. Она очень трудолюбивая, целеустремленная и отзывчивая девушка, очень надеется на то чтоб её мечта осуществилась. Шахноза хотела бы получить займ для покупки необходимые оборудования и инвентарь для салона красоты, а также оплатить  за аренду  помещения. Она надеется на поддержку с вашей стороны.
texts.en: Shahnoza dreamed of working in a beauty salon and opening her own business from a young age. After finishing high school she left to study in Tashkent. After finishing her degree she rented a place for her business. She faced a lot of competition and her limited capital did not allow her to expand her activities. After finding out about courses at IMON International, LLC called Women Entrepreneurs - Attaining Success she became an active participant and learned business fundamentals. Her brothers are in Russia and so far cannot help her financially, and her parents are retired. She very much wants to offer hairstyling services, and is determined to open her own beauty salon. She is a very hardworking, determined, and responsible girl, and really wants to see her dream come to fruition. Shahnoza is seeking a loan to purchase needed equipment and stock for the beauty salon, and also to pay rent for the facility. She hopes for support from your end.

loans.use: To purchase necessary equipment and inventory for her beauty salon as well as pay the rent for the beauty salon.

loans.name: Panai

texts.en:
Panai is 32 years old, married and supports a family of five. He is a wheat farmer and has been farming for the last eight years, earning a monthly income of 7,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

He has applied for his fourth loan of KES 50,000 from KADET, which he intends to use to purchase hybrid wheat seeds and fertilizers and also get farm labor for plowing. The anticipated profits will support his activities after planting. 

His future plans are to expand his farm and get into large-scale farming.

loans.use: To purchase wheat seeds for planting and fertilizers.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret operates a retail shop and thanks to this work she has been able to get ahead and help her family. Thanks to the loan she got from Kiva she’s been able to grow her retail shop and invest in her transport business. 

She is calling on Kiva and Yehu Microfinance once more to ask for support to buy repairs for her motorcycle.
Margaret is grateful for this opportunity she’s receiving once again.

loans.use: To purchase repairs for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita, 46, is a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ponciano, a carpenter, and is a mother to her child. They together manage their household expenses while operating their respective businesses. She works hard to continuously provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mercedita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy a sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her neighbors and the local community are her regular customers. She also maintains a direct selling business as a source of additional income. She earns a minimum of PHP 450 in sales every day.

To help continue her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will utilize the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Mercedita hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to have her own car service that will be used for the business. She also dreams that her business will become big someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products for her business.

loans.name: Filipina

texts.en:
Filipina is 44 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Filipina has been raising pigs for 9 years and also earns additional income from her sari-sari store and by retailing meat.

She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business, which involves agriculture. Nasreen's husband is a farmer and grows different seasonal vegetables. He has received this skill from his father.   
He grows vegetables and then sells them to required customers for profits. His profession requires much struggle but in the end he receives good profits. 
Nasreen herself belongs to a sewing and embroidery business, but she also gives time to her family and to her household works. She has five children: three daughters and two sons. All of her children are getting their education. 
With the loan investment, her husband will purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides which will help him grow his business and increase his profits. 
Nasreen is hopeful that her husband’s business will be improved a lot after this loan investment.

loans.use: To buy seeds, pesticides and fertilizer for her agriculture business.

loans.name: Houssam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 24 years, single, and lives with eight family members, three of whom work.

Houssam has owned a cafeteria since 2011, offering hot drinks, juices, and sandwiches. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is becoming well-known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting an $1800 loan in order to pay the annual rent for the cafeteria. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent

loans.name: Nueva Realidad Group

texts.es: Angelica tiene 29 años de edad, está casada con Juan Carlos y tienen dos hijos el cual uno de los niños estudia el preescolar. Platica que tenía una tienda de abarrotes en su localidad desde hace 6 años pero debido a que mucha gente le quedo a deber tuvo que cerrarla por que ya no tuvo ganancias para volver a surtir su tiendita de abarrotes. Actualmente dedica a vender cenas por la tarde noche (antojitos mexicanos) como tacos dorados, enchiladas, pambazos, tortas, piezas de pollo doradas agua frescas y refrescos. Dice que con ese negocio tiene 3 años y que ahorita nada mas esta trabajando en la venta de la cena mientras ahorra para surtir su tienda de abarrotes.  Doña Angelica está pidiendo su préstamo a la financiera para la compra de insumos para hacer los antojitos como verdura de diferentes variedades como jitomate, lechuga, cebolla, chiles en  vinagre, chiles verdes, chile guajillo, refrescos, frutas de temporada para hacer aguas frescas, pollo destazado para dorar, aceite, gas, carbón etc. Angelica dice que el préstamo le beneficiara ya que tendrá una fuente de empleo para poder darles a sus pequeños hijos una mejor calidad de vida, su sueño es ver crecer a sus hijos y que tengan una buena educación y un buen empleo ya que en esta época como dice ella es muy difícil tener un empleo estable y donde te paguen bien, también ella quisiera volver abrir su tiendita de abarrotes ya que esa ganancia que sacaba de ahí le ayudaba a pagar el crédito.los otros cinco integrantes se llaman Liliana, Lidia, Francisco, Maria Raquel y Alicia ellos invertiran en insumos para elaborar pan, zapatos para vender, comprara colchas, sabanas, toallas para su venta, comprara perfumes para su venta, y se comprara insumos para hacer antojitos mexicanos para vender.
texts.en:
Angélica, 29, is married to Juan Carlos and they have two children one of which is attending pre-school.   She relates that she used to have a grocery store in her locality six years ago but had to close it because many people failed to pay her and she earned no profits to restock her little grocery store.

She currently sells dinner at night (Mexican fast-food snacks) like crispy, fried tacos, enchiladas, ‘pambazos’ [type of sandwich], sandwiches, fried chicken pieces, fresh fruit drinks and soft-drinks.  She says that she’s been in business three years and that now she’s only working selling food while she saves up enough to restock her grocery store.

Angélica is asking the credit firm for this loan to buy ingredients to make the fast-food snacks like tomatoes, lettuce, onions, chilies in vinegar, green chilies, Guajillo chilies, soft-drinks, seasonal fruit to make the fresh fruit drinks, chicken in pieces to fry, oil, gas, charcoal, etc.  Angélica says that this loan will be of benefit to her because she’ll have a source of employment in order to give her little children a better quality of life.  Her dream is to see her children grow up with a good education and good jobs because in these times, like she says, it’s very difficult to have steady employment where salaries are good.  She’d also like to reopen her little grocery store because the profits she made there helped her repay the loan.

The five other members of the group are called Liliana, Lidia, Francisco, Maria Raquel and Alicia.  They will invest in ingredients to bake bread, shoes to sell, bedspreads, sheets and towels to sell, perfume to sell and ingredients to make Mexican fast-food snacks to sell.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El Sr. Mario tiene 60 años y es casado con 5 hijos que son todos mayores de 20 años, el se dedica a la construcción de viviendas es  maestro contratista, el vive en la zona de Llojeta,  este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Mario va a usar este préstamo para compra de material de construcción ya que él quiere construir su propia vivienda,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital ya que el quiere darles a sus hijos un poco mas de comodidad, el Sr. Mario enfrenta retos en su negocio que son los contratos se deben acabar en un determinado tiempo pero muchas veces no se logra alcanzar, pero el hace lo posible para cumplir sus contratos, su deseo es seguir ampliando su domicilio, realizando departamentos.
texts.en: Mario is 60 years old and is married with 5 children; all of his children are over 20 years old.  He makes a living in housing construction, and works as a general contractor.  He lives in the Llojeta district of La Paz.  This is Mario’s third loan cycle with Emprender.  He is going to use the loan to purchase construction materials, since he wants to build his own home.  He has asked for this loan because he doesn’t have the capital he needs and he wants to provide his children with a little more comfort.  The main challenge Mario faces in his work is that contracts have to be completed in a set period of time, but oftentimes this cannot be achieved; however, Mario does his best to fulfill his contracts.  Mario’s wish is to continue enlarging his home and to build apartments.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for building his home.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
This is Evangeline. She previously availed a PHP 19,000 loan to purchase a greater quantity and variety of school supplies and merchandise needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children's education and to meet their personal, household and business expenses. 

She would like to apply for a PHP 21,000 loan to buy additional stocks of school supplies and merchandise. The more items displayed at the store the better as more items to sell will result in better profits. The business profits will help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. 

Evangeline dreams of giving her children a good and high quality education by working hard at her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional school supplies and other merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Элмире 42 года, вдова, воспитывает 3 детей. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Элмира занимается разведением скота. Начав этот бизнес 25 лет назад с суммы 10,000 сом, благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний  день  Элмира имеет в хозяйстве 7 коз и 1 лошадь,  перепродажа скота приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 3,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Элмира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку овец с целью откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Элмира планирует вложить в увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Elmira is 42 years old. She is a widow and is raising three children. Elmira provides her family's sole source of income by breeding livestock. She started the business 25 years ago with 10,000 som in initial capital. Thanks to her tireless work, she now has seven goats and one horse, and livestock sales bring in a monthly profit of 3,000 som. In order to further develop her business, Elmira came to Bai Tushum and Partners for a 50,000 som (KGS) loan to purchase sheep which she plans to fatten and resell. She plans to invest proceeds from the loan into expanding her herd.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 33 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. Glenda runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell.

She has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF previously. She has been running the charcoal retail business for three years and also earns extra income from retailing rice.

Glenda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: C 7995 Abumvikanye Group

texts.en:
Isaac is 33 years old and is married with four children, aged between 3 and 10 years. He sells rice. Issac is a leader of this group, which is called "C 7995 ABUMVIKANYE" in the local language. In the photo, he's the one who raises up his hand. He has been in this business for 15 years and he works from 6 a.m. to 1 p.m. daily, except on the weekends. Isaac currently employs eleven people to help him. 

Isaac has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to cultivate large quantities of rice for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future, to pay school fees for his children, and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to cultivate large quantities of rice for resale

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 59 years old and married with seven children. With one child in school, she works hard to provide for them. Letecia runs a general store in the Philippines and is requesting a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks for her general store.

She has been in this business for 17 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soap, egg, spices, etc. 

In the future Letecia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stock for her general store.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 39 years of age and supports a family of five people, comprising of his wife, Nelly, and their three kids aged between five and ten years. He has been in the dairy farming business for five years and earns Ksh 8,000 per month.

He is servicing his sixth loan of Ksh 45,000 with KADET LTD after successfully completing his previous loans. He is to use the loan to purchase a dairy cow for milk production. With the anticipated profits he is going to use some of it for loan repayment and the remaining amount to pay school fees for his children. 

Joseph hopes to expand his dairy farming business on a large-scale basis.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and resale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a divorced woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She runs a water selling business from home. She has retained her business because she has gained a lot of skills in business management through the trainings conducted by Yehu Microfinance Trust Kenya.

She desires to expand her business for more income generation in the future. She needs 30,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase new water pipes, a water meter, and pay for labor charges.

loans.use: to purchase new water pipes, a water meter, and pay for labor charges

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 25 years old, married, and has two children aged three years and six months. She owns a milk bar stall in Kingstone, a business she has had for the last two years.

She has applied for a loan from KADET and with this loan she hopes to expand her trade and be able to sell more litres of milk. This will boost her income and help her support her family.

With any additional income, Lucy hopes to educate her children and give them a better life.

loans.use: to buy milk in larger volumes for resale

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino es un hombre de 50 años, vive en la ciudad de Camaná con su esposa y sus 3 hijos, él es una persona muy trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos para sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos no pudo cursar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado poder estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Mecánica; en sus ratos libre le gusta realizar pequeños viajes por su ciudad con su familia y en alguna de estas ocasiones aprovechan para comer un riquísimo “Saltado de Carne” el cual es el plato favorito de su familia.
Gracias al apoyo de su familia y a su deseo de salir adelante, Marcelino trabaja como chofer de un microbús, brindando serivios de movilidad local, él labora un aproximado de 12 horas diarias, en las cuales puede atender un promedio de 80 clientes, él se siente a gusto en su trabajo ya que sus clientes lo recomiendan por su trato amable y respetuoso. 
Marcelino se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de llantas y el mantenimiento general para su vehículo; de esta manera Marcelino tendrá un vehículo en buenas condiciones, él cual le servirá para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes e incrementar sus ingresos económicos y así poder asegurar y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Marcelino, 50, lives in the city of Camaná with his wife and three children. He is hardworking and enthusiastic, putting all of his efforts towards making progress for his family. Unfortunately, for lack of financial resources and the need to work to cover his needs, he wasn't able to go to college, but he would have liked to study mechanical engineering. In his free time he likes to take trips around the city with his family, and sometimes they will stop to eat saltado de carne, their favorite meal. 

Thanks to the support of his family and his desire to get ahead, Marcelino works as a mini-bus driver, working about 12 hours a day in local transport. He tends to an average of 80 customers during that time. He likes his work because his customers recommend him for the friendly and respectful manner in which he treats them.

Marcelino is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he will be able to buy tires and perform maintenance on his vehicle. That way he will keep it in good condition so that he can give his customers better service and increase his income, thereby improving his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tires and pay for regular maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Louela

texts.en:
Louela is 38 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. Louela runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and is requesting a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase charcoal to sell.

She has borrowed and paid back 11 loans from NWTF previously. She has been running the charcoal retail business for 10 years and also earns extra income from food vending.

Louela aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.en:
This is Maria Victoria. She previously availed a PHP 9,000 to purchase merchandise items and products for her business. The earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a PHP 13,000 loan to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better as more items to sell will result in better profits. The business profits will definitely help to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. 

Maria Victoria dreams to become financially free someday as she expands her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise and products for her business.

loans.name: Pacifique

texts.en: Pacifique is 32 years old. She has two children aged one and four years. She has been selling beans and potatoes for four years. With the loan, she plans to buy more beans, and add rice, soaps, and sugar to the business. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more beans, rice, and soaps for sale

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a 62-year-old businessman, married to Mary, who is a farmer and they are blessed with five children. He has been running a green grocer business in an open air market for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES 17,000 which he uses to support his family.  

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Edward will use the loan to purchase more stock of onions, green vegetables, and fruits for his business. With the anticipated profits from the business, he will educate his children. 

He hopes to own a petrol station along Nairobi highway and build rental houses in his piece of land.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of onions, green vegetable, and fruits for his business.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en: Jeanette is 55 years old. She is a mother of three children, aged between fifteen and thirty. The youngest is still in school. With the loan, she will buy more beans, bananas, sugar, and rice for selling. With the profits from the business, she will renovate the house, which is old and needs renovation.

loans.use: to buy more beans, bananas, sugar, and rice for selling

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter tiene 25 años, es un joven emprendedor, honesto y muy trabajador. Es soltero y aún no tiene hijos porque espera consolidarse económicamente para formar su propia familia. Actualmente vive en casa de su abuela, junto a sus padres y hermanos, es a ellos a quienes dedica todo su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante para que se sientan orgullosos de él.

Él es conductor de motocarro, su trabajo consiste en trasladar pasajeros a manera de taxi. Todas las personas que solicitan su servicio terminan muy contentos y agradecidos por el trato amable que ofrece y porque cobra el precio justo. Lleva en esta actividad poco más de un año, trabaja solo y a diario renueva sus energías para trabajar con mucho optimismo y siempre dando lo mejor de sí. Así también, de manera eventual, comparte su pasión por la música con su hermano mayor, siendo parte de una orquesta musical que trabaja los fines de semana, si consiguieron algún contrato.
Por lo pronto, le gusta mucho ambas actividades, aunque asegura que al principio le fue difícil trabajar como mototaxista porque tenía que enfrentar los comentarios negativos de las personas, y porque no conocía la ciudad completamente. Ahora lo hace de manera óptima y sus ingresos se han incrementado. Para el futuro, espera comprarse otro motocarro; y formar su propia orquesta también es uno de sus ideales.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen lo posible, para continuar con sus objetivos, Está muy comprometido a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, y está muy contento de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 600) comprará algunos repuestos y accesorios que necesita para refaccionar su motocarro.
texts.en:
Walter is a 25 years old honest and hardworking entrepreneur. He is single, and although he has no children, he hopes to develop an economic base for a future family. Actually, he lives in his grandmother’s house, along with his parents and siblings. He is using all of his effort to succeed and move forward so that his family is proud of him.
He is a motorcycle taxi driver. He gives passengers rides similar to a taxi driver. Everyone that uses his services are very happy and grateful for the friendly treatment he provides and also for the fair prices that he charges. He has been doing this activity for the past year. He works on his own. He greets each day with energy, optimism and a positive outlook. Also, he shares his older brother’s passion for music. He is part of a band that works on the weekends when they have engagements. He likes both activities a lot. At first it was difficult working with the motor taxi as he had to respond to negative comments from customers and he didn’t know the city streets well. Now he knows his work well and his investments are increasing. In the future he would like to buy a car taxi and also form his own band. These are some of his goals.
This is his first loan with MFP. He is thankful to the people that made it possible for him to continue with his objectives. He promises to pay his payments on time and he is very happy to be a member of this community bank. All of the members are good, friendly and united.
With the money that he is requesting (600 soles) he will buy the parts and accessories needed to fix his motorcycle taxi.

loans.use: to buy the parts and accessories needed to fix his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to make a wall around his house.

loans.name: Pasencia

texts.en:
This is Pacencia. She previously availed a PHP 15,000 loan to purchase a greater quantity and variety of grocery items and products for her business. The earnings were a big help for her children's education and to meet their personal, household and business expenses. 

She would like to apply for a PHP 13,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. The business profits will definitely help her to sustain daily needs and educational expenses of her children. 

Pacensia hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a 39-year-old business lady, married to Samuel who is also a businessman, and they are blessed with three children aged 18, 10 and 5 years respectively. She has been running a butchery for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan term with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Pauline will use the loan to purchase a bull for slaughtering. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. 

She hopes to open a hotel business which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To purchase a bull for slaughtering.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is 53 years old, married to Eunice, and together they have two children. He operates a spare parts shop and has been in the business for the past 10 years.

This is his first term loan with KADET after he was introduced by a field officers. He will use the loan amount to purchase stock of spare parts for his shop.

He hopes to purchase a transportation vehicle to aid in his business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of spare parts

loans.name: Domitila Del Carmen

texts.es:
Domitila, administra una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, vive con sus dos abuelos, la casa es propia, es madre de tres jóvenes quienes no viven con ella, el negocio es una tienda en la cual ofrece toda clase de productos que sean necesarias en el hogar lo realiza con ayuda de un sobrino.
Solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de productos como lo son el aceite, las pastas, arroz, frijoles, maíz, gaseosas, entre otros productos que le permite mantener un inventario surtido.
El objetivo de ella es que a través de este préstamo puede establecer un negocio con mayor capacidad para atender las necesidades de la clientela ya que esto le permitirá también mantener su preferencia.
texts.en:
Domitila runs a store selling staple products.  She lives with her grandparents in her own home and is the mother of three young people who do not live with her.  The business is a store which offers all kinds of products needed in the home, which she operates with the help of her nephew.  

She is requesting the loan to buy products like oil, pasta, rice, beans, corn, and sodas among other products that allow her to maintain a well-stocked inventory.  Her goal is to use this loan to establish her business with greater ability to supply her customers’ needs so that they will continue to buy from her.

loans.use: to buy products like oil, pasta, and rice.

loans.name: Leslie

texts.es:
Leslie tiene 26 años, es una mujer amable, buena y trabajadora. Es madre de dos hijos, de 8 y 4 años, a quienes tiene a su cargo, ya que su ex pareja los abandonó. Es una tarea muy ardua, pero todo lo que realiza lo hace por amor a ello y pensando en brindarles lo mejor.

Su trabajo es la venta de los cuadros que elaboran los reclusos en rehabilitación que están internados en el centro penitenciario de la ciudad. De manera programada se dirige al penal para adquirir los cuadros que luego pone a la venta. Su sistema de venta es al crédito y realiza los cobros de manera semanal o quincenal, dependiendo de la disponibilidad de su cliente. En el mismo lugar también elaboran sandalias artesanales y esta es otra actividad en la que ahora quiere incursionar. Por el momento, su trabajo le está dando la oportunidad de tener un ingreso para continuar brindando a sus hijos la educación y alimentación; lleva realizándolo 2 años. Así también, eventualmente, vende golosinas de manera ambulatoria o en alguna fiesta o reunión que encuentra en su recorrido.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite disponer mucho de su tiempo, pero no siempre le fue tan fácil poder realizarlo, ya que al principio no sabía nada del negocio, pero poco a poco fue aprendiendo y ahora el trabajo que realiza se ha convertido en su forma de vida. Su meta es consolidar su negocio y vender sus productos en una tienda y empezar a vender en otros distritos de la región.

Este es el crédito número 3 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Asimismo, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo anteriormente. Y además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 800) comprará madera y los materiales que lleva al penal para que elaboren los cuadros y las sandalias que posteriormente pondrá a la venta.
texts.en:
Leslie is a friendly, good and hardworking 26 year old. She is the mother of two children, ages eight and four. They are her sole responsibility as her husband abandoned her. It is a lot of hard work, but she does it with love and the hope of bringing the best to her family.
She sells paintings that are made by the prisoners in the central jail of the city. She goes to the jail to acquire the paintings, which she then sells. She sells the paintings on credit and receives weekly or bimonthly payments from her customers, depending on the customer’s situation. In the same prison they also make sandals. This is another business that she would like to start, selling the sandals. For the moment, this work has been successful and has allowed he to give her children food and an education. She has been doing this work for the past two years. Also, she would eventually like to sell sweets door to door or at parties or reunions that are in her area.
What she likes about her work is that it is a good use of her time but it isn’t always easy. At first she didn’t know anything about business, but little by little she learned and now her work has become a part of her life. Her goal is to consolidate her business and sell her goods in a store. She would also like to sell in other districts in her region.
This is her third loan with MFP. She is very content with the financial assistance. With this loan she feels secure about advancing her business. She promises to pay her payments on time as she has done in the past. She is happy to belong to the community bank, as all of the members are responsible and united.
With the loan that she is requesting, for 800 soles, she will buy wood to take to the jail so the prisoners can make the pictures and sandals that she will sell.

loans.use: to buy materials so that prisoners can paint the pictures that she sells.

loans.name: Inom

texts.ru: Inom is the man who likes to work hardly. During 30 years he works in collective farm. He grows different kind of cons and sells to local people. Also he has live-stocks. In business to him helps his wife. Their sons go to Russia to find work. Inom’s profit doesn’t enough to build adding rooms for their sons and that’s why he wants to get a loan for purchasing of building materials.
texts.en: Inom is the man who likes to work hard. During the last thirty years he works in a collective farm. He grows different kinds of cons and sells to local people. He also has livestock. His wife helps him in the business. Their sons went to Russia to find work. Inom’s profit isn’t enough to build additional rooms for their sons and that’s why he wants to get a loan to purchasе of building materials.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 62-year-old mixed crop farmer. He is married to Ann, who is a farmer, and they are blessed with three children. He has been in the farming business for the past four years and has a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family members.

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Samuel will use the loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profits from the business, he will educate his children. 

He hopes to buy a piece of land and build rental houses, which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Issa

texts.en: Issa is 38 years old. He is a father of four children aged between 3 and 10 years. He has been selling clothes for three years. With the loan he has requested, he plans to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used for renovating his house. In the future, Issa would like to become a wholesaler of the clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and increase the volume of sales.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru: Шоира замужняя женщина, на воспитании имеет двоих детей, старшему 5 лет а младшему 3 года. Муж находится в трудовой миграции. На иждивении имеются родители мужа. Шоира любит с детства вышивать- это профессия досталась ей в наследство от матери. Ранее она шила для увлечения и для своих потребностей, но выйдя замуж и ощутив серьезные финансовые проблемы в семье она решила помочь своему мужу, который последний раз прислал ей деньги четыре месяца назад, в настоящее время муж безработный не в состоянии высылать жене денег. Она решила серьезно заняться шитьем не только для себя но и по заказу. Узнав о курсах для женщин, который проводит НАДЖТ совместно с «Имон Интернешнл» Шоира приняла активное участие, получив необходимые знания подала заявку на получения кредита. Она очень уверенная грамотная женщина, способна достичь поставленных целей. Шоира хотела бы купить швейную машинку и необходимые материалы для шитья национальных и европейских платьев. Она очень надеется на вашу доброту и помощь.
texts.en: Shoira is married and has two children. The older child is five years old, and the younger is three. Her husband is a migrant laborer. Her husband's parents are dependent on them. Shoira's love of sewing began in childhood. It is a profession which was passed on to her by her mother. In the past she sewed for her own enjoyment and needs, but after marrying and facing serious financial problems in the family she decided to help her husband who last sent her money four months ago. Her husband is currently unemployed and unable to send his wife money. She decided to sew seriously not just for herself but to order. After finding out about classes for women run by NABWT (National Association of Business Women of Tajikistan) in cooperation with IMON International, Shoira became an active participant and after learning the needed information, submitted an application for a loan. She is a very confident and skillful woman, and able to reach her stated goals. Shoira would like to buy a sewing machine and the supplies needed for sewing traditional and European dresses. She very much hopes for your kindness and help.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and the necessary fabrics for sewing of national and European dresses

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is 22 years old. He has one child aged four. His wife works as a business woman. With the loan, he wants to buy more clothes to increase the volume of sales. With the profits from the business, he will renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru: Фарход 1982 года рождения, он женат у него есть маленький сын. В настоящий момент он разводит дома скот. Так как он живет далеко от города, он в свое время не смог поступить в университет, и остался помогать родителям. Кроме того в сезонное время он выращивает арахис, и с утра по раньше он сдает арахис на рынок торговцам. Сейчас его сын маленький, но в будущем когда у него будут еще дети, он должен всем им дать высшее образование, которое сам не смог получить, позже построить им дом и женить. Для этого он должен накопить определенную сумму для каждого ребенка поэтому Фарход , уже сейчас начинает копить свой капитал.Настоящий кредит он получает для увеличения поголовья скота.
texts.en: Farhod was born in 1982. He is married and has a young son. At this time he raises livestock at his home. As he lives far from the city, he was unable to attend university, and instead stayed to help his parents. He also raises peanuts seasonally and early in the morning he sells the peanuts to traders in the market. His son is still young, but when there are more children he wants to provide them all with the higher education he himself could not obtain, and later build them homes and pay for their weddings. To do this he needs to save a certain sum for each child, and so Farhod is already beginning to save. He is requesting this loan to expand his livestock herd.

loans.use: purchase livestock

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.ru: Абдусаттор 1965 года рождения, женат имеет 3 детей.  Он живет высоко в горах, где с января по март лежит снег. В их селе все занимаются откормом скота, некоторые выезжают за пределы Таджикистана и уезжают на заработки в Казастан и Российскую Федерацию. Но Абдусаттор не хочет оставлять свою семью, для этого он с семьей выращивают дома скот. Жена помогает Абдусаттору в разведении скота, она доит коз и из молока делает (кислые молочные шарики). Настоящий кредит получает для покупки скота и корма для скотов.
texts.en: Abdusattor was born in 1965. He is married and has three children. He lives high in the mountains, where there is snow on the ground from January to March. Everyone in the village raises livestock, and some leave Tajikistan to work in Kazakhstan or Russia. Abdusattor, however, does not want to leave his family, so he and the family raise animals at their home. His wife helps him keep the livestock; she milks the goats and makes sour milk balls from the milk. He is requesting this loan in order to buy animals and animal feed.

loans.use: purchase livestock

loans.name: Rose

texts.es:
Rose tiene 35 años, es una mujer buena, amable y trabajadora. Está separada del que fue su pareja y es madre de dos hijos, de 18 y 5 años. Viven en la casa de su padre, al lado de  su hermana y sus dos sobrinos.

Su negocio es la venta de cerveza. Todos los lunes realiza el pedido a las distribuidoras con las que trabaja, las mismas que le entregan las cajas de cerveza en su domicilio, procede a colocarlas en la congeladora para que estén listas para el consumo. También vende gaseosas, hielo y chupetes de fruta. Trabaja en esta actividad por más de 3 años y con la ayuda de su hermana. Desde hace algún tiempo atrás, también vende pollo asado los fines de semana, ya que ha visto en este negocio la oportunidad perfecta de vender mayor cantidad de cervezas y gaseosas; y en algunas ocasiones también suele vender ropa.
Aun recuerda el primer día que se puso a vender bebidas, todos los temores y dudas que tenía, pero poco a poco fue consolidándose y aprendiendo el negocio. Ahora es una gran vendedora y tiene muchos clientes, así como planes para su futuro, como poner un bar y más adelante una distribuidora.

Este es el crédito número 3 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen lo posible para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, está muy comprometida a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, como lo hizo en los créditos anteriores que tuvo. También está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 2000) comprará mayor cantidad de cervezas y gaseosas, también los ingredientes e insumos para seguir preparando sus comidas.
texts.en:
Rose is 35 years old. She is a good woman, friendly and hardworking. She is separated from her partner. She is the mother of two children who are 18 and 5 years old. They live in her father’s house, next to her sister and her two nephews.

Her business is selling beer. Every Monday she orders from the distributors with whom she works, and they deliver the boxes of beer to her home, and she puts it in the refrigerator to be ready for consumption. She also sells soft drinks, ice, and fruit lollipops. She has been doing this work for more than three years with the help of her sister. For some time she has been selling roasted chicken on the weekends, as she has seen in this business the perfect opportunity to sell more beer and soft drinks. At times she also sells clothing.

She still remembers the first day that she began to sell drinks, all the fears and doubts that she had, but little by little she was establishing and learning the business. Now she is a great saleslady and has many customers and plans for the future, such as putting in a bar and later a distributorship.

This is her third loan through MFP, and she is grateful to those that make it possible for her to continue with her objectives. On her part, she is very committed to meeting her payment schedule on time, as she did on the previous loans she has had. Also she is happy to be a member of her communal bank as all of the members are good, kind, and supportive.

With the requested amount of 2000 soles she will buy more beer and soft drinks, and also ingredients and supplies in order to continue preparing her meals.

loans.use: to buy beer, soft drinks, and ingredients and supplies in order to continue preparing meals

loans.name: Vedaste

texts.en: Vedaste is aged 22. He has one child aged 2. He has been selling ladies clothes. He wants the loan to buy more clothes to sell such as blouses, skirts and trousers for the ladies. With the profits, he dreams to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 3 years. He describes himself as honest and customer friendly. He operates a motorbike where he provides transportation. He has been involved in this business for 5 years and employs 3 staff members. His business is located at a competitive business environment and his primary customers are business persons. He describes his biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a solar lantern. His business goal is to run a cereal retail store.

loans.use: to buy a solar lantern.

loans.name: Mwanawani

texts.en:
Mwanawani is a married woman with four children.  She runs a business where she operates a maize miller. She started the business five years ago and her potential customers are neighbours and passersby.  


Since she joined Yehu Microfinance Kenya, she has retained her business because she has been trained in business management skills. Mwanawani hopes to expand her business in the future. She needs a loan of KES 20,000 to buy five bags of maize for resale.

loans.use: to buy five bags of maize.

loans.name: Thaer

texts.en:
Thaer is a 21-year-old single young man. He has been a taxi driver for two years, which has been a profitable project and his only source of income, but he also needs more support to cover his needs and the costs.

Thaer is requesting a USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of painting and making repairs to his taxi, such as changing the wheels and installing new mirrors. This will create a new look to the taxi and improve its efficiency, which will enable Thaer to take more requests and improve his income.

Thaer is photographed next to his taxi.

loans.use: To paint and repair his taxi

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 39-year-old man. He is married and the father of two sons and two daughters.

For the past four years, Mahmoud has had a grocery store, which has been a profitable project, but also needs more support to cover the family's needs and the store's cost.

Mahmoud is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing for his store necessary missing groceries that are usually requested by customers, such as milk, canned food, rice, and sugar. This will give to Mahmoud a variety of groceries, so he will compete with others well and satisfy his customers' needs. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.

Mahmoud is photographed in his grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase groceries

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She is married and sells water to the residents living around her. Riziki began the business from her own savings through applying for a distribution meter. The area faces perennial water shortages and relies on people like her for clean/portable water. She is the mother of three children, all of whom are in school. She also supplies bore hole water for other domestic chores for the village.

Riziki was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to repair the tap and construct a good site for the selling of water. Riziki’s future ambition is to make her business a big source of portable water for the village. The challenges she faces are theft and some customers not paying on time.

loans.use: To repair the tap and construct a good site for the selling of water.

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en:
Sameera is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Nasser appears in her Kiva profile photo, pictured in his store.

Sameera is a Palestinian woman; she is married and a mother to one son and four daughters. Her elder son is employed with a low salary.

For the past one year, Sameera's husband has had a store for selling mobile phones, which has been a profitable project, but also needs more support to cover the family's needs.

Sameera is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing a new collection of mobile phones and improving the store's condition, such as painting and installing shelves and lights. This will improve the store's condition, increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To improve the store's condition and buy a collection of mobile phones for resale.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a business lady living in Malindi town, Kenya. She owns a grocery stall that has been in operation for the last two years. In this shop, Kadzo sells tomatoes, oranges and vegetables. Kadzo began the business two years ago, and besides this, she also sells fried fish. Kadzo is married and has four children, three of whom are in school.

Kadzo learned of Milango from her friends. She was introduced to Milango this year and is applying for a loan of 31,450 Kenya shillings to reconstruct her grocery stall and add new stock of groceries and fish.

She believes that the income will enable her to provide for the basic needs of her family and also educate the three children who are in school.

loans.use: To reconstruct her grocery stall and add new stock of groceries and fish.

loans.name: Mathews

texts.en: Mathews is doing well, and his business has continued to improve. He has decided to apply for a loan, which he will repay in a short term, in order to help him make a few repairs to his van.

loans.use: To repair his van.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad, who appears in the picture next to his house, is a Palestinian married young man with no children yet. He is a worker and gets a low salary. It is the only source of income for him, but it's not enough to cover the family's needs and finish the house.

Mohammad is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of completing the house, such as painting, installing doors and windows and installing tiles. This will improve the house's condition and offer to Mohammad and his wife a suitable home to live in.

loans.use: To complete the house.

loans.name: Electina

texts.en: Electina has made much progress from her previous loan. The sales were quite high, and she was able to repay the loan before the loan term ended. She has therefore decided to apply for a new loan to purchase additional stock of clothes in preparation for the Muslim festival period of Ramadhan, when many customers purchase clothes in bulk.

loans.use: To purchase new stock of clothes.

loans.name: Feriyal

texts.en:
Feriyal is a Palestinian woman. She is married and a mother to five daughters. Her husband is a painter and gets a low salary, which is the only source of income to him and not enough to cover all the family's needs.

Feriyal and her family are suffering from humidity and damp in their house that may cause to them shortness of breath and other minor diseases, so Feriyal is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of repairing her house from humidity. This will help to remove humidity from Feriyal's house and offer to her family clean home conditions.

Feriyal is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To repair her house from humidity and damp.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 30 años, es una mujer amable, solidaria y muy responsable. Su pareja desde hace 12 años es Víctor y tiene 54 años, con él tiene dos hijos de 12 y 3 años. 
Su trabajo consiste en la venta de comida y jugos. Todos los días, desde muy temprano, sale a vender jugos elaborados de las frutas más frescas de la región (de naranja, papaya, toronja y otros). Los desayunos que ofrece son pan con huevo, con pollo, con queso, con palta o jamonada. Al acercarse la noche empieza con la venta de comida típica de la región, ofreciendo las más ricas carnes asadas de pollo, pescado y cerdo, a los que agrega su toque secreto de sazón y sabor. Esta labor la realiza en la vereda de su casa desde hace 2 años. Por otro lado, también trabaja en una entidad del estado, y eventualmente se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de productos de limpieza como detergentes, ambientadores, cera, jabones; de esa manera puede tener ingresos adicionales a su principal fuente de trabajo. Como toda mujer con ganas de superarse tiene muchos objetivos, pero el principal, por ahora, es consolidarse con su negocio de comidas, para ello desea implementar un espacio dentro de su casa para poder realizar su trabajo con mayor tranquilidad y comodidad.

Este es su crédito número 5 con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Y además le gusta ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece, ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1500) comprará frutas, ingredientes e insumos para continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Rosa is 30 years old. She is a kind, supportive and very responsible woman. She has been with her partner, Victor, for 12 years. He is 54, and they have two children, age 12 and 3.

Rosa works selling food and juices. Every day, from early morning, she sells juices made from the freshest fruits of the region (orange, papaya, grapefruit and others), and breakfast sandwiches of egg, chicken, cheese, avocado or bolognese. In the evening she sells dishes typical of the region: the richest roast chicken, fish and pork, with her own secret seasoning. Her stall is on the pavement outside her house, and she has had it for 2 years. She also works for a state government agency, and also sells cleaning products door-to-door, such as detergents, air fresheners, wax and soap, so as to bring in some additional income. Like any woman wanting to excel, she has many goals, but the main one, for now, is to consolidate her food business, as she wants to develop a space inside her house to make the work easier and more comfortable.

This is Rosa's fifth loan with MFP, and she welcomes the opportunity and confidence placed in her. She agrees to make the repayments on time. She likes being part of the communal bank to which she belongs, as the members are responsible and supportive of each other. With the requested amount (1500 Soles), Rosa will buy fruits, ingredients and supplies to continue her work.

loans.use: To buy fruit, ingredients and consumables to continue her business

loans.name: Valon

texts.en:
Valon is from Kosovo. He is married and is the father of a one-year-old child. For more than twelve years, he has managed a motorcycle mechanic repair business, which he inherited from his father. 

With this loan he will buy spare parts for motorcycles to expand and enrich his business. His hopes are to continue generating income for his family and improve their living conditions in general.

loans.use: to buy tools for his motorcycle repair business.

loans.name: Pajtim

texts.en:
Pajtim is from Kosovo and is single. Three years ago he started his business as an air-conditioning fitter, working from his home. Now he has numerous requests from different companies to install air-conditioners. 

He has requested a new loan to buy new working tools because his work has increased. He still hopes to expand his business which will help to improve his living standards and ensure an income for his family.

loans.use: to buy equipment for his air-conditioning business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Gani

texts.en:
As a married man with four children, Gani works hard to support his family. He has greenhouse where he plants vegetables. He has asked to borrow 600 Euros from KosInvest to extend the greenhouse so he can grow vegetables to sell in addition to using them for his family.

Gani has been sustaining his business activities for a long time. He hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream which is to expand his business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy material to extend his greenhouse.

loans.name: Fexhrije

texts.en:
Fexhrije lives in Kosovo. She is married and has two boys. Fexhrije runs a small farm with one cow whose milk is used only for her family's needs. Her plans are to increase the number of cows and develop the farm, for which she needs more funds. 

With the help of this loan she plans to purchase another cow. Fexhrije’s dream is to establish a bigger farm, where she will be able to create conditions for keeping more cows, increase her income from the livestock business and create better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Walaa

texts.en:
Walaa is a young woman who is 22 years old. She is married and has no children yet. Her husband is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover all their costs. 

For the past six months, Walaa has run a beauty salon. It has been a profitable project, but it also needs more support to cover costs.

Walaa is requesting a 2,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing new beauty salon kit and a collection of new accessories, such as hair and body creams, a number of hair dryers, and different types of hair brushes. This will give Walaa the necessary kit for her work in the salon, which will improve her work quality and increase her income.

Walaa is photographed in her beauty salon.

loans.use: To buy beauty salon kit and accessories.

loans.name: Zayed

texts.en:
Zayed is a young, 30-year-old man. He is married and a father to two daughters who are four and five years old.

Zayed has a store selling women's scarves and accessories. This is a profitable project and his only source of income, but also needs more support to cover the family's needs.

Zayed is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new collection of women's scarves and accessories. This new collection will attract customers to choose and purchase more, thereby increasing sales and improving the family's income.

Zayed is photographed in his store.

loans.use: To purchase women's scarves and accessories for resale

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.en:
Hanadi is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Aqel appears in her Kiva profile photo, pictured in their house.

Hanadi is a young 32-year-old woman. She is married to Aqel and is a mother to two sons and two daughters, who are 1 to 6 years old.

Hanadi's husband is a worker who gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs and requests.

Hanadi wants to improve the condition of her family's house, so she is requesting a loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of improving its condition, such as painting and installing electric extensions. This will give Hanadi and her family suitable living conditions in their home.

loans.use: To improve the condition of her family's house

loans.name: Nonvignon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVIGNON est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Yévèdo Félicienne, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Yévèdo Félicienne est âgée de 32 ans et est mariée à un certain Étienne. Le couple a un enfant scolarisé et à leur charge. Yévèdo Félicienne n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Dans le but de subvenir à ses besoins et d’assurer les charges familiales, Yévèdo Félicienne mène comme activité depuis quinze ans environs, la vente des bouteilles et des plastiques dans un marché du Bénin. Yévèdo Félicienne achète ses produits dans les quartiers et villes du Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Yévèdo Félicienne désire obtenir un deuxième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON. Ce crédit leur permettra à rehausser le niveau de leur activité et à faire face à la demande croissante de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
NONVIGNON Group is made up of three persons who live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, named Yévèdo Félicienne, is the one raising her hand in the photograph.

This is the second time that the members of this group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

Yévèdo Félicienne, age 32, is married to one Étienne. The couple has one school-attending child to support. Yévèdo Félicienne herself didn't attend school.

In order to provide for herself and ensure the family expenses are covered, she's been selling bottles and plasticware for about fifteen years in one of Benin's market.

She gets her supplies from neighborhoods and towns in Benin. In order to bolster her product stock and better meet customer demand, she would like to obtain a second loan with the other members of NONVIGNON Group.

This loan will enable them to bolster their businesses and meet an ever-increasing customer demand.

loans.use: to buy bottles and plasticware

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is a 44-year-old woman. She is married and a mother to eight sons and five daughters. Her husband is a worker who gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

For the past six years, Farida has been raising and selling sheep and sheep products. This has been a profitable project, but also needs more support to cover costs.

Farida is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing more sheep and improving the herd's condition. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.

Farida is photographed next to the herd.

loans.use: To purchase sheep.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is a twenty-three-year-old single young man. His father is a construction worker whose low salary is not enough to cover the family's needs and the costs of higher education.

Abdullah is studying at the university, specializing in Business and Financing. Abdullah wants to complete his studies and needs to pay the university fees. He is therefore requesting a loan from FATEN to help him cover the university fees. This will ensure a better future for Abdullah and allow him to improve the family's living conditions. 

Abdullah is photographed in the University.

loans.use: To pay university fees.

loans.name: Ligia

texts.es:
Ligia tiene 27 años, es una mujer trabajadora y decidida con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Está separada del padre de su hija de 3 años de edad.  Vive en su propia casa, la que construyó en un terreno cedido por sus padres.  
Su actividad es la venta de ropa y zapatos en sociedad con su madre, quien vende desde su casa entre sus vecinos y amistades; la otra parte la vende Ligia de forma ambulatoria en el mercado de la localidad. Se inició hace más de 5 años con un capital propio, motivada por su madre y comprando en pequeñas cantidades, que fueron aumentando según la demanda. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable, pues logra acabar todo lo que lleva para vender. Antes de empezar con su negocio, tuvo dificultades económicas, ya que los gastos aumentaron con la separación con su pareja, siendo ella padre y madre para su hija, y tiene el deseo de brindarle una mejor calidad de vida y una buena educación, además de apoyar a su madre con los gastos del hogar. Por tanto, y viendo los buenos resultados que está consiguiendo, desea continuar y aumentar el stock de venta de su negocio.

Este es el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP y está muy contenta de saber que cuenta con un apoyo financiero, ya que así se siente segura de avanzar con su negocio. Además le gusta el apoyo que se brindan unos a otros en su banco comunal.
Con el monto solicitado, de 2000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de ropa y zapatos, de variados modelos y tallas, la cual traerá desde la capital, buscando conseguir precios cómodos.
texts.en:
Ligia, 27, is a hard-working, determined woman who wants very much to get ahead.  She is divorced from the father of her three-year-old daughter.  She lives in her own house which she built on land given to her by her parents.

Her business activity is selling clothing and shoes, in association with her mother and out of her home, to neighbors and friends.  Ligia also works as a street vendor at the local market.  She began her business five years ago with her own capital, encouraged by her mother and buying in small quantities that gradually increased as the demand grew.  She believes her business is quite profitable because she always sells everything she takes to sell.  Before beginning her business she had economic difficulties since her expenses increased when she got divorced.  She has to be both father and mother to her daughter and wants to give her a better quality of life and a good education.  She also wants to help her mother with the household expenses.  Therefore, based on the good results she is obtaining, she wants to continue and increase her sales stock.

This is her fifth loan through the MFP institution and she is very happy to be able to count on the financial support, giving her the confidence to advance in her business.  Also, she likes gthe support she gets from the other members of her communal bank.

The loan in the amount of 2,000 PEN she is requesting will be used to buy clothing and shoes in different styles and sizes.  She will buy them in the capital city, seeking out the best prices.

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes in different styles and sizes.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar, who is photographed in his store, is a thirty-eight-year-old man. He is married and is a father of six daughters. 

For the past eight years, Omar has been buying and selling fruits and vegetables in his store to customers. This has been a profitable project as the store is located in an area with a lot of movement and Omar has loyal customers. However, he needs more support to cover the family's needs.

Omar is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing more summer fruits and vegetables. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Mercedes Maritza

texts.en:
Mercedez is thirty-six years old and lives with her two sons. She lives in the rural areas of Northern Peru in her own house which has electricity. Her main area of activity is the selling of soft drinks and sweets, even though she has started offering cooked food on weekends. This hard work has allowed her to build a good reputation and become a trustworthy provider of goods for the community. 

She has seen an opportunity to continue to increase the range of products offered and has asked for a loan as a result. Furthermore, she has previously received a loan from Edpyme Alternativa, with the support of Kiva, which initially helps her to consolidate the foundations of her business. She has proven to be a reliable and punctual client.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to expand the range of products offered.

loans.name: Nonvissilele Group

texts.fr: NONVISSILELE est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Ahlokoba (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 47ans et est mariée à un certain Innocent. Le couple n’a aucun enfant à charge. Ahlokoba vit ensemble avec son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de sept ans, Ahlokoba vend des savons liquides de façon ambulante. Ahlokoba achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la première fois que, Ahlokoba et les autres membres du groupe NONVISSILELE sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
NONVISSILELE Group is made up of four persons who live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, named Ahlokoba (raising her hand in the photograph) is 47 years old, and married to one Innocent.

The couple doesn't have any child to support. Ahlokoba and her husband live together and ensure together that the various household expenses are covered.

For almost seven years, Ahlokoba has been selling liquid soap as a traveling saleswoman. She gets her supplies in one of Benin's market.

This is the first time that she and the other members of NONVISSILELE Group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their working capital and better answer customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy liquid soap

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.en:
Jose Manuel is forty years old, married and has three children. He lives in his own house which is made out of basic material. His house is situated in the north of Peru where he undertakes the raising and commercialization of animals. He has been doing this activity for the past ten years specialising in animals such as sheep, ducks, chickens and turkeys. Moreover he also grows agricultural crops. All of these activities are carried out just outside his house.
 
Jose Manuel is an active client of Edpyme Alternativa and has proven very punctual in his payments. As a result of the difficult conditions in his house he is now looking to take out an additional loan to cover the costs of fixing the floor in his house.

loans.use: to make improvements to the floor of his living room.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is forty years old and lives in Tonggo, Tudela. Merlinda is married with five children. 

Merlinda has a store that sells variety of products. Merlinda has had this business for five years.Merlinda requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.  

Merlinda has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Merlinda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages and detergents.

loans.name: Sooga

texts.en:
Sooga is twenty-five years old and single with one child. She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for more than a year. 

Sooga has requested a loan to purchase new equipment. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Sooga will increase and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing gear.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is thirty-two years old and married with three children. She runs a small business selling light food and snacks in her community and has been doing this for a year. 

Beverly has requested a loan to increase the quality of the goods in her canteen. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Beverly will continue to maintain and stabilize her business.

loans.use: to buy noodles, flour and coffee powder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shelving, counters and display cases.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es:
Abraham es un hombre humilde y sencillo de 45 años. Está casado con Alejandrina, de 44 años. Su casa es propia, la compraron hace 12 años, allí viven junto a sus dos queridos hijos Jilmer y Noemí, quienes son estudiantes.
Él se dedica a labrar la tierra para cultivar plantas de cacao, tiene mucho conocimiento sobre este cultivo porque lleva 15 años con ello. Le gusta el trabajo que hace porque tiene un gran apoyo por parte de su esposa e hijos (en sus tiempos libres). Con esta labor puede solventar los gastos que tienen en su hogar; y cree que lo más difícil es llevar sus cultivos hasta el lugar donde los vende, ya que son sacos muy pesados. Pero aun así se preocupa por seguir nutriendo sus campos de cultivo para obtener una buena producción.

Abraham sabe que tiene que pagar puntual sus cuotas y está contento porque una vez más cuenta con apoyo financiero. En su banco comunal siempre es partícipe de cada reunión y le agrada porque trabaja con personas responsables. 
Con los 700 nuevos soles de este préstamo comprará abono para esparcir en sus plantas después de quitar las malezas.
texts.en:
Abraham, 45, is a humble man who is married to Alejandrina, 44.  They live in their own house, which they bought 12 years ago, with their two beloved children, Jilmer and Noemí, who attend school.

He is a cocoa farmer and has much expertise after working with this crop for 15 years.  He enjoys his work because he has ample support from his wife and children (in their free time).  The income he makes provides enough to cover household expenses.  He believes the most difficult part of his job is having to transport the crops to the sales point, since the sacks are very heavy.  But even so, he worries about taking good care of his cropland in order to obtain a good harvest.

Abraham is committed to paying back the loan on time and is happy to have access to financial support once again.  He always attends and participates in the communal bank meetings, and enjoys working with responsible people.

With the 700 PEN loan, he plans to buy fertilizer to spread over his crops after removing the weeds.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Faamanuia

texts.en:
Faamanuia is thirty-two years old and married with four children. She makes and sells handicrafts to earn a living and has been doing this for two years. 

Faamanuia has requested a loan to help her business grow. She plans to use her profits to help her family. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy weaving materials.

loans.name: Angela Dilia

texts.es:
Ángela tiene 60 años de edad, es casada, tiene 6 hijos, vive con su esposo y una hija  en una aldea del Departamento de Yoro, Yoro.
