La actividad económica a que se dedica Doña Ángela es una pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios (arroz, frijoles, azúcar, harina, manteca, arroz, pan, golosinas etc.)  Inicio su negocio con capital propio,  posteriormente con las ganancias logro aumentar su inventario. Ella cuenta en la actualidad con una clientela fija, lo que le permite un aumento en sus ventas y además la demanda de mayor oferta de productos. 
Actualmente ha solicitado su séptimo préstamo para invertir en la compra de alimentos, como, carnes, arroz, azúcar, manteca, productos de abarrotería, embutidos y lácteos). Surtiendo su negocio le permitirá aumentar las ventas y mejorar sus ingresos familiares y lograr un desarrollo económico.
Su sueño es que sus ventas sigan aumentando y con las ganancias crecer económicamente para apoyar a sus hijos en la educación y lograr un negocio estable.
texts.en:
Ángela is 60 years of age, and is married with six children. She lives with her husband and one daughter in a small village in the department of Yoro, Yoro.

Ángela has a general store, where she sells food products (rice, beans, sugar, flour, lard, rice, bread, candies, etc.). She started her business with her own capital, and then used her profits to increase her stock. She currently has regular customers, which has allowed her to increase her sales, and there is also demand for a greater range of products.

Ángela has requested her seventh loan to buy food such as meat, rice, sugar, lard, grocery items, cold cuts and dairy products. Supplying her business will allow her to increase her sales, improve her family’s income and ensure better financial development. Her dream is to see her sales continue to increase, and to use her profits to expand financially so that she can provide for her children’s education and have a stable business.

loans.use: To buy products such as meat, rice, sugar, lard, grocery items, cold cuts and dairy products to supply her business and increase her stock.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio tiene 41 años, es un hombre muy esforzado. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Celedonia, de 38 años, y sus dos menores hijos Jaime y Yorela, a quienes desea brindar mejor calidad de vida.
Desde muy joven se dedica al cultivo de cacao y café, sus cultivos están bien cuidados, ya que sabe que los ingresos de su familia dependen de esta actividad. Los productos los lleva a vender a la ciudad, donde se encuentran las asociaciones recolectoras de cacao y café, ubicadas a 30 minutos de su comunidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho ánimo para obtener una buena cosecha. Esta labor la lleva realizando 30 años (empezó desde niño con sus padres) y considera que siempre tiene que cuidar sus cultivos para evitar que las plagas los malogren. Su mayor anhelo es construir su casa a base de material noble (ladrillo y cemento) para lograr tener la tienda que tanto desea.

Sabe que este préstamo le ayudará en el progreso de su trabajo y así lograr su objetivo. Asimismo, se siente muy contento por trabajar en su banco comunal, porque los integrantes son personas solidarias. 
Con este préstamo comprará fertilizantes y abono para mantener la buena producción de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Antonio, 41, is a hard-working man who lives in his own house with his wife, Celedonia, 38, and their two minor children, Jaime and Yorela, for whom he wants to provide a better quality of life.

Since he was very young he has been growing cocoa and coffee for a living.  His crops are well taken care of since he knows the family income depends on this business.  He takes the crops to the city to sell to the cocoa and coffee collection associations, located about 30 minutes from his community.  What he enjoys most about his work is farming the land and taking enough care to obtain a good harvest.  For 30 years he has been working in this trade (he began as a child with his parents), and he feels he always has to avoid plant disease to protect his crops.  His greatest goal is to build a house out of solid materials (brick and cement) and to have his own store.

He knows the loan will help him get ahead in his work so he can meet his goal.  Also, he is very happy working with his communal bank since all the members are supportive.

This loan will be used to buy fertilizers to keep his land in good condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es: Ernestina siente que desde que cuenta con el apoyo de los créditos Kiva, sus ventas han aumentado y se ha fortalecido más el negocio ya que con la inversión que realizó en ropa y calzado pudo atender los pedidos de su clientela.  Este es la tercera financiación realizada por Kiva dentro de los siete créditos otorgados por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con la cual pretende comprar además, electrodomésticos menores y variedades seleccionados que le han encargado.  Sabe que con esta inversión le va a ir muy bien porque tiene una clientela fija, con muy buenos hábitos de pago.  Ernestina trabaja arduamente para sacar adelante su negocio y para que sus hijos sigan superándose, una muestra de ello es el grado de profesional en Economía que recibió su hija en una universidad pública de la ciudad, hecho que la tiene muy feliz y orgullosa.  Se encuentra muy agradecida por el apoyo que le han brindado a ella y a los demás comerciantes a través de este programa que fortalece cada vez más los negocios para cumplir las metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Ernestina feels that ever since she has had the support of Kiva loans, her sales have increased and her business has become stronger. This is because the investment she made in clothing and shoes has allowed her to meet her customers’ orders.

This is the third Kiva loan of the seven loans given to Ernestina by the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She plans to use it to buy small household electrical appliances, as well as a select variety of items that have been ordered from her. She knows that this investment will help her to do well, as she has regular customers with very good payment habits.  

Ernestina works very hard to ensure that her business progresses and her children continue to get ahead. An example of this is the professional qualification in economics that her daughter received from the city’s public university, which makes Ernestina very happy and proud. She is very thankful for the support given to her and the other traders through this program, which continues to strengthen businesses to meet goals.

loans.use: To buy electrical household appliances and various products to diversify her business.

loans.name: Cindy

texts.es:
Cindy tiene 24 años, es una mujer de muchas ideas e ilusiones con su futuro. Tiene muchas ganas de progresar, además es alegre y amable con las personas. Es soltera, está realizando estudios técnicos y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres en compañía de sus tres hermanos.

Su actividad es la venta de ropa. Todas sus prendas las traen desde la capital, donde realiza viajes periódicos cada 3 meses. También cuenta con un empleo de medio tiempo, por las mañanas, en una empresa privada, aprovechando para vender sus prendas a sus colegas. Se inició en el negocio hace más de un año con un capital propio, y hasta el momento lo viene realizando sola. Considera a su negocio rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja, siendo un ingreso adicional para sus gastos personales. Antes de empezar con su negocio, tenía dificultades económicas, ya que el precio de los alimentos sube constantemente y los ingresos de sus padres no les alcanzaban. Por ello decidió generar un ingreso adicional, logrando superar estos problemas y viendo la acogida que tiene su negocio desea continuar y mantenerlo. Además desea abrir una botica al terminar sus estudios de técnica en farmacia.

Este es el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP, por lo que espera poder cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, comenta estar a gusto con su banco comuna por la ayuda que vienen brindando a las personas con deseos de progresar.

Con el monto solicitado, de 3500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de una moto lineal valorizada en 1500 nuevos soles, para realizar la cobranza de sus créditos y ahorrarse en el pago de pasajes. También adquirirá más prendas para dama, de diversos modelos modernos.
texts.en:
Cindy is 24 years of age, and is a woman with lots of ideas and excitement concerning the future. She wants to get ahead, and is happy and friendly with other people. She is single, is undertaking technical studies and has no children. She lives in her parents’ house, along with her three siblings.

Cindy works selling clothing. She gets all her clothes from the capital, where she regularly travels every three months. She also has a part-time job in the mornings, where she works in a private company and takes full advantage by selling her clothing to her work colleagues. Cindy started this business more than a year ago, using her own capital, and has run the business alone. She thinks that her business is profitable because of the good profits it generates, which represent additional income for her personal expenses. 

Before starting her business Cindy had financial difficulties, as food prices are constantly on the up and her parents’ income was insufficient. She therefore decided to earn extra income, overcoming these problems. Seeing how well her business was received, she wants to support it and ensure it continues. She also wants to open a pharmacy once she finishes her technical studies in pharmacology.

This is Cindy’s third loan from MFP, and she hopes to meet her goals. She says that she is happy with her village bank, and the help that it provides to people who want to get ahead. She plans to use the requested amount of 3,500 nuevos soles to buy a motorcycle valued at 1,500 nuevos soles, which she will use to collect amounts due to her and save money when traveling. She will also buy more ladies’ clothing, in a wide range of modern styles.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and a motorcycle to get around.

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es:
Dionicio es un hombre de 39 años. Vive en la casa que compró hace 8 años, gracias a su esfuerzo. Su esposa es María, de 40 años, también tres hijos: Abner, Yesenia y Deyvis, quienes día a día lo motivan a seguir adelante.
El cultivo de plantas de cacao es la actividad que diariamente realiza desde hace 15 años. Tiene su propia parcela y cada mañana se levanta con entusiasmo de poder ir a ver los frutos de sus plantas. Para Dionicio su trabajo es lo mejor que puede hacer, ya que es lo que más le gusta, gracias a ello puede velar por el bienestar de su familia. Sin embargo, considera que lo más difícil es transportar su cosecha hasta los centros de acopio. Por ello, lo que más anhela es poder comprar una movilidad y así evitar cargar demasiado peso.

Está agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe de MFP, pues se siente seguro de avanzar con su trabajo. Además, se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago como en anteriores créditos.  
Con los 3,000 nuevos soles solicitados comprará fertilizantes químicos para realizar el mantenimiento de sus plantas de cacao.
texts.en:
Dionicio, 39, lives in the house he bought eight years ago through his hard work.  His wife, María, is 40 years old and they have three children: Abner, Yesenia and Deyvis, who are his daily motivation for getting ahead.

Cocoa farming is the daily activity he has been involved in for 15 years.  He has his own patch of land, and every morning he gets up enthusiastically to go see how his crops are doing.  Dionicio feels this is the best job he can have since it is what he enjoys most, and thanks to it, he can give his family a good lifestyle.  However, he feels the most difficult part of the job is transporting the harvest to the collection centers.  So, what he desires most is to buy a vehicle to avoid having to carry too much weight.

He is grateful for the financial support received from MFP because he is confident it will help him advance in his job.  Also, he is committed to paying back the loan on time, as with previous loans.

The loan in the amount of 3,000 PEN will be used to buy chemical fertilizers for maintenance of his cocoa crop.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his cocoa crop.

loans.name: La Union Group

texts.es:
El comité La Union son de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, todas señoras de la zona que se esfuerzan por dar lo que necesitan a sus familias. Son mujeres jefas de familia que desean tener un mejor futuro, no solo para ellas, sino también para sus familias.
La Presidenta del grupo, la Sra.Mercedes, comenta que se dedica al comercio, ya que tiene una despensa bien surtida, con la cual surte a sus vecinos y otras personas. Ella comenta que empezó con un pequeño negocio, pero después con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo ha logrado ir creciendo. Ella sueña con ampliar su local, y de esa forma poder crecer como microempresaria.
Solicita el crédito para surtir su despensa con bebidas, lácteos, verduras, frutas, y demás productos de primera necesidad, con las cuales podrá tener su negocio bien surtido.
texts.en:
La Union (The Union) is a committee of the town of San Lorenzo. All the members are women of the area who do their best to provide for the needs of their families. They are the heads of their households and they want to grant a better future to themselves as well as to their families.
Mercedes is the president of the group; she is a retailer and she says she has a well-stocked store thanks to which she satisfies the requests from her neighbors and other people. She says she has started with a small shop, but she has succeeded in making it grow thanks to her hard work and her great effort. She dreams of expanding her shop in order to grow as a micro entrepreneur.
She is requesting a loan to stock up her small store with drinks, dairy products, vegetables, fruits and other basic necessities with which she will keep her shop well supplied.

loans.use: To buy drinks, dairy products, vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en: Oliva is sixty-four years old and married with seven children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as chickens, sugar, flour etc. She has been doing this for two years. Oliva needs a loan to improve her business. She hopes to use her profits to maintain her shop and help her family. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy goods for her shop.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la ciudad surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundación,  trabajan con la fundación desde el año 2009,  se encuentran  en el 11º ciclo, donde todas ellas trabajan dentro de un ambiente de ayuda y cooperación mutua.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. María, quien  se dedica  a la  elaboración de masas dulces en general y  también de bocaditos salados. Comenta que sus productos son muy buenos, y es por ello que ya tiene una clientela que constantemente le hacen pedido. Ella se define como una persona con ganas de salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
Maria solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para hacer sus bocaditos dulces y salados, como ser tomates, jamón, queso, dulce de leche, azúcar, mayonesa y demás. Agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo de Kiva y Fundación.
texts.en:
This group was born thanks to one of its members who came into contact with Fundación Paraguaya. They have been working with the Fundación Paraguaya since 2009 and they are now in their 11th cycle, working together with a spirit of mutual support and cooperation.
María is a member of this group. She prepares sweet pastry as well as savory snacks. She says that her products are very good, and for this reason her customers constantly place orders with her. She says she is a person with a great desire to get ahead in life and to help her family.
María is requesting a loan to buy ingredients to prepare her sweet and savory snacks such as tomatoes, ham, cheese, caramel, sugar and mayonnaise. She is grateful for the support she is receiving form Kiva and from the Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, ham, cheese, caramel, sugar and mayonnaise.

loans.name: Naheel

texts.en:
Naheel is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Nidal appears in her Kiva profile photo, pictured in the store where he sells fodder.

Naheel is a young 21-year-old woman. She is married to Nidal and is a mother to one son who is one year old.

For the past three years, Naheel and her husband have been selling poultry fodder. This has been a profitable project, but also needs more support to cover their costs and customers' increasing demand.

Naheel is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her and her husband cover the costs of bulk-purchasing poultry fodder for the store. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.

Naheel and Nidal are looking to take out a bigger loan amount in the future, in order to expand the store and increase the amount of fodder they buy to resell.

loans.use: to bulk-purchase poultry fodder.

loans.name: Inamorata

texts.en: Inamorata is a 29-year-old woman who is married with 3 children. She runs a business selling general goods and products in her community. She has 4 years of experience with this business. Inamorata has requested a loan to purchase more goods. She plans to use her profits to improve and extend her shop. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy goods for her shop.

loans.name: Faauuga

texts.en: Faauuga is a 30-year-old married woman with 5 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. She has requested a loan to improve her plantation. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Faauuga hopes to improve the quality and continue to grow her crop.

loans.use: to buy farming equipment.

loans.name: Sivailoa

texts.en: Sivailoa is 26 years old and married with 1 child. She runs a small business selling ice cakes in her community and has been doing this for a few years. She has requested a loan to purchase more resources. She joined SPBD in 2008 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Sivailoa will be happy to increase production and produce better quality.

loans.use: to buy ice cake ingredients.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario tiene 31 años, es hombre sencillo y trabajador. Vive en su casa propia, la que compraron hace 6 años, junto a su esposa Feliciana, de 30 años. Fruto de su amor tienen dos hijos: Nélida y Marilyn, a quienes anhelan dar una mejor calidad de vida.

Gracias a las ganancias de su trabajo en el campo logró abrir su tienda de abarrotes, vende, verduras, arroz por kilos, azúcar, menestras, conservas, entre otros alimentos para la necesidad de sus clientes. Quien atiende constantemente la tienda es su esposa y él se dirige a su parcela para ver la producción de su café y cacao; pero cuando está desocupado la apoya. Gracias al entusiasmo y la alegría que tiene logra robarles una sonrisa a sus clientes, por ello siempre acuden a su negocio, además de encontrar lo que necesitan. Lo que más anhela es que su tienda se abastezca de más productos, y de esa manera vender al por mayor. Mientras tanto, seguirá normalmente con su labor atendiendo con lo poco que empezaron hasta lograr su objetivo. 

Él sabe que tiene que ser puntual al pagar sus cuotas para que pueda acceder a otro préstamo, y lo hará. En su banco comunal es partícipe en todas las reuniones que se realizan e imparte entusiasmo a todos los socios. 
Con el dinero de este préstamo comprará más mercadería para la venta en su tienda.
texts.en:
Mario is 31 years old, and a simple, hard-working man.  He lives in his own home that he bought 6 years ago with his wife Feliciana, who is 30 years old.  The fruits of their love are two children: Nélida and Marilyn, for who they hope to provide a better quality of life.

Thanks to the savings from his work in the countryside, he managed to open his grocery store.  He sells vegetables, rice by the kilo, sugar, legumes, and preserves, among other foods that his customers need.  The person who tends to the store regularly is his wife, and he takes himself to his farmland to oversee the production of his coffee and cacao; however, when he has free time, he helps his wife.

His constant enthusiasm and happiness manage to steal a smile from his customers and, because of this, they always frequent his business; in addition, they find what they need there.  His biggest wish is to supply his store with more products and, in this way, to sell at wholesale.  In the meantime, he will continue his work as usual, attending with the little they started with until he reaches his objective.

He knows that he has to be punctual with his loan payments in order to access another loan in the future, and he will do it.  He participates in all his cooperative bank’s meetings and imparts his enthusiasm to all the members.

He will use the funds from this loan to buy more merchandise to sell in his store.

loans.use: to buy more food to supply his store.

loans.name: Fiva

texts.en: Fiva is 53 years old and married with 4 children. She makes and sells hand fans, fine mats, tapa and so on to earn a living and has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan to help her increase the quality of her products. She plans to use her profits to produce good income for her family's financial situation and also to help with her children's education. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy craft materials.

loans.name: Gil

texts.en: Gil is married with three children. He is 47 years old and lives in Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta City. He is engaged in buying and selling coconuts to earn a living and has had this business for 4 years. Each month, he earns approximately PHP 4,000 doing this type of work.  He has requested a loan of Php 14,900 to purchase coconuts for his retail business. He has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Gil hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts for his retail business.

loans.name: Nive

texts.en: Nive is a 39-year-old woman who is married with 4 children. She has a small business, mowing lawns. She has 4 years with this business. Nive needs a loan to improve her business. She will use her profits to help her kids' education. Nive joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new weed eater and other materials.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 77-year-old woman with 1 child. She has a small plantation and grows bananas, taro and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. Agnes has requested a loan to purchase new chemicals and other equipment. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, she hopes to help her child's education and extend her home.

loans.use: to purchase new chemicals and equipment.

loans.name: Peau

texts.en: Peau is a 28-year-old married woman with 3 children. She has a small plantation and grows banana, taro and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. Peau has requested a loan to purchase new chemicals and equipment. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. With her profits, she hopes to extend her home and pay for her kids' education.

loans.use: to purchase new chemicals and equipment.

loans.name: Julia Mary

texts.en: Julia Mary is 19 years old and single with 1 child. She runs a small business selling popcorn, ice cakes and snacks in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. She has requested a loan to purchase more food items. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Julia Mary will extend her business and help pay for her child's education.

loans.use: to purchase new food items for the community.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana es una mujer de 54 años. Vive en su casa propia, la que compró con su esposo Félix, de 53 años. Tienen seis hijos, y aun dependen de ellos. 
Ella se dedica al cultivo de plantas de café en su parcela de dos hectáreas de extensión. Esta labor la realiza hace 28 años y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien se encarga de los trabajos pesados. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que después de tanto esfuerzo logra ver los frutos, y lo que considera difícil es llevar sus sacos de cosecha hasta la ciudad, donde se encuentran las sociedades acopiadoras. Ella vende sus granos a muy buen precio por cada kilo, según la calidad. Por ello, para que siga obteniendo una buena producción su prioridad es realizar el mantenimiento de sus plantas para que en esta temporada pueda cosechar aun más granos de café. 

Una vez más siente contenta por la confianza que le brindan para obtener este préstamo, ya que así seguirá con su trabajo. Asimismo, se siente agradecida de trabajar con socios responsables en su banco comunal.
Con el dinero de este préstamo contratará jornaleros para que le apoyen en la cosecha del café.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is a 54-year old woman.  She lives in her own house that she bought with her husband, Félix, who is 53.  They have six children who still depend on them.

She dedicates herself to the cultivation of coffee plants on her plot of land that is two hectares in size.  She has been doing this work for 28 years and she counts on the support of her husband, who takes charge of the heavy work.  What she likes the most about her work is that, after all the effort, she manages to see the fruits of their labor.  What she considers the most difficult part is taking the sacks with the harvest to the city, where the wholesalers can be found.

She sells her grains at a good price per kilo, based on the quality.  For this reason, in order to continue obtaining a good production, her priority is to realize the maintenance of her plants so that in this harvest season she can produce even more coffee grains.

Once more she feels content by the confidence shown in her to obtain this loan since, in this manner, she will continue with her work.  Likewise, she feels grateful for working with responsible members in her cooperative bank.

She will use the funds from the loan to hire day laborers to help her with the coffee harvest.

loans.use: to hire day laborers for her coffee harvest.

loans.name: Nonvignon 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVIGNON 1 est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Dédevi Clémence, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Dédevi Clémence est âgée de 39 ans et est mariée à un certain Paul. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Dédevi Clémence vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple subvient ensemble aux divers besoins du ménage. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Dédevi Clémence vend des produits cosmétiques dans un quartier du Bénin depuis près de sept ans. Dédevi Clémence s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Dans le souci de renforcer davantage son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Dédevi Clémence désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Dédevi Clémence sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON 1, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The NONVIGNON 1 group is made up of three individuals who live in the same neighborhood.  The leader of the group, named Dédevi Clémence, is the one with her hand raised in the photo.  This is the first time that this group has requested financial help through ALIDé in order to build up their businesses.  Dédevi Clémence is 39 and married to a man named Paul.  The couple has five children in their care, all of whom attend school.  Dédevi Clémence lives with her husband and children.  Together, the couple meets their various household needs.  In order to fulfill her responsibilities, Dédevi Clémence has been selling cosmetic products in a Bénin neighborhood for seven years. She gets her supplies in a market in Bénin.  In the hopes of further strengthening her business and to better meet the demand of her customers, she wants to increase her stock of merchandise.  To do this, Dédevi Clémence is requesting, along with the other members of the NONVIGNON 1 group, an initial loan through ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Oscas

texts.es:
Oscas tiene 21 años, es un joven soltero, alegre y entusiasta por salir adelante. Vive en la casa de sus padres, quienes les dan mucho apoyo para seguir estudiando.
Para ello trabaja en la chacra de sus padres, para poder solventar sus gastos educativos. Desde hace 10 años que ayuda a sus padres en los cultivos de cacao y café y lo que más le gusta es labrar la tierras; considera que lo más difícil es que tiene que estudiar y trabajar a la vez, pero aun así no pierde las esperanzas de continuar.

Oscas sabe que el dinero de este crédito le será muy beneficioso para su trabajo, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus cuotas de pago. Asimismo, agradece a su banco comunal por darle la confianza de seguir trabajando responsablemente. 
Con el dinero de este préstamo, 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará abono para esparcir en sus cultivos después de la cosecha que se avecina.
texts.en:
Oscas is 21 years old; he is a single young man, happy and enthusiastic about getting ahead.  He lives with his parents, who support him a great deal in continuing his studies.

He works on his parents’ farm in order to cover his educational expenses.  He has helped them with the cacao and coffee crops since he was 10 years old; the part he enjoys most is working the lands.  He considers the most difficult part to be studying and working at the same time but, even still, he doesn’t lose hope of continuing.

Oscas knows that the funds from this loan will be very beneficial to his work, which is why he commits to being punctual with is payments.  Likewise, he thanks his cooperative bank for giving him the confidence to continue working responsibly.  

He will use the funds from this loan, 1000 Peruvian soles, to buy fertilizer to distribute on his crops after the harvest that is approaching.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.es:
Leoncia tiene 67 años, vive en su casa propia, la que compró junto a su esposo Fortunato hace muchos años atrás. Tiene dos hijos ya mayores, quienes también habitan en su casa.
A pesar de su edad, ella sigue laborando en su tienda de ropa. Labor que lleva realizando más de 15 años y comenta que en todo este tiempo su negocio ha sido en más concurrido por la buena atención y la amabilidad que dan a sus clientes. Antes lo realizaba sola y ahora, a veces, cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos o de su esposo, y eso es lo que más le gusta, estar en compañía de su familia.
 
Ella se siente muy contenta de saber que tiene el apoyo de los préstamos de MFP para seguir con su negocio. Por otro lado, se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago, como en los anteriores créditos. Y le agrada ser integrante de su banco comunal, pues sus compañeros son personas solidarias y responsables.
Con estos 1,000 nuevos soles se abastecerá de más prendas de vestir, las cuales traerá desde la ciudad capital, porque allí hay mayor variedad y mejores precios.
texts.en:
Leoncia is 67 years old. She lives in her own home, which she bought together with her husband Fortunato many years ago. She has two grown children who also live in the house with her. Despite her age, she still works in her clothing store. She has been working there for more than fifteen years. She says that over all this time her business has been very busy due to the good service and friendliness she provides her customers. She used to work alone, and now she occasionally relies on her children’s or her husband’s help. She really enjoys spending time with her family.

She feels very happy knowing that she has loan help from MFP [Microfinanzas Prisma] to keep her business going. Additionally, she promises to be timely with her payments, as she has been with previous loans. She is grateful to be a member of her communal bank since her companions are caring and responsible people.
With these 1,000 PEN [$375] she will supply her store with more clothes, which she will bring from the capital city since she can find a greater variety and better prices there.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mahuklo Group

texts.fr: MAHUKLO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres exercent leur activité dans le même marché. La représentante du groupe, Awaou (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 52 ans et est mariée à un certain Moussiliou. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un reste à leur charge. Awaou vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de treize ans, Awaou vend des cartes de recharges téléphoniques et divers produits à son domicile. Awaou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Awaou et les autres membres du groupe MAHUKLO sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
MAHUKLO is a group of three people who run their businesses in the same market.  The leader of the group, Awaou (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 52 years old and married to a man named Moussiliou.  The couple has three children, all of whom attend school and remain in their care.  Awaou lives with her children and husband.  Together, the couple meets their various household needs.  For nearly 13 years, Awaou has been selling telephone cards and various items from her home.   She gets her supplies in a market in Bénin.  This is the second time that Awaou and the other members of the MAHUKLO group have requested financial help through ALIDé in order to build up their working capital and their business, and better meet the demand of their customers.   Their previous loan has been fully repaid.

.

loans.use: to buy telephone cards.

loans.name: Leonia

texts.en: Leonia, a 56-year-old widow with seven children, has been making and selling jewelry, carving bowls, and traditional clothes to earn a living for two years. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services and is now requesting a loan to purchase more items/new handicrafts. Leonia plans to use her profits to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Samaher

texts.en:
Samaher, a young married Palestinian woman and mother to one son and one daughter. is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo, pictured in his store that sells vehicle spare parts.

For the past three years, Samaher's husband has been buying and selling vehicle spare parts, a profitable project and the family's only source of income. Because they also need more support to cover the family's needs and costs, Samaher is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help her husband purchase more spare parts to resell. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.

About Shariah-compliant lending:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase more used vehicle spare parts to resell.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee tiene 29 años, junto a su pareja Faustino, de 44 años, compraron la casa donde habitan ahora con sus dos hijas: Tania de 10 y Marilyn de un añito, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. 
Ella es una mujer muy hacendosa, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en la tienda que implementó en su vivienda hace 2 años. Tiene buenos ingresos, ya que se ubica en una zona donde hay mucha concurrencia de gente. Su labor normalmente lo realiza sola, mientras su pareja está en sus campos de cultivo. Con las labores de cada uno logran solventar los gastos de su hogar. Sin embargo, la dificultad que tiene es que no puede conservar frías las bebidas que vende por falta de un congelador, y en su zona de calor, todos solicitan las sus bebidas heladas.

Ella se siente muy agradecida con MFP por la facilidad de obtener un préstamo, pues así está segura de continuar con su trabajo. Asimismo, agradece a su banco comunal por trabajar con personas solidarias y responsables.
Con estos 2,000 nuevos soles, más sus ahorros, comprará su tan anhelada refrigeradora.
texts.en:
Haydee is twenty-nine years old. Together with her partner Faustino, who is 44 years old, she bought the house where they live with their two daughters, Tania, who is ten years old, and Marilyn, who is only one year old. They hope to provide their daughters with a better quality of life.
Haydee is a very industrious woman. She sells groceries in the store she opened in her home two years ago. She earns good income since her store is located in a spot where many people pass by. She normally works alone while her partner  is working in the fields. With each one’s work, they manage to cover their living costs. However, the problem she has is that she cannot keep the drinks she sells cold because she does not have a cooler, and in the hot region where she lives, everyone asks for cold drinks.

She feels very grateful to MFP [Microfinanzas Prisma] for help in obtaining a loan, which she is sure will help her to keep working. Likewise, she is grateful to her communal bank for working with caring and responsible people.
With these 2,000 PEN [$750], along with her savings, she will purchase the refrigerator she is anxious to have.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es:
Dionisia tiene 34 años. Su pareja es Rómulo, de 40 años. Ambos compraron un terreno donde elaboraron su casa, a base de material noble (ladrillo y cemento). Es ahí donde actualmente habitan, junto a sus dos hijos, quienes son estudiantes y a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. 

Junto a su esposo, día a día se esmeran en salir adelante, ambos tienen el deseo de que sus hijos sean profesionales y tengan un mejor futuro. Por tal motivo, hace 13 años abrieron su tienda de abarrotes en su vivienda, la cual va muy bien, ya que cuentan con buenos ingresos. Lo que más le gusta de su labor es que está con su esposo atendiendo a los clientes. Para más adelante desean que su tienda sea de venta al por mayor, pues así les generaría más ingresos para solventar la educación de sus hijos. 

Ella está muy agradecida con MFP por confiar en su trabajo. Por ello, se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago, como en anteriores ocasiones. 
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles de este préstamo comprará un saco de arroz, otro de azúcar, menestras, variedades de fideos y otros comestibles para su tienda.
texts.en:
Dionisia is thirty-four years old. Her partner is Romulo, who is forty years old. They both purchased a plot of land where they built their house with durable materials (cement and brick). They currently live there with their two children, who are students, and for whom they hope to provide a better quality of life.

Along with her husband, Dionisia takes great pains to get ahead day after day. They both hope that their children will have professional careers and a better future. To that end, they opened their grocery store thirteen years ago in their house, which is going well for them since it provides them with good earnings. What she likes best about her work is that she works with her husband while attending to her customers. In the future, they hope that their store will make wholesale sales since that would help them generate more income to cover their children’s education.

She is very grateful to MFP [Microfinanzas Prisma] for trusting in her work. She promises to make punctual loan payments as she has previously done.
With this loan of 2,000 PEN [$750], Dionisia will purchase a bag of rice, a bag of sugar, vegetables, varieties of noodles, and other foodstuffs for her store.

loans.use: purchase merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 42 years old and lives in Poblacion 4, Clarin. She is widowed with two children.  Alma has a general store that sells a variety of products.  Alma has had this business for 10 years.  Alma has requested a loan of 12,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.  

Alma has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Brígida

texts.es:
Brígida tiene 59 años, está casada con Eusebio, de 68 años. Ellos compraron su casa hace 25 años, donde ahora viven con sus cuatro hijos.
Ella es una mujer que le gusta progresar, años atrás le enseñaron a vender ropa en una tienda donde trabajaba cuando era muy jovencita. Es así como se motivó a abrir su propio negocio, ya que le gustaba atender a los clientes y ayudarles a escoger las mejores prendas. Esta labor la lleva realizando hace 25 años, con la ayuda de su esposo, y gracias a sus ganancias puede educar a sus hijos.

Brígida está muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero de MFP, pues así se siente segura de avanzar con su negocio. En su banco comunal está satisfecha de tener compañeros activos y solidarios.  
Con los 3,000 nuevos soles de este préstamo se abastecerá de más ropa para aumentar la mercadería de su tienda.
texts.en:
Brigida is 59 years old and married to Eusebio, who is 68 years old. They purchased their house, where they currently live with their four children,  twenty-five years ago.
She is a woman who likes to move forward. Years ago, she learned to sell clothes in the store where she worked when she was very young. This experience motivated her to open her own business since she likes to attend to her customers and help them to chose the best clothes. She has been doing this work for twenty-five years with her husband’s help. Thanks to her earnings she has been able to educate her children.

Brigida is very grateful for MFP’s [Microfinanza Prisma’s] financial support, which has helped her to feel safe about moving forward with her business. She is satisfied to have active and caring companions in her communal bank.
With this loan of 3,000 PEN [$1125], she will supply her store with more clothes to increase the merchandise available in her store.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell in her store.

loans.name: Simaima

texts.en:
Simaima is a 39-year-old, married woman with five children. She makes and sells cafeteria foods in her community to earn a living. She has four years of experience with this business. 

Simaima needs a loan to buy sacks of flour and sugar for her food-stall business. She plans to use her profits to to make improvements to her house. Simaima has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour and sugar for her food-stall business.

loans.name: Luafulu

texts.en:
Luafulu is 45 years old and married with eight children. She runs a small business selling Samoan cocoa in her community. She has been doing this for three years. 

Luafulu has requested a loan to buy Samoan cocoa, plastic cups, etc. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Luafulu will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy Samoan cocoa, plastic cups, etc. for her small business.

loans.name: Faatalatala

texts.en: Faatalatala is 35 years old and married with three children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for two years. Faatalatala has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, baking powder, etc. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Faatalatala will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, baking powder, plastic bags, etc.

loans.name: Punauli

texts.en:
Punauli is 27 years old and married with one child. She runs a small business selling soft drinks in her community. She has been doing this for three years. 

Punauli has requested a loan to buy a sack of sugar, syrups, etc. for her business. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Punauli will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a sack of sugar, syrups, etc. for her soft drinks business.

loans.name: Mahudjro Group

texts.fr: MAHUDJRO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Marthe (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à un certain Samuel. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge.  Marthe vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Afin de contribuer aux divers dépenses de la maison, Marthe vend depuis près de quinze ans, des bouteilles dans un marché du Benin.  Marthe achète ses produits dans certaines villes du Bénin. C’est la première fois que, Marthe et les autres membres du groupe MAHUDJRO sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
Mahudjro is a group of three people who all live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is called Marthe (pictured with her hand raised in the photo), and she is 35 years of aged and married to Samuel. The couple has four children, all at school and all under their care. Marthe lives with her husband and her children, and together the couple covers the various household expenses. 

To contribute to paying the different household expenses, Marthe has worked for almost 15 years selling bottles in a market in Benin. She buys her products in certain towns located in Benin. This is the first time that Marthe and the other members of the Mahudjro group have requested the financial support of Alidé. They have done so to increase their working capital and boost their business, and to better meet the needs of their customers.

loans.use: To buy bottles.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy 500 kilos of onion seeds and 40 kilos of chemical fertilizers, hire a pump to water her onions and pay her labor expenses.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo was born in New York City shortly after his parents immigrated to the United States from Cuba. Since childhood, he has relocated to Georgia where he and his brother opened a re-modeling business that serves both residential and corporate customers. His brother, an Iraq war veteran and member of the active duty U.S. Army, remains a partner in his business but does not work there full time. 

Eduardo recognized a need for these services in his Georgia community and remains proud of the fact that, despite obvious challenges, the business showed profit after only its first year. The company has employed more than ten part-time workers and currently has one full-time employee. 

This loan will be used to purchase supplies and equipment in order to better serve customers and expand the services offered. Inspired by his brother, Eduardo hopes to expand the business into new markets and reach out to help local veterans.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 45 años, su esposo es Eugenio, de 53 años. Fruto de esa unión tienen tres hijos, a quienes les brindan amor y una buena educación. 
Tiene una tienda de abarrotes, la cual implementó en su misma vivienda hace 6 años, y junto a su esposo realizan la atención de los clientes. Este negocio les es muy rentable, ya que siempre tienen buenos ingresos a pesar de tener competencia. La amabilidad y la buena atención que brindan hacen que la gente siempre regrese. Y desde que María conoció de MFP, han usado los créditos para ir creciendo con su tienda. 

Ella está muy comprometida con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, pues es muy responsable. Así también como lo son sus compañeros de banco comunal, por ellos se siente contenta.
Con estos 1,000 nuevos soles, más sus ahorros, se abastecerá de mercadería para incrementar el stock de su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
María is a 45-year-old woman. Her husband is Eugenio, age 53. From this union they have three children, to whom they provide love and a good education. 
 
She has a grocery store, which she set up in her own home 6 years ago. She and her husband work together to serve the customers. This business is very profitable for them, since they always have good income in spite of the fact that they have competition. The friendliness and good service they provide ensure that the people always come back. And since María found out about MFP, they have utilized the loans to continue growing with their store. 

She is very committed to making her loan payments punctually, since she is very responsible. The same is true of her fellow members in the communal bank, and so she is very happy with them. 

With these 1,000 Peruvian new soles, in addition to her savings, she will stock up on merchandise to increase the inventory of her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more food products to stock her store.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Notre emprunteur s’appelle Aminata. Elle  est mariée et mère de 3 enfants âgés respectivement de 5, 7 et 10 ans. Aminata est âgée de 46 ans. Elle s’active dans la vente de légumes .Elle vend aussi le petit déjeuner. Elle a acquis une expérience de plus de 10ans dans ce domaine .Elle démarre sa journée à 7h 30mn du matin pour la terminer à 20h 30mn. Après avoir vendu le petit déjeuner  le matin, elle part étaler sa table ou elle vend des fruits : mangues, pastèques, pommes, bananes. Elle est à son 4ème crédit qui va lui servir à améliorer son stock aussi bien pour les condiments dont elle a besoin pour faire la restauration  que pour les fruits.
Madame Aminata s’occupe des petits besoins de ses enfants et participe à la dépense  quotidienne du foyer. 
Elle a comme projet futur d’ouvrir un grand restaurant  avec l’appui des institutions financières comme l’IMCEC.
texts.en:
This borrower is called Aminata. She is married and a mother of three children aged five, seven and ten. She is 46 years of age, and works selling vegetables. She also sells breakfasts. 

Aminata has over ten years’ experience in this business. She starts her day at 7:30 am, and finishes at 8:30 pm. After selling breakfasts in the morning, she sets up her table where she sells fruit – mangos, watermelons, apples and bananas. 

This is her fourth loan, which will be used to increase her stock, as well as to buy the seasonings she needs to cook the products she sells and to buy fruits. Aminata is responsible for her children’s needs, and pays her part towards the daily household expenses. In the future she plans to open a large restaurant with the support of financial institutions like IMCEC.

loans.use: To buy fruits for resale and seasoning to prepare breakfasts for sale.

loans.name: Mouhamadou Lamine

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mouhamadou Lamine âgé de 26 ans, est un jeune électricien de profession depuis 6 ans. Il est célibataire sans  enfant. Il est à sa première expérience  de crédit et a du recourir à l’IMCEC pour acquérir du matériel électrique  et s’engager à fond dans les chantiers qu’on lui confie. Pour cela il sollicite un crédit de 150000F CFA.
Il n’a pas de charges et toute son énergie, il veut le consacrer à sa carrière : travailler afin de disposer de sa propre société formelle et reconnue. Cela lui permettra de pouvoir gagner plus de marché et de gagner la confiance  des particuliers.
texts.en:
Mouhamadou Lamine is 26 years of age. He is young and an electrician by profession, and has been for the past six years. He is single and has no children. 

This is his first experience with loans, and he has requested financing from IMCEC to buy electrical materials and get fully involved in the projects entrusted to him.  He has therefore requested a loan of 150,000 francs CFA.

He has no expenses and wants to dedicate all his energy to his career, working so that he can eventually have his own formal and well-known company. This will allow him to win a greater share of the market, and to gain the trust of private customers.

loans.use: To buy electrical materials for his job.

loans.name: Sua

texts.en:
Sua is a 48-year-old, married woman with three children. 

She has a small plantation on which she grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Sua has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a plant sprayer, taro crops, gloves, etc. for her farming business.

Sua has been a member of SPBD since 2009. With her profits, Sua hopes to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a plant sprayer, taro crops, gloves, etc. for her farming business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 58 years old and lives in Basirang,Tudela. She is married with three children. 

Virginia has a general store where she sells a variety of products. She has had this business for seven years. Virginia has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. for her store.

Virginia has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Virginia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. for her store.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Madame Fatou est une dame âgée de 54 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont l’ainé a 18 ans et le cadet, 10. Elle exerce le noble métier d’enseignante arabe  comme on la voie sur la photo, avec la correction de sa tenue. Elle a opté pour  apprendre aux touts petits dès leur bas âge de bien connaitre leur foi. Seulement, elle ne se limite pas à cela, elle fait aussi de l’élevage de poulets de chair depuis 3ans déjà. Fatou sollicite un crédit de 75000 FCA pour acheter des poussins et de l’aliment volaille car elle a une clientèle à satisfaire.
Avec les revenus de ses deux activités, elle réussi  à gérer sa famille. Elle aimerait dans l’avenir agrandir son poulailler afin d’augmenter son exploitation.
texts.en:
Fatou is a 54-year-old woman, and is married with four children. Her oldest child is 18, and the youngest is ten. She has the noble job of working as an Arabic teacher, as can be seen in the photo where she is wearing the correct dress. She decided to teach children from a young age to understand their faith well. She did not limit herself to this, however, and has also raised broiler chickens for the past three years.  

Fatou has requested a loan of 75,000 francs CA to buy chicks and chicken feed, as she has to meet her customers’ needs. With the income she obtains from her two businesses, she manages to help her family get ahead. She would like to expand her chicken coop so that she can increase her production.

loans.use: To buy chicks to raise and then sell.

loans.name: Richer

texts.en:
Richer is 29 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. He is single with one child. Richer is a security guard and earns approximately 3,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan to be used for constructing a house. 

Richer has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for one year. In the future, Richer hopes to start a business.

loans.use: to construct a house

loans.name: Teófilo

texts.es:
Teófilo tiene 47 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y gracias a ello, hace 13 años, compró un terreno en el que construyó su casa a base de madera. Ahora vive allí junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos.
Su actividad es la producción de cacao, labor que realiza hace 23 años en su propia parcela, la cual pudo comprar con el apoyo de sus padres. Su trabajo lo hace con la ayuda de su esposa o de sus hijos, pero en los tiempos de cosecha contrata jornaleros para extraer los frutos de manera rápida.  Después, los comercializa en los centros de acopio, quienes le grafican un muy buen precios por cada kilo. Las ganancias de su cosecha las invierte en el mantenimiento de sus cultivos y en los gastos escolares de sus hijos, como también en la alimentación diaria de su familia.

Teófilo agradece el apoyo financiero que le brinda MFP, ya que gracias a ello podrá cumplir con sus objetivos. Además, le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son responsables. Con los 3,500 nuevos soles de este préstamo comprará sacos de abono natural para mantener fértiles sus plantas de cacao.
texts.en:
Teofilo is 47 years old. He is a very hard-working man. Thirteen years ago, he purchased a plot of land where he built a house out of wood. He currently lives there with his wife and three children.

He produces cocoa on his plot of land, which he has been doing for twenty-three years. He was able to purchase the land with his parents’ help. He works with the help of his wife and children, but during the harvest he hires workers to pick the cocoa beans more quickly. Later, he sells them at collection centers where he receives a good price per pound. He invests the earnings from his harvest in the maintenance of his crops and in his children’s school expenses. He also uses them to feed his family on a daily basis.

Teofilo is grateful for the financial support that MFP [Microfinanzas Prisma] provides him since he will be able to achieve his goals with it. Additionally, he is grateful to be a part of his communal bank because each of its members are responsible. With the 3,500 PEN [$1325] loan, he will purchase bags of natural fertilizer to keep his cocoa fields fertile.

loans.use: to purchase natural fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Valu

texts.en: Valu is a 49-year-old married woman with nine children.  She has a small plantation and grows bananas and taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year. Valu has requested a loan to buy new chemicals and other supplies for her business.  She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Valu hopes to start a business to help her children and expand her home.

loans.use: to buy new chemicals and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Mariefel

texts.en:
Mariefel is married and has one child. She is 26 years old and lives in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Mariefel is a farmer and grows coconuts to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers for her farm.
 
Mariefel has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Mariefel hopes to acquire an additional parcel of coco land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Marjie

texts.en:
Marjie is 24 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has two children. 

Marjie has a general store that sells consumable products. She has had this business for three years. 

She requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Marjie has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Marjie hopes to engage in another type of business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Luisita

texts.en:
Luisita is 42 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has four children.
 
To earn a living, Luisita has a business selling dried fish. She earns about PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. 

Luisita has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to buy additional dried fish to sell.

Luisita has been a member of PMPC for 11 years. In the future, Luisita would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 54 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has five children.
 
Paulina has a window grills and metal craft fabrication business and earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing steel bars, steel plates and other materials for the metal craft fabrication. 

Paulina has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Paulina hopes to expand the business

loans.use: To purchase steel bars, steel plates and other materials.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 59 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has four children. 

Carmen has a general store that sells groceries and other consumable products. She has had this business for 20 years. 

She requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to be used in purchasing stocks for her general store.

Carmen has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Carmen hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing stocks for her general store.

loans.name: Miselida

texts.es:
Misélida tiene 60 años, es una mujer buena, amable y sobre todo muy trabajadora. Está separada del que fue su pareja por muchos años y con quien tuvo cuatro hijos, quienes ya son mayores e independientes. Vive únicamente con Diana, su hija de 37 años, en su casa propia, la que pudo comprar con bastante esfuerzo y muchos años de ahorro.

Misélida es una mujer multifacética y con visión de negocio, ya que desarrolla varios negocios de acuerdo a la temporada. Entre las actividades que realiza está la compra y venta de granos como maíz, frijoles y kúdzu. Así mismo, en ocasiones especiales o en fechas de celebración, vende ropa. Sin embargo, su principal actividad es la venta de comida, ya que le encanta cocinar, por ello no duda en preparar y poner a la venta, todos los días, el delicioso pollo con papas fritas o comúnmente llamado “salchipollo”, el cual acompaña con una buena porción de arroz; este platillo se ha convertido en el favorito de toda su clientela. Trabaja sola desde que se inició en esta actividad, hace aproximadamente 6 años y desde entonces ha visto, con gran emoción, el proceso de crecimiento por el que ha tenido que pasar para consolidarse en la preferencia del público.
Para el futuro de su negocio espera tener un restaurante, donde pueda vender todo el día y con mayor tranquilidad la comida que prepara, porque actualmente sólo lo hace por la noches, aunque ya ha ganado experiencia en este trabajo siente que todavía le sigue siendo difícil atender a todos los clientes que tiene; no obstante espera que todo el esfuerzo que realiza produzca buenos frutos, como hasta ahora, ya que lo único que desea es seguir adelante.

Este es el crédito número 10 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Asimismo, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, como lo hizo en anteriores créditos. Y además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 2500) comprará ingredientes, insumos y utensilios de cocina para continuar preparando su platillo más solicitado y con el que tiene muy contento a todos sus comensales.
texts.en:
Misélida, age 60, is a good woman who is friendly and hardworking. She has been separated from her partner for many years and has four children who are already grown and independent. Only her 37-year-old daughter Diana lives with her. Misélida owns her house, which she bought with great effort and after many years of saving.

She is a multi-faceted woman who has a vision for business. Misélida has developed different ventures according to the season. One of her businesses is buying and selling basic staples such as corn, beans, and kudzu. On a few special occasions or on celebration dates, she will sell clothing. However, her main business activity is selling food since she enjoys cooking. She has no hesitation in preparing and selling food every day, especially the delicious dish of chicken and fried potatoes commonly known as “salchipollo”, which is served with a healthy portion of rice. This dish has become a favorite among all her customers. Misélida has worked alone ever since she started her business six years ago. She still gets excited about the process of growth that she has had to go through in order to earn the public’s trust.

In the future, Misélida hopes to have a restaurant where she can sell all day and be able to prepare food in much calmer conditions since she currently works alone and into the night. Even though she has gained experience through her work, Misélida still finds it difficult to serve all of her customers. She expects all of her efforts to result in a fruitful outcome, just like in past experiences, so this is the only thing that drives her to press forward.

This is her 10th loan with MFP. Misélida is very pleased to know that she has financial backing and feels more confident about advancing in her work. At the same time, she promises once again to complete her payments just as she did with her previous loans. She is glad to be part of her Communal Bank since all of the members are responsible and supportive. The amount of 2,500 PEN that she requested will be used to buy ingredients, supplies, and cooking utensils so that she can continue preparing her most requested dish and keep all of her customers happy.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, supplies, and cooking utensils.

loans.name: Glenrose

texts.en:
Glenrose is married and has four children. Glenrose is 33 years old and lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Glenrose has an appliance display center business to earn a living. She has had this business for six years. Each month, she earns 19,000 PHP doing this work. 

She has requested a loan for 20,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her appliance display center.

Glenrose has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Glenrose hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her appliance center.

loans.name: Koreti

texts.en: Koreti is a 42-year-old married woman with six children. She makes and sells food in her canteen in the community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. Koreti needs a loan to buy packs of chicken, mutton flaps, cucumbers, plastic plates, etc. She plans to use her profits to improve her house. Koreti has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy packs of chicken, mutton flaps, cucumbers, plastic plates, etc.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is widowed and has two children. Grace is 40 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, Grace has a sand quarrying business. She has had this business for 12 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 7,000. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase equipment for her quarrying business. Grace has been a member of PMPC for five years. 

In the future, Grace hopes to engage in another type of business.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for her quarrying business.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is married and has nine children. Leonila is 55 years old and lives in San Isidro, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Leonila owns a general store to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns 1,500 PHP doing this work. 

She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Leonila has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Leonila hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

location.town: Liloy-San Isidro, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is a single woman with two children, aged 3 and 11 . She describes herself as an ambitious woman. She operates a farm and a restaurant, where she sells food and beverages. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of food ingredients. She will use the 80,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) loan to buy products for her farm. Her business goal is to run a green house within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy land and build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy products for her farm

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 49 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has three children. 

Juliet has a hog fattening business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to be used to purchase feed for her hog fattening business.
 
Juliet has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Juliet hopes to purchase additional piglets.

loans.use: To buy feed.

loans.name: Nonvignon 3 Group

texts.fr: NONVIGNON 3 est un groupe constitué de trois personnes dont la représentante (dont le doigt est levé sur la photo) se nomme Marie-Claire. Les membres du groupe résident dans le même quartier. Ce groupe sollicite un premier crédit en vue de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d'augmenter leur chiffre d'affaire. Âgée de 39 ans, Marie-Claire a peu fréquenté et est mariée à un certain Marius. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Marie-Claire vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Il y a environs quinze ans que Marie-Claire exerce comme activité, la vente de tissus et des cartes de recharge téléphoniques à son domicile et par le système de distribution. Ce qui lui permet de subvenir sans grande difficulté aux besoins familiaux. Marie-Claire s’approvisionne au Mali et chez les opérateurs économiques du Bénin. Marie-Claire et les autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON 3 sollicitent un financement auprès de ALIDé, afin d'agrandir son activité et d'accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu.
texts.en:
NONVIGNON 3 is a group consisting of three people whose representative (whose finger is raised in the photo) is named Marie-Claire. The members of the group live in the same neighborhood. This group is requesting a first loan in order to raise the level of their business and increase their turnover. 39 years old, Marie-Claire went to school very little and is married to a certain Marius. The couple has three children, all in school and under their care. Marie-Claire lives together with her children and her husband. The couple takes care of the diverse family responsibilities together. 

For about 15 years Marie-Claire has been in business selling fabric and phonecards from her home and through the distribution system, which allows her to meet the family needs without great difficulty. Marie-Claire gets her supplies in Mali and from the economic operators of Bénin. Marie-Claire and the other members of the NONVIGNON 3 group are requesting a loan from ALIDé, in order to expand their business and grow their turnover and income.

loans.use: to buy fabric and phonecards.

loans.name: Mahuglo Group

texts.fr: MAHUGLO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Mathilde Assiwavi (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 28 ans et est mariée à un certain Martin. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Mathilde Assiwavi vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Mathilde Assiwavi assure ensemble avec son mari, les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de six ans, Mathilde Assiwavi vend des balais, des nattes et des paniers de façon ambulante et à son domicile. Mathilde Assiwavi s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Mathilde Assiwavi et les autres membres du groupe MAHUGLO sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
MAHUGLO is a group of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is Mathilde Assiwavi, age 28, seen with her hand raised in the photo. Mathilde Assiwavi is married to a man named Martin. The couple have two dependent children who both go to school. Mathilde Assiwavi lives with her husband and children, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. 

Mathilde Assiwavi has been selling brooms, mats and baskets door-to-door and from her home for almost six years. She buys her stock at a market in Benin.

Mathilde Assiwavi and the other group members are seeking their first loan from ALIDé to strengthen their working capital and bolster their activity to better meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy brooms, mats and baskets for resale.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Francisco, se dedica a la venta de artículos del hogar, vive con su esposa y un hijo que aún esta pequeño y depende económicamente, el inicio su negocio desde hace dos años, pues le gusta mucho el comercio y su rama de venta son los artículos del hogar.
Solicita un préstamo para poderlo invertir en adquisición de nuevos productos como planchas, paraguas, controles de televisión, zapaterías, y otros productos, que son bienes necesarios en los hogares de sus clientes, este préstamo le ayudara a  poder iniciar una nueva inversión se reproduzca mayores ingresos y que su clientela se encuentre satisfecha.
Su aspiración es poderse superar en el comercio, tener un negocio propio en un local donde tenga afluencia de clientes, ya que le permitirá estar más cerca de su familia y tener una condición más estable.
texts.en:
Francisco sells household goods. He lives with his wife and young son who is still a financial dependent. Francisco started his business two years ago since he enjoys the retail trade, especially the sale of household goods. He is requesting a loan so that he can invest in the acquisition of new products such as irons, umbrellas, television remote controls, shoes, and other products that are necessary household items for his customers. This loan will help him make a new investment so that he can generate more income and keep his customers satisfied.

His aspiration is to excel in his trade and to have his own business in a location where there is more customer traffic. This would allow him to be closer to his family and have more stable conditions.

loans.use: to buy irons, umbrellas, television remote controls, and shoes.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María tiene 40 años, su pareja es Julio, de 52 años, y con él logró comprar la casa donde viven ahora con sus tres hijos.
Ella es una mujer muy laboriosa. Su actividad es la venta de rollos plástico, así como también vende platos, vasos, ollas, cubiertos, entre otros utensilios para el hogar. Esta labor la realiza en su vivienda desde hace 9 años y comenta que le va muy bien. Le gusta mucho su labor, para ella no hay dificultad alguna, el problema es cuando se va quedando sin mercadería.

Desde que supo de los créditos de MFP le han servido para el crecimiento de su negocio, y esta vez no es la excepción. Por lo que siempre es responsable de pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, para no perjudicar la confianza puesta en ella, por la institución, ni por sus compañeros de banco comunal.
Con estos 2,000 nuevos soles comprará más de la mercadería que ofrece, pues ya tiene muy poca.
texts.en:
María is 40 years old. She lives with her partner Julio, who is 52, and their three children. María and Julio managed to buy the house they live in.

María is a very hardworking woman. Her business consists of selling plastic rolling pins, plates, glasses, cooking pots, cutlery and other household utensils. She has worked from home for nine years and says the business is going very well. She really enjoys her work and has no problems except for when she runs out of stock. 

Since she found out about MFP loans she has used them to grow her business and this time is no exception. María always makes her payments on time. She knows that both MFP and her partners in the communal bank trust her and she doesn’t want to jeopardise this trust. She will use this loan of 2000 PEN to buy more merchandise to sell, since she currently has very little.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her small business selling plastic and household items.

loans.name: Ngik's Group

texts.en:
Ngik is 59 years old. She is a mother of six children, two of whom are still dependent on her and work as paid workers. She resides with her husband in the Thmor Koul district of Cambodia. Ngik has been working in rice farming for nearly forty years. She earns approximately KHR 47,500 per day to support her family and is able to save around 12,000 KHR each day.

Ngik's group consists of two female members. This is the first loan for her group with VisionFund. She is leading her group to apply for a loan of 500,000 KHR each. 

As the group leader, she wants to use her portion to spend for land plowing for rice farming. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income from her business to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for land plowing for rice farming.

loans.name: Vannak's Group

texts.en:
Vannak is 29 years old. She is married and has three children, one daughter and two sons, all of whom are still in her burden and in school. 

She is a rice farmer on five hectares of farmland. Having been farming rice for seven years, she is able to earn around KHR 34,000 per day from her current business to support her family.    

This is the first loan for Vannak's group of three female members, who live in the same village located in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. The group is now applying for a loan of KHR 500,000 each with VisionFund. 

Vannak, who is the leader, is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for land plowing. She hopes this loan will help her earn a larger income to improve her lifestyle and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her rice field.

loans.name: Morn's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Thmor Koul distict of Cambodia, Morn is 69 years old and married with nine children, two of whom are dependent on her. Only one of her dependent children is still in school. 

She has been involved in rice farming on four hectares for just one year. She can earn around KHR 13,000 per day from her current business. A lack of working capital remains her challenge to support her business.
