Morn has been with VisionFund for two cycles and successfully paid back the loans, while the others of her group have been with VisionFund for one to two cycles. The past loans have helped Morn afford to buy household necessities for her family. 

To solve her challenge, she is now leading her group of three female members to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for the farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice healthfully and sell it for a good price so as to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for farmland.

loans.name: Zef

texts.en:
Zef is in his late fifties, married and a father of three children ranging from thirty to twenty years of age. For the past sixteen years, he has been in the poultry business, raising turkeys. "The main hardship in the beginning in this type of business, " he says, "was that Albanians were not very aware of the benefits of white lean meats. The difficulties of expanding this business and not being able to make a good profit out of it, went on for some years. But I was persistent because I just loved it; and I am glad I did. " 

Note here that lately, things have changed in Albania and people take more care of their health compared to before and of course, they try to eat lean and use products from their own country most of the time. 

Zef is requesting a loan to use it for buying feed for turkeys because the demand for what he offers has grown rapidly the last years. He also plans to buy 200-300 baby turkeys. 

Zef has been an excellent VF Albania client for some time now. He has been able to establish a large clientele and has successfully paid off the previous loans. 

He is seeking your help in this matter.

loans.use: To buy 200-300 baby turkeys and feed for them

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, représente et secrétaire du groupe de crédit  Alleluya , qui lève la main sur la photo, âgée de 41 ans, mère de 8 enfant qui vont tous  à l’école (d'autres a l’université). Son mari est fait aussi de petit commerce. Elle a commencé son petit commerce de divers  avec son fond propre. Plus tard, elle a adhéré dans le programme de microcrédit de l’IMF Hekima. Elle s’installe régulièrement dans le petit marché du quartier localement  surnommé Trois paillotes - Axe Katindo où elle vend ses produits divers. Avec ce nouveau crédit, elle va acheter 10 casiers de Fanta, farine, savon de lessive Omo, huile , etc. Elle vend également du pétrole à  domicile pour augmenter ses revenus.  Dit elle, elle  souhaite obtenir plus des crédits pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et  construire une maison  pour sa famille. Elle remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  les crédits  qu’elle reçoit régulièrement sans aucune garantie matérielle car grâce à ces crédits, elle se payait des ustensiles de cuisine et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, et ses enfants étudient confortablement.
texts.en:
The client (raising her hand in the photo) is the leader of the credit association Alleluya.  She is on her fourth loan cycle. She is 41 years old and the mother of 8 children who all attend school. Her husband is a university student.

She started her small retail business using her own funds.  Later on, she joined the microfinance institution Hekima and its micro-credit program.  She regularly displays her various goods at a small market located in her neighborhood, and locally known as the Trois paillotes - Axe Katindo market.

With this loan, Amani will buy 10 crates of Fanta, some flour, Omo soap detergent, oil etc.  

She also sells oil (petroleum) from home to supplement her income.  

She says that she would like to receive additional credit in order to increase her turnover and build a house for her family.  

She thanks the microfinance institution Hekima for granting her loans without requesting any material collateral.  It is indeed thanks to these loans that she has been able to buy kitchen utensils and to take care of her family's needs, and that her children can study comfortably.

loans.use: to buy 10 crates of Fanta, some flour, Omo laundry soap, oil etc.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is a married woman. She has two children, ages 5 and 7 years. She describes herself to be a diligent woman. 

She operates a retail stall where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located within a market and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the poor road network, hence making it difficult to access the clothes retail stall business. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more clothes for selling. Her business goal is to venture into a retail shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will run many retail shops in major towns.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for selling.

loans.name: Yeng's Group

texts.en:
Yeng is aged 39 and married. She lives with her husband and earns a living through farming one hectare of rice and planting 1.5 hectares of maize as the family's main source of income. She does not have a child yet. 

Having been in this business for almost nineteen years, she is able to earn around 7,700K HR per day to make a living. A lack of working capital is her main challenge for her business.

This is the second loan for Yeng's group of four members who live in the same village located in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. 

To solve the challenge, she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to purchase rice seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for land preparation. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase crop yields and earn a larger income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Cheth's Group

texts.en:
Cheth, aged 53, resides in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is a married mother of four children, two are dependents and only one is still in school. Rice farming has been the main source of her family's income for almost twenty years. Now she farms on three hectares of farmland earning around 22,000 Riel (KHR) per day to support her family. The main challenge for her is the lack of working capital to support her business. 

This is the fourth loan for Cheth with VisionFund; she completely paid back the past three loans, which have enabled her better support her family and rice farming business. To address her funding challenges, she is leading her group of four female members to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 Riel (KHR) each.

As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds and use a portion of it to pay for plowing land for rice farming. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice in a healthy way, increase crop yields so as to earn more income, and to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Oun is 26 and married. She has only one son who is too young to attend school. She earns a living through farming rice on five hectares of farmland. She has been involved in rice farming for six years, earning a daily income of around 11,000 Riel (KHR) per day. She is able to save around 6,000 KHR each day. 

This is the second loan for Oun's group of two members with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. The first loan has helped her better support her family. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan of 500,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to grow rice and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Ayidote 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AYIDOTE 1 est formé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Pauline est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Pauline est âgée de 44 ans. C’est la sixième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Pauline est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Jean. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés, et tous à leur charge. Pauline vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Il y a près de dix huit ans que Pauline mène comme activité, la vente de nourriture (Sauce faite à base de viande de porc accompagnée de pâte de farine de manioc) à son domicile afin de contribuer aux divers besoins de sa famille. Pauline s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Pauline désire obtenir un autre crédit, ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The AYIDOTE 1 group consists of three women who are friends and belong to the same savings group.  

The group's representative, Pauline, is the one raising her hand in the photo.  She is 44 years old.

It is the sixth time that this group is requesting financial assistance from ALIDé in order to increase its level of activity.

Pauline is married to a carpenter named Jean.  They have four children, some of whom go to school, and all of them their dependents.  Pauline lives with her children and her husband.  The couple jointly takes care of the household expenses.

Pauline has been selling food for almost eighteen years (she sells a sauce prepared with pork meat and paste made with cassava flour).  She sells from home and contributes to her family's various needs.  She buys her supplies locally.

In order to increase her stock of supplies, and to better meet her customers' demand, Pauline would like to receive a new loan, along with the other members of her group.  Previous loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy pork meat and cassava flour.

loans.name: Ayidote Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AYIDOTE est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Mireille, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Mireille est âgée de 29 ans et a peu fréquenté l’école. Mireille est mariée à un certain Michel. Le couple a un enfant scolarisé et à leur charge. Mireille vit ensemble avec son enfant et son mari. Mireille assure ensemble avec son mari, les charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Mireille vend de la nourriture (mélange de riz et de haricot), des plastiques et des ustensiles de cuisine de façon ambulante et par le système de distribution depuis près de dix ans. Mireille s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le souci de renforcer davantage son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Mireille désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Mireille sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AYIDOTE, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
AYIDOTE is a group of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is Mireille, seen with her hand raised in the photo. This is the group’s first time seeking financial assistance from ALIDé to bolster their activities. 

Mireille, age 29, received little schooling. She is married to a man named Michel. The couple have one dependent child who goes to school. Mireille lives with her husband and their child, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. 

Mireille has been selling food (a mix of rice and beans), plastic wares and kitchen utensils for almost ten years. She conducts her sales door-to-door through the distribution system. She buys her merchandise at a market in Benin.

Mireille wants to replenish her stock to strengthen her working capital and better meet customer demand. To that end, she and the other members of the group AYIDOTE are seeking their first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy plastic wares and kitchen utensils for resale.

loans.name: C7807 Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.en:
Pascal is 31 years old and married with five children between the ages of 2 years and 12 years old. He sells various goods such as sugar, biscuits, lotions, and soap. Pascal is a leader of this group, which is called "C7807 ABISHYIZEHAMWE" in the local language. In the photo, he's the one raising his hand. He works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily, except weekends. Pascal has 10 years of experience in this work. 

Pascal has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save money for his future and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase various goods for resale.

loans.name: Sophea's Group

texts.en:
Aged 40, Sophea is a married mother of two dependent children who are still in school. She lives in a village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. To make a living, she has been farming rice and planting maize for almost twenty years, earning a daily income of around 9,400 Riel (KHR).  She is facing a lack of working capital to support her business. 

Sophea's group consists of four members who all are female. This is the second loan for Sophea's group with VisionFund. She is leading her group to apply for a loan of 1,200,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy rice seeds and pay for land preparation. She hopes to increase her crop yield and earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sour's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village located in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Sour is aged 35 years and married with three children who are still dependent on her and in school. 

Like other villagers, maize planting is her main source of the family's income to support the family. To better support her family, sometimes she works for others for pay. She has been in her business for almost sixteen years and earns a daily income of around 8,300 KHR per day. 

This is the second loan for Sour's group of four female members who reside in the same village. They successfully paid back the previous loan with VisionFund. The first loan has helped Sour better support her business and family. 

She is now requesting a loan with her group members of 1,200,000 KHR each. Sour, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labor. 

With this loan, she hopes to make more income so as to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Marie Gaudence

texts.en: Marie Gaudence is 26 years old. She has two children aged one and seven. She owns a boutique (small store) and has been selling different products such as rice, cooking oil and others. With the loan, she will buy more tomato sauce, rice, and cooking oil for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more tomato sauce, rice, and cooking oil for sale

loans.name: San Juan Bosco Group

texts.es:
El comite San Juan Bosco se formo en el año 2009 las señoras se encuentran muy entusiasmada y desean  seguir haciendo actividades para mejorar sus estilos de vida y también ayudar a sus familias. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y con un gran espíritu de superación.
La señora Natividad es una de las miembros del grupo, y cuenta que siempre pone gran empeño en todo lo que hace, ya que por medio de su despensa puede ayudar a su familia. Natividad es una persona con gran carisma y buena predisposición, por lo que llegara lejos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, lácteos, carnes, verduras y otros insumos para poder tener bien surtido su negocio y seguir ofreciendo buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The 'San Juan Bosco' committee was formed in 2009.  The ladies who belong to this committee are very keen and would like to continue working in order to improve their lifestyles and help their families.  They are very hard-working women who have a great desire to do well in life.

Natividad is one of the members of this group.  She says that she always puts a lot of determination into everything she does because it is through her grocery store that she is able to help her family.  Natividad is a very charming and willing person who, for this reason, will go far.  She is requesting this loan to buy drinks, dairy products, meat, vegetables and other products so that she can keep her business well stocked and continue offering a good variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy drinks, dairy products, meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.es:
Inocencia tiene 43 años, está casada hace más de 20 años con el Sr. Carlos de 47 años, tienen 5 hijos,  2  en edad escolar y 3 ya son  mayores de edad, que trabajan de forma independiente.
La Sra.  Inocencia y su marido empezaron a trabajar en la Argentina durante muchos años, es ahí donde juntaron el dinero para poder volver a su país y construir  una casa propia que tanto soñaban, y fue así como hace mas de 10 años montaron una pequeña despensa y carnicería en dicho hogar. Actualmente la Sra. atiende en la despensa mientras el Sr. Carlos trabaja en una casa comercial como chofer y así ayuda a su Sra. con los gastos del hogar, además de solventar los gastos de sus hijos en las universidades.
Ahora desea comprar más productos, como ser bebidas y artículos de primera necesidad como: Harina, yerba, fideos  arroz y otros con lo cual desea surtir su negocio, es por ello que solicita el préstamo a fundación Paraguaya y Kiva
texts.en:
Inocencia is 43 years old and has been married for twenty years to Carlos, who is 47. They have five children, of whom two are school-age and three are adults who work independently.

Inocencia and her husband worked in Argentina for many years until they earned enough money to return to their country and achieve their dream of building their own home, and more than ten years ago they were able to set up a small grocery and butcher shop in that home. Inocencia currently operates the grocery while Carlos works as a driver for a company in order to help his wife with the household costs, in addition to paying for their children's university expenses.

Now she wants to buy more products, such as drinks and essential goods like flour, yerba, pasta, rice and others, which she would like to use to stock her business. That is why she is requesting this loan from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy goods for her grocery store like flour, yerba mate, pasta, and rice

loans.name: Máximo

texts.es:
Máximo tiene 64 años, hace 34 años está casado con Felicitas, fruto de ese matrimonio tienen cuatro hijos, con quienes viven en la casa que lograron comprar cuando se casaron.
Él es un hombre que se esmera por dar bienestar a su familia. Hace 23 años labora como comerciante vendiendo colchones, sabanas, frazadas, ollas, vajilla y demás artículos para el hogar. Para ello implementó un espacio en su vivienda, lo que ahora es su tienda. Esta actividad la hace con la ayuda de su esposa y de sus hijos, a ellos les encanta atender  a los clientes. Gracias a este trabajo pudieron construir su casa base de material noble (ladrillo y cemento) y ahora ayudan a sus hijos en los gastos de su educación.

Con la esperanza de seguir creciendo con su negocio decidió incursionar con la metodología de créditos que tiene MFP, lo que le ha servido de mucho ayuda, así como también ser parte de un banco comunal con personas que tienen las mismas expectativas de mejora que él.
Con este dinero comprará más mercadería para su tienda, traída de la ciudad de Lima, pues allí se encuentran artículos de mejor calidad y bajos precios.
texts.en:
Máximo is 64 years old. He has been married to his wife, Felicitas, for 34 years and they have four children. They all live together in the house that Máximo and Felicitas managed to buy when they got married.

Máximo is the kind of man who puts a lot of effort into securing his family’s wellbeing. For 23 years he has worked as a salesman, selling mattresses, sheets, blankets, cooking pots, dishes and other household items. He set aside part of his house for the business – this is now his shop. His wife and children help him with the business; they love serving customers. Thanks to this work they have been able to rebuild part of the house with good-quality materials (bricks and cement) and now Máximo and Felicitas are helping to pay for their children’s education. 

Hoping to keep growing his business, Máximo decided to take out a loan with MFP, which has helped him a lot. He has also benefitted from being part of a communal bank with other people who want to improve their lives, just as he does.

He will use this loan to buy more stock for his business from the city of Lima, where there are high-quality items at low prices.

loans.use: to buy stock for his shop

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres unidas es el grupo formado por 22 mujeres de la ciudad de Caacupé, que se han unido con el ánimo de ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo unido. El grupo lleva por nombre Mujeres unidas, ya que todas ellas se unen por un futuro mejor.
Maria, la presidenta del grupo, se dedica a la venta de perfumes de todo tipo, en lo cual le va muy bien, ya que tiene muy buena clientela, pues ella siempre ofrece buena variedad y buen precio a sus clientes.
Maria quiere seguir ganando por medio de su negocio, y es por ello que solicita el crédito para la compra de perfumes de todo tipo, con lo cual quiere surtirse y tener una buena variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes. Agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo de Kiva y de Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Unidas” (Women United) communal bank is comprised of 22 women from the city of Caacupé.  They have joined together in the spirit of helping their families by working together.  The group is named Mujeres Unidas because all of them are united for a better future.

Maria, the president of the group, sells all types of perfume.  It is going very well for her because she has very good clientele.  She always offers her customers a good variety and good prices.

Maria wants to continue earning through her business.  That is why she is requesting the loan to buy all types of perfume.  She will use the perfume to stock up and to have a good variety to offer her customers.  She is grateful for the help that she is receiving from Kiva and the Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy perfume to sell.

loans.name: C7811 Abaticumugambi Group

texts.en:
Straton is 51 years old and married with four children between the ages of 7 and 28.  He takes care of three relatives. He sells rice. Straton is the leader of this group, which is called "C7811 ABATICUMUGAMBI" in the local language. In the photo, he's the one who raises up his hand.

Straton has been in this business for seven years, and he works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m every day except during the weekend. Straton has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to cultivate more rice for re-sale. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to cultivate more rice for re-sale.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is involved in the agricultural business with her family in Khashtarak village, Tavush region. With joint effort they breed cows, sheep, goats, and chickens as well. Also, Susanna and her family are engaged in gardening. 

Susanna uses part of the produced cheese, milk, eggs, meat, persimmons, grapes, potatoes, and wheat for her family's needs, and the other part she sells from her house to fellow villagers and to customers from Ijevan city as well.   

Susanna solves the needs of her family with income derived from her agricultural business. She says that breeding is a quite profitable business, so she would like to expand it. Using a 1,000,000 AMD Kiva loan, Susanna wants to buy two more cows in order to get more dairy products to sell.

Susanna is 36 years old. She is married and she has a son and a daughter, who are pupils. Susanna's husband works at school as a teacher. Her parents-in-law, who are pensioners, also live with Susanna's family.

loans.use: to buy two more cows in order to get more dairy products to sell.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino, es casado y tiene dos hijos que están en etapa escolar , viven en casa de sus suegros  ocupando una habitación con paredes de adobe y el piso de tierra, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Puerto Mejillones de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja como chofer toda la noche y por más de ocho horas y con lo poco que gana debe cubrir todos los gastos de su familia ya sean de estudios, alimentación y gastos médicos ya que tampoco cuenta con seguro medico.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de ladrillo y cemento para la construcción de un muro en la  vivienda de sus suegros para dar más seguridad a su familia más que todo en tiempos de lluvia.
El sueño de Marcelino es tener su casa propia y dar más comodidad a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Marcelinos is married and has two school age children.  They live in his mother and father-in-laws’ house.  They live a room with adobe walls and a dirt floor.  The house is in the Puerto Mejillones area of the city of La Paz.

He currently gets income from working as a driver all night for over eight hours.  With the little that he earns he needs to cover all of his family’s expenses for education, food, and medical expenses.  He does not have medical insurance.

He needs the loan to buy bricks and cement to build a wall at his in-laws’ house.  He will do this to provide his family with more security, especially when it rains.

Marcelino’s dream is to have his own house, to make his family more comfortable, and to improve their quality of life.

This is the second time he has worked together with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy bricks and cement to build a wall for more security at his in-laws’ house

loans.name: Arthur

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN RUMIYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr.Arthur; el socio continua con su negocio de academia pre universitaria, a la vez el socio es profesor del nivel secundario en uno de los colegios del Cusco, el socio es una persona bien empeñosa y responsable, el lleva ya años con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que el socio sale adelante.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de papelería para su academia.

El socio está agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This is a member of the “Hatun Rumiyoc” Communal Bank, located in the district of Wanchaq, in the province and department of Cusco. 

The member is Arthur who is continuing his business, a pre-university academy. At the same time, he is a teacher at the secondary school level in one of the 'colegios' (private schools) in Cusco. Arthur is a very diligent and responsible person. He has spent years working with his academy and it is doing well, thanks to the effort he puts into the business. As a result, Arthur is forging ahead.

Arthur is requesting a loan to buy paper products for his academy. He is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with his payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy paper products for his academy.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en: Davit earns a living by repairing cars and raising bees. Thanks to an earlier Kiva loan, he was able to expand his bee-keeping business. His two occupations have allowed him to support his family and build his own auto repair shop (he began repairing cars in his house's yard). He is now busy installing and maintaining gas cylinders in cars, and is asking for a 850,000 AMD loan to meet customer demand by buying several new cylinders and equipment for installing them. This is Davit’s fourth loan from Nor Horizon; he has never been late in making his repayments.

loans.use: to buy several gas cylinders and new equipment to install cylinders in customer cars.

loans.name: Máximo

texts.es:
Máximo tiene 55 años, es un hombre trabajador y muy responsable. Él compró un terreno donde construyó su casa, que es donde vive ahora con su esposa Marcelina, de 53 años, y sus tres hijos, quienes son el motivo de sus esfuerzos. 
Desde muy temprano, madruga para preparar las especias y condimentos que vende en el mercado de su localidad, y también ofrece algunos abarrotes. Esta labor la empezó hace 20 años y se siente muy orgulloso de realizar lo que mejor sabe hacer. Sin embargo, a veces las ganancias de su negocio no alcanzan para solventar los gastos de educación para sus hijos. Por ello, su mayor anhelo es crecer vendiendo además frutas y verduras, lo cual espera lograr en poco tiempo. 

Ahora está contento de recibir el apoyo financiero de MFP, pues viene creciendo poco a poco con cada crédito. También es parte de un banco comunal, lo que le ha servido mucho, pues aprende de las experiencias de sus compañeros.
Con estos 1,500 nuevos soles comprará abarrotes para incrementar la mercadería de su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
55-year-old Máximo is a hardworking and very responsible man. He bought a piece of land on which he built his house, and that is where he now lives with his wife Marcelina, 53, and their three children. Máximo’s children are the reason he works so hard. 

He gets up very early each day to prepare the spices and condiments that he sells at a local market. He also sells a few grocery items. He started this job 20 years ago and he is very proud of the fact that he has managed to create a business doing what he knows best. However, his income is not always enough to cover the cost of his children’s education. For this reason his greatest desire is to grow his business by expanding into selling fruit and vegetables. He hopes he will be able to do this soon. 

Máximo is pleased to be receiving financial support from MFP, because his business is gradually growing with every loan. He is also a member of a communal bank, which has been very useful, since it has allowed him to learn from other members’ experiences. 

Máximo will use this loan of 1,500 PEN to buy groceries to increase the stock available for sale on his market stall.

loans.use: to buy groceries to increase the stock available for sale on his market stall.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Modesta tiene 37 años, su pareja es Antonio, de 44 años, con quien tiene tres hijos. La casa donde viven la compraron juntos con las ganancias de su trabajo.
Ella es una mujer empeñosa, siempre está pendiente de sus campos de cultivo donde produce café y cacao. Esta labor la empezó hace 16 años y cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo, quien se encarga de realizar el mantenimiento de las plantas. La dificultad que tienen es para combatir las plagas que aquejan a sus siembras, pero al superar esto puede ver el fruto de su trabajo. Sus cosechas las comercializa en los centros de acopio de su localidad, donde le gratifican un buen precio por la buena calidad de sus granos.

Desde que supo de los créditos de MFP decidió ser parte de un banco comunal y no se arrepiente de ello, pues la ha servido para incrementar sus ganancias. Por lo que siempre ha sido responsable con sus pagos, como una forma de retribuir la confianza que ponen en ella.
Estos 1,000 nuevos soles los invertirá en la cosecha de sus plantas de café y cacao, contratando peones para la jornada.
texts.en:
Modesta is 37 years old and her partner is Antonio, 44 years old, with whom she has three children.  They bought the house where they live together with the profits of their business.

She is a hard-working woman, and is always devoted to her fields where she produces coffee and cacao.  She started this work 16 years ago and counts on the help of her husband, who takes charge of maintaining the plants.  The difficulty that they have is in combatting the pests that afflict their plants, but upon overcoming this the fruits of their labor will be seen.  She sells her harvests in the warehouse center of her region, where they are gratified by a good price due to the good quality of their grains.

From when she knew about MFP's loans, she decided to be part of the communal bank and doesn't regret it, since it has served to increase her profits.  Due to this she has always been responsible with her payments, as a form of repayment for the confidence they give her.  She will invest these 1,000 nuevos soles in the harvest of her coffee and cacao plants, hiring day laborers.

loans.use: to hire laborers for the harvest

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre de 39 años que siempre está al pendiente del bienestar de su esposa y de sus tres hijos. Juntos viven en la casa que obtuvieron gracias al trabajo y esfuerzo de él y su pareja.
Su negocio es la venta de rollos plásticos de diferentes modelos y colores. Esta actividad la empezó hace 4 años y menciona que siempre tiene clientes que acuden a su puesto. Le gusta su trabajo, y además cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, quien se encarga de la parte administrativa. 

Él esta muy agradecido con MFP y con todas las personas que confían en su trabajo y hacen posible su crédito, por lo que se compromete a ser responsable con sus pagos, como siempre lo ha sido. Es parte de un banco comunal y es algo que le ha traído muchos beneficios para su negocio.
Con el dinero de este préstamo se abastecerá de la mercadería que más solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 39 year old man who is always looking out for the well-being of his wife and their three children.  They live together in the house that they got thanks to his and his wife’s hard-work and effort. 

His business is selling different models and colors of rolls of plastic.  He started this business activity four years ago.  He says that he always has customers who come to his stand.  He likes his work, and he has his wife’s support.  She takes charge of the administrative part of the business.

He is very grateful to MFP and all of the people who have confidence in his work and make this loan possible.  He pledges to be responsible with his payments just like he always has been.

He belongs to a communal bank, and it is something that has brought him many benefits for his business.

He will use the loan to stock up on the merchandise that is most requested by his customers.

loans.use: to buy more rolls of plastic.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is 50 years old, married and the father of four children who range in age from 13 to 25 years old. Three of them attend a university. He has been a poultry farmer since 2000 and recently entered the hardware business as a way to pay for the high costs of providing a university education to three children at the same time. He operates both businesses in the city outskirts, and has requested a UGX 3,000,000 loan to buy items to sell in his hardware store. His main challenge is the difficulty of transporting items from town to his business location. Edward is an honest man, and is grateful to Ugafode for supporting him, especially when he faced challenges repaying his previous loan because his two sons had just entered their university.

loans.use: to buy stock for a new hardware store.

loans.name: Jobirjon

texts.ru: Жобиржон 34 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Он занимается животноводством. Жобиржон в основном разводит мелко - рогатый скот. В этой области он восемь лет. Кредит берет для закупа телят и коз.
texts.en: Jobirjon is 34 years old and married.  Jobirjon has four children.  He's engaged in animal husbandry. Jobirjon mostly breeds small livestock. He's been doing this business for eight years.  He's requesting this loan to purchase calves and goats.

loans.use: to purchase calves and goats

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул 39 лет, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей. Бактыгул работает преподавателем кыргызского языка в школе села Боконбаево и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается разведением скота. Начав этот бизнес в 2007 году с суммы 20,000 сом, благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний  день  Бактыгул имеет в хозяйстве 2 коровы и 30 овец, также 2,08 га орошаемой земли, где она выращивает картофель и эспарцет, служащий кормом для скота.  Ежемесячный доход от хозяйства составляет сумму около 10,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бактыгул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Бактыгул планирует вложить в увеличение хозяйства, чтобы сделать сбережения на обучение для сына Сыргак и дочери Нуржамал в ВУЗе.
texts.en:
Baktygul is a thirty-nine-year-old married mother raising 4 children. She works as a teacher of Kyrgyz language in the Bokonbaevo village school, but she also raises animals in order to supplement her teacher's salary. She began this business with a sum of 20,000 soms and today, due to her hard work, she owns 2 cows, 30 sheep and 2.08 hectares of land she uses to cultivate potatoes and cock's head, which serves as fodder for her herd. Her monthly income from the business is about 10,000 soms. 

In order to expand her business, Baktygul approached "Bai Tushum and Partners" with a request for a loan 110,000 soms (KGS). This loan would allow her to purchase some livestock for fattening and resale. She plans to invest profits from the loan back into her business and build up some savings so that she could pay for her son Sirgat and her daughter Nyrjamal to go to college.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is 40 years old and lives in the small village of Sagarejo District with her husband, mother-in-law and two children, who are 6 and 8 years old and attend a local school. Her mother-in-law is a pensioner and her husband is a musician who plays drums for local parties and similar events. Nana earns a living by caring for two milk cows, whose output allows her to make cheese every day for sale in the local market. The family's total average monthly income is 900 Lari. Nana and and her husband work hard but are unable to earn enough money to set aside savings to buy household goods they need or to renovate their house.  

Nana has requested a loan to buy a new milk cow. With three cows, she will be able to produce and sell more dairy products, such as cheese, curds and yogurt. She will use her increased income to repair her house, which is old and uncomfortable. This will allow her family to rest comfortably after finishing a hard day's work.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Bekmurod

texts.ru: Бекмурод приехав с России продолжил свою деятельность. Сейчас он берет кредит для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Bekmurod has returned and continued his activities. He is now requesting a loan to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.use: purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Mónica

texts.es:
Mónica tiene 35 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy trabajadora. Junto a su pareja, tiene tres hijos, quienes aun son menores y dependen de ellos para poder tener una buena calidad de vida. Viven en su casa propia como una familia muy unida y trabajadora.

Su trabajo consiste en la venta de golosinas, su puesto está ubicado en su misma vivienda y es muy concurrido por sus clientes, ya que está muy bien situado en su barrio. Ella es muy conocida por su buen humor y carisma, lo cual ha hecho que sus ventas le den los ingresos económicos que requiere. La necesidad de ser independiente y los gastos familiares que ha diario tenía que cubrir, fueron los motivos principales que le llevaron a desarrollar este trabajo. Lleva ya 3 años en esta actividad, al principio sentía que era muy tímida para hacerlo, pero con el tiempo pudo desarrollar sus cualidades y ahora vende mucho y está muy contenta por eso.
Lo que más le gusta es conversar con sus clientes y hacerlos reír, considera que lo más difícil es tener que vender bajo los fuertes rayos solares de la mañana. Le encantaría tener una tienda de golosinas donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad y poder ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.

Este es el crédito número 5 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su préstamo para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, está muy comprometida, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, como lo hizo anteriormente. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios entre sí.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1000) comprará mayor cantidad de golosinas para ofrecer a sus clientes, además de empezar a implementar su puesto con algunos abarrotes.
texts.en:
Mónica, age 35, is a good woman who is friendly and hardworking. She and her partner have three young children who are dependent on them, so she wants them to have a good quality of life. They live in their own home as a unified and hardworking family.

Her job consists of selling candy from a stand located in her home, which is frequented by her customers since her business is well-situated in her neighborhood. Mónica is well-known for her good humor and charisma, which has helped her to make sales and generate the income that she needs. Her desire to be independent and the need to cover the daily family expenses are the main reasons that motivate her to develop her business. She has been in operation for three years and was very timid at first, but over time she developed her personal qualities and now is able to generate good sales. For this reason, she is very pleased. Mónica enjoys talking with her customers and making them laugh. However, the most difficult part is dealing with low sales due to the strong heat of the sun during the morning hours. She enjoys having a candy stand because she can sell comfortably and still offer a wide variety of products to her customers.

This is her fifth loan with MFP. She is grateful to everyone who made this loan possible so that she can continue pursuing her goals. Once again, she is very committed to complete her payments on time in the same manner as before. Mónica is very pleased to be part of her Communal Bank since all of the members are fine individuals who are friendly and supportive. The loan amount of 1,000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy a large quantity of candy that she can offer to her customers. She also plans to start selling a few groceries from her stand.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of candy.

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.ru: Хосият более двенадцати лет занимается растениеводством. Ей 51 год. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Хосият берет кредит для закупа топлива и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Khosiyat has been growing vegetables and crops for over 12 years. She is 51 years old and married with three children. She applied for a loan to purchase fuel and mineral fertilizer.

loans.use: purchase fuel and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en: Alvard lives in Kirants village, in the Tavush region of Armenia, where she earns a living by breeding cows, pigs and chickens. She also grows wheat, fruits and vegetables and sells cheese, eggs and wheat from her house to her regular customers. Because her garden is small, she is able to sell only a limited amount of produce. Alvard lives and runs her farm alone, because her husband has passed away and her four children (a son and three daughters) are married and live on their own. Thanks to her hard work, she is able to support herself, provide her children’s families with fresh agricultural products, organize their weddings and buy a car for her son. She is requesting a loan for 600,000 Armenian drams to expand her livestock herd by buying some bull-calves. She believes these new animals will allow her to increase her income.

loans.use: to expand a livestock herd by buying some bull-calves.

loans.name: Dali

texts.en:
Dali is 63 years old. She is a widow and lives in a small village in Abasha District with her 23-year-old son, Aleksander. Dali and her son earn their living through agricultural activities. They have a milking cow and a calf, produce cheese and sell it on the local open market. They also have a pig and sell piglets. They work hard and keep their livestock in good conditions. The family is busy with farming also. They own 1 hectare of land, where tomatoes, Bulgarian peppers and nuts are grown. Also, Dali has a pension in the amount of 100 Lari. Total average monthly income of the family is 300 Lari. They work hard but still live in poverty. Their income is not enough even for everyday expenses. 

Dali requested a loan for cultivation of her agricultural land and for purchasing young tomato plants. Dali will sow more tomatoes and Bulgarian peppers. She will work hard during the spring and summer seasons and after the seasonal work is properly done, she hopes to get more harvest. With increased profit Dali will repair the house, because the existing one is old and uncomfortable. As a result, the family will be able to spend their evenings after hard working days in a more comfortable environment.

loans.use: to cultivate land and purchase young tomato plants

loans.name: Joana

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 3 filhos que frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
Trabalha como secretaria numa empresa privada, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (fechaduras, cimento, tinta, ferro e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa.
No futuro deseja progredir profissionalmente e melhorar as condições de vida da sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é investir nos estudos dos seus filhos para garantir um futuro melhor profissionalmente.
texts.en:
Joana is married and has 3 children who attend school.  She owns the home where she lives with her family and she does not support anyone else.  She works as a secretary in a private company.  With this loan she plans to purchase construction materials (locks, cement, pain, iron, etc.) to continue construction on her home.  

In the future she would like to make progress in her profession and improve her family's living conditions.  For this purpose she promises to make her payments on schedule and request additional loans from Hluvuku.  Her greatest challenge is to invest in her children’s education to guarantee them a better future with professional job opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (locks, cement, paint, iron, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials (iron, cement, sand, stones, windows, etc.) to continue construction on his home.

loans.name: Dufatanye Gasiza Group

texts.fr:
Solange  fait partie du groupe Dufatanye /Gsz. Le nom du groupe signifie «travaillons ensemble». Elle a 31 ans, elle est marie avec 4 enfants de 2 ans à 11 ans, dont 2 scolarises. Elle a 1 personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 4 ans de primaire.

Solange est agriculteur des pommes de terre. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des semences des pommes de terre, des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre.

Pour faire croitre son agriculture, elle planifie de moderniser son agriculture en utiliser des fertilisant sélectionne. Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait être une agricultrice de profession. Avec les profits, elle prévoit de continuer à payer les frais scolaire pour ses enfants et assurer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Solange is part of the Dufatanye /Gsz group. The name of the group means "let's work together." She is 31 years old, and she is married with 4 children from 2 to 11 years old of whom 2 go to school. She has one dependent other than her children. Her level of education is 4 years of primary school.

Solange is a potato farmer. This is her first loan cycle with ACB. She is going to use her loan to buy potato seeds, fertilizers and pay for manual labor.

To grow her agriculture, she plans to modernize her farming by using select fertilizers. In the coming years, she would like to be a farmer by profession. With the profits, she plans to continue to pay for the school fees for her children and ensure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds, fertilizers and pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Patssone

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 4 filhos todos frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ele. 	
Tem um negocio próprio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (arroz, açúcar, feijão, óleo e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futuro pretende ampliar o seu negócio fazendo outro tipo de actividade como agro-pecuária, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a subida de preços dos produtos onde compra e a grande concorrência no ramo do comércio.
texts.en:
Patssone is married and has 4 children who all attend school.  He owns the home where he lives with his family, and he also supports two nephews who live with him.  

He has his own business where he sells basic goods.  With this loan he plans to purchase products (rice, sugar, beans, oil, etc.) to increase his inventory.   In the future he plans to expand his business by doing other types of activities such as raising crops or animals.  He promises to make his loan payments on time so that he can request additional loans from Hluvuku.  

His challenges are price increases where he buys his products and the large amount of competition in this sector.

loans.use: to buy products for sale (rice, sugar, beans, oil, etc,)

loans.name: Adelino

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 6 filhos dos quais 5 frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
É militar, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (varões de ferro, cimento, pedra, areia e outros) para reabilitar a sua casa.
No futuro pretende concluir os seus estudos e melhorar a sua vida profissionalmente, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é o transporte devido as deslocações da casa ao serviço e também a escola.
texts.en:
Adelino is married and has 6 children, 5 of whom attend school.  He owns the home where he lives with his family, and he does not support anyone else.  He is in the military.  With this loan he plans to purchase construction materials (iron bars, cement, stone, sand, etc.) to fix up his home.  In the future he plans to complete his education and improve his professional life.  He promises to make his payments on schedule in order to request additional loans from Hluvuku.  

His greatest challenge is transportation from home to work and also to school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (metal bars, cement, stones, sand, etc.) to fix up his house.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 49 years old. She lives in a small village of Chokhatauri District with her family: her husband – Pillip and their 27-year-old son. Their son is unemployed. All family members run agricultural activities. They have a plot of land where 100 nut-trees are grown. They pick nuts in late summer, approximately 400 kg. per season and make "churchkhela" (natural grape juice and nut candy). They sell "churchkhela" in nearby villages. Also, they have a vineyard. They make wine and sell it on the local open market. Total average monthly income of the family is 800 Lari.

Sonia requested a loan to purchase nuts. Thus, she will be able to make more "churchkhela". This will increase their sales and the family will get additional income. With increased amount of profit they will be able to reinvest in the family agricultural business to expand it and make it more profitable. Also, with the increased income they plan to repair the house. Taking into account the above-mentioned, the living conditions of the family will improve.

loans.use: to purchase nuts to prepare for sale

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is a 35-year-old married woman with six children aged between 7 and 16 years. They are all school-going age. She is purely an agriculturalist and grows all different kinds of crops ranging from beans to maize, millet and bananas that she feeds the family and also sells to sustain her family.

She wants UGX 2,000,000 to hire labour in the farm and also pay school fees. Since it's not yet harvest season, she will be able to repay after harvest.

Her customers are mainly inhabitants of the village and a few from town. Her dream is  to expand to extensive agriculture if she gets funds.

Her major challenge is limited land and resources for expansion coupled with the unpredictable weather changes.

loans.use: To hire labour and also pay school fees

loans.name: Yong

texts.en: Yong is 34 years old, married and the mother of five children. She lives with her family in a small village in the Baray district, which is located in Kompong Tom province. She earns a living as a farmer, and makes about $2 a day growing rice. She and her husband work together on their farm to ensure a healthy rice crop and a fruitful harvest. Yong is requesting a loan for KHR 1,500,000 to buy supplies she needs for her farm, including seeds, fertilizer and pesticides. This will ensure a good crop which is not harmed by insects. In the future, Yong wants to renovate her house and make it more comfortable for the family to live in.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a rice farm.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 43-year-old married man with four children aged between 13 and 19 years. They are all in school. He additionally has three dependents who are orphans. 

Paul is a carpenter and makes all kinds of household furniture ranging from beds, chairs, and cupboards among others and his main clients are the local community.

This is his second loan with UGAFODE and he has applied for UGX  1,500,000 to buy a generator and DSTV (Digital Satellite Television service) so that he can begin showing football matches at a cost during this season to increase his income revenues.

His major challenges are financial constraints coupled with late payments from his customers.

His dream is to grow his business and educate his children.

Paul is very hardworking and is grateful to UGAFODE for their timely services, which help him meet his target and therefore satisfy his numerous family demands.

loans.use: to buy a generator.

loans.name: Rocío

texts.es:
Rocío tiene 50 años, es una mujer muy buena, amable y trabajadora. Está separada de quien fue su pareja por muchos años. En la actualidad vive en su casa propia, la que construyó al lado de su ex pareja, allí habita con tres de sus cuatro hijos y comparte junto a ellos su día a día y su lucha por mejorar juntos su nivel de vida.

Rocío es una mujer que siempre ha trabajado para salir adelante, se dedica a varias actividades que le generan ingresos económicos tales como: lavar ropa ajena, vender refrescos los fines de semana, eventualmente trabaja ayudando a otra señora en la venta de comida, pero su actividad más importante se centra en la venta de ropa. Lleva en esta actividad 2 años, inicialmente vendía solamente a sus amigos y familiares, pero ahora vende sus prendas  ofreciendo de casa en casa. Las prendas las trae de otra ciudad donde compra al por mayor y se caracterizan por la calidad del material y los diseños modernos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite decidir su horario, puede manejar su tiempo y dedicarlo a diferentes actividades. Considera que lo más difícil es que inicialmente tiene que movilizar gran cantidad de mercadería, aunque esa carga disminuye mientras más rápido logra vender sus prendas. Eso no la desanima y sigue adelante en su trabajo porque le gusta lo que hace y espera que con el paso del tiempo pueda tener una tienda de venta de ropa donde pueda exhibir sus prendas y estar más tranquila y cómoda.

Este es su crédito número 5 con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Y le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece, ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.

El monto solicitado (S/. 1200) lo invertirá en la compra de prendas de vestir de diferentes tallas y modelos para ambos sexos, así espera seguir ofreciendo calidad en innovación a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rocío, age 50, is a good woman who is friendly and hardworking. She has been separated from her partner for many years. Rocío currently lives in her own home, which was built alongside her ex-partner. There she lives with three of her four children. Together they strive day after day to improve their standard of living.

Rocío is a woman who has always worked to get ahead. She does various jobs in order to generate income, which include doing other people's laundry and selling soft drinks on the weekends. Occasionally she works with another woman in selling food, but her most frequent business activity is selling clothes. Rocío has been in this business for two years. She started out initially selling only to friends and relatives, but now she sells clothes by going door-to-door. The articles of clothing are brought in from another city where they can be purchased in bulk. These products are known for being made from quality materials and for being styled in the latest designs. What she enjoys most about her work is being able to set her own schedule so that she can devote time to different activities. At first, the most difficult part for Rocío was being able to get rid of a large quantity of merchandise but this concern diminished as she began making sales more quickly. She is eager to continue with her work because she enjoys what she does and hopes to eventually have a clothing store where she can display her merchandise more easily and comfortably.

This is her fifth loan with MFP. Rocío is grateful for this opportunity and the trust that has been demonstrated to her. She also promises to complete her payments in a punctual manner. Rocío is glad to be part of her Communal Bank since she believes the members are responsible and supportive individuals. The loan amount of 1,200 PEN that she requested will be invested in the purchase of clothing in different sizes and styles for both sexes. She hopes to continue offering innovative products that are of high quality to her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing in different sizes and styles.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.en:
Jose Luis, 45, lives with his wife and their five children. He is a hardworking man who mainly dedicates his time to raising animals, but also grows lemons and works as an assistant in a farm to increase the income for his family. He has been developing this area of expertize for more than 10 years.

He has previously received a loan from Edpyme Alternative which he describes as a success and which encouraged him to take out a new one after paying back responsibly. This loan of 1000 soles will be used to buy animal feed for his livestock and improve the prospects of commercializing his animals. He has previously proven to be a reliable client.

loans.use: to purchase balanced animal feed for his animals.

loans.name: Elvia Marleny

texts.es: Elvia, tiene 28 años de edad, vive con su pareja en una aldea que pertenece a la comunidad de Taulabe, Comayagua. Ella se dedica a la agricultura principalmente a la siembra de granos básicos como maíz, frijoles y café. Hace dos años que tiene estos cultivos, ella se siente contenta porque va mejorar la producción y obtendrá buenas ganancias. Con los dos préstamos anteriores ha venido ampliando el cultivo y el préstamo actual de 3,500.00 lo va invertir en la preparación y fertilización de la tierra para sacar mejores cosechas de granos básicos como maíz y frijoles ya que es la temporada. Su plan es que con las ganancias va cultivar una parcela más de café y aprovechar más ingresos.
texts.en:
Elvia is 28 years of age, and lives with her partner in a small village in the municipality of Taulabe, Comayagua. She works in agriculture, mainly growing basic grains such as corn, beans and coffee. She has grown these crops for two years, and is happy because her production is going to increase and she will obtain good profits. 

Elvia used her two previous loans to increase her harvests. The current loan of 3,500 Honduran Lempiras will be invested in preparing and fertilizing the land to ensure better harvests of basic grains like beans and corn, as it is the season for this produce. Elvia plans to use her profits to grow coffee on one more plot of land, and therefore have greater income.

loans.use: To prepare land to grow corn and beans.

loans.name: Ma. Guillermina

texts.es:
La señora Ma. Guillermina tiene 73 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos  y vive con la nuera y su nieto en una aldea rural del Departamento de Yoro, Yoro
Su actividad económica es la agricultura, dedicada específicamente a la producción de granos básicos frijoles y maíz. Ella inicio sus labores en la agricultura desde muy joven. Dispone de un terreno que le fue heredado de sus padres. El cual ha logrado hacer producir con mucho trabajo, empeño y dedicación. En la actualidad produce maíz y frijoles que le sirven para consumo y venta. Con las  ganancias obtenidas las invirtió para ampliar las áreas de producción. 
En la actualidad esta solicitando  un crédito de 15,000 para invertir en la compra de fertilizante e insumos para el fortalecimiento de sus cultivos. Se siente motivada a seguir con su negocio productivo ya que considera que le generan buenas ganancias si maneja bien el crédito. 
A futuro planea utilizar sus ganancias para poder comprar más tierra y heredarla a sus hijos y producir más.
texts.en:
Ma. Guillermina is 73 years of age, and is a single mother. She has three children and lives with her daughter-in-law and grandson in a rural village in the department of Yoro, Yoro.

She works in agriculture, specifically growing basic grains – beans and corn. She started working in this job from a very young age, and has a plot of land which she inherited from her parents. She has cultivated this land with lots of work, determination and dedication. She currently grows corn and beans for personal consumption and for sale, and invests her profits in expanding her production areas.

Ma. Guillermina has requested a loan of 15,000 Honduran Lempiras to buy fertilizer and supplies to boost her crops. She is motivated to move forward with her business, as she considers that it generates good profits if she manages the loan well. In the future she plans to use her profits to buy more land which she will pass on to her children, as well as to produce more.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and supplies to boost her crops.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.en:
Rosa Elena is 30 years old, married and with four children, two of whom are still at school. She lives in a rural area in Northern Peru in a community of approximately 200 families. She lives in a house owned by herself and her husband with water and electricy.

Rosa works raising and selling animals, an activity she has been doing since she was a teenager. Indeed, she learnt this type of activity from her parents and is now able to practice it in her house.  

She has previously received a loan from Edpyme Alternativa, which she used to buy a small motorcycle, which has allowed her to save on costs when transporting her merchandise. As a result of this success, she sees this new loan as an opportunity to contunue developing her business and area of expertise. She also tries to diversify her income by growing and selling some rice.

loans.use: to buy a cow and animal feed to continue strenghthening her animals.

loans.name: Pinto

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 4 filhos dos quais 3 ainda frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Trabalha como jardineiro e tem um negocio próprio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (feijão, sabão, óleo, ovos, farinha, caldo e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futuro pretende apostar num negócio de venda de plantas de ornamentação para aumentar a sua renda, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é comprar equipamentos necessários par prestar serviços de jardinagem.
texts.en: Pinto is married and has 4 children, 3 of whom are still in school.  He owns the home where he lives with his family and he does not support anyone else.  He works as a gardener and he also has his own business selling basic necessities.  With this loan he plans to purchase products (beans, soap, oil, eggs, flour, broth, etc.) to increase his inventory.  In the future he plans to open a business selling ornamental plants to increase his income.  He promises to make his payments on time in order to request additional loans from Hluvuku for that purpose.  His greatest challenge is purchasing the equipment he needs to provide gardening services.

loans.use: to purchase items for sale (beans, soap, oil, eggs, flour, broth, etc.)

loans.name: Gloire De Dieu 1 Group

texts.fr: GLOIRE DE DIEU 1 est un groupement de vingt trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Conforte (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 49 ans et est une veuve. Conforte a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un seul reste à sa charge. Conforte a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Conforte prépare de la nourriture (riz, pâte de maïs accompagnée de sauce aux poissons) qu’elle vend dans une école du Bénin. Conforte exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans, et achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. La clientèle de Conforte s’agrandit de plus en plus. Afin d’élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire les exigences de sa clientèle, Conforte sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GLOIRE DE DIEU 1, l’appui financier de ALIDé. Conforte a bien remboursé le premier crédit reçu de ALIDé.
texts.en:
GLOIRE DE DIEU 1 is a group of 23 people, whose members live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Conforte (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 49 years old and is a widow. Conforte has three children, all in school, of whom only one is still her dependent. Conforte stopped school at the secondary level. 

To take care of her different responsibilities, Conforte prepares food (rice, corn paste with fish sauce) that she sells in a school in Bénin. Conforte has been practicing this business for 5 years, and buys her products in a market in Bénin. Conforte's clientèle is growing more and more. In order to raise the level of her business and to better satisfy the demands of her clientèle, Conforte is requesting, together with the other members of the GLOIRE DE DIEU 1 group, financial support from ALIDé. Conforte repaid the first loan that she received from ALIDé well.

loans.use: to buy condiments and food supplies (rice, corn, fish).

loans.name: Inga

texts.en:
Inga is 44 years old. She lives in a small village in Lanchkhuti District with her family: her husband Merab and her parents-in-law, who are pensioners. Inga and Merab run an agricultural business. They have a dairy farm with three milking cows and three calves, and they produce cheese. Part of the produced cheese is used by the family and the other part is sold on the local open market. She sells, on average, 60 kg of cheese per month. Also, the family owns 1.5 hectare of land where they grow maize and tomatoes, and they have beehives with bee colonies. They harvest ecologically clean honey twice a year and sell it in nearby villages. The total average monthly income of the family is 600 Georgia Laris (GEL).

Inga requested a loan for purchasing a mini tractor. Merab will use it for tilling their land. Using their own tractor instead of a rented one will decrease costs of farming and increase their profit. Also, Merab will cultivate plots of neighbor farmers. He will be paid for providing this service, so the family will get additional income. With the increased amount of income, they will be able to repair the roof of the house and provide better living conditions for the family members.

loans.use: to purchase a mini tractor.

loans.name: Elena De Juay

texts.en:
Elena, 52, lives with her son in the North of Peru. She sells vegetables and fruit to her customers and offers flexible payment methods to facilite business. This innovative approach has allowed her to be known locally and for her business to develop. Moreover, she also grows chillies and is now also offering internet services for the locals who want to use it. 
 
On the back of these developments, demand for her products has increased and she wants to be able to cope with this. As a result, this loan of 3000 soles will be used for the purpose of purchasing more vegetables to increase the supply of goods offered and bring in new customers. She has very good references from the people who know her.

loans.use: to buy more vegatables to expand her business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. She is a married mother of two school-going children. She owns a retail shop which has been in operation for three years and has been a source of constant income to the family. In this shop, she sells sugar, cooking oil, and washing detergents among other things. Besides this business, Janet is also a vendor of water.

She learnt of Milango from a company employee and joined in order to access credit for her business. Janet is asking for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to purchase retail stock like cereal, sugar, cooking fat, etc.

Janet is optimistic that the sales will increase and she will finally open another retail shop. Her desire is to grow her future chain of businesses into a wholesale business. The additional income obtained from this loan will help restock her shop and also pay her children’s school fees. The only challenge that Janet faces is inflation.

loans.use: To purchase retail stock like cereal, sugar, cooking fat, etc.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. He is a father of four school-going children. He owns a retail shop which has been in operation for seven years and has been a source of constant income for the family. In this shop, he sells cereals, sugar, cooking oil, and kerosene among other things. Besides this business, David also owns a grocery stall. He learnt of Milango from a company employee and joined in order to access credit for his business. 

David is asking for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to purchase retail stock like cereal, sugar, cooking fat, kerosene, etc. David believes he can then be able to provide for his family’s basic needs more easily. David’s desire is to grow his business into a wholesale one. He is full of praise for Milango for all this assistance. The only challenge that David faces is inflation.

loans.use: To purchase retail stock like cereal, sugar, cooking fat, kerosene, etc.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid has been operating a mobile phone accessories shop in Kongowea, Mombasa, Kenya for the last four years. Besides his business, Rashid is a family man, married and with one set of twins. In his business, he sells phone batteries, chassis, and microphones, speakers, charging systems, credit cards and earphones.

Rachid learnt about Milango from other clients who had obtained loans from Milango to improve their businesses. With a loan capital of 21,050 Kenya shillings, he will be able to purchase repair tools, mobile phone accessories and a few phones. 

The income obtained from this business will help improve the standard of living of his family and educate his children well. He is full of praise for Milango and its partners for such an initiative.

loans.use: To buy repair tools, mobile phone accessories and a few phones.

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea is 42 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Aurea is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Aurea has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from vegetable vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 24 years old, married, and has three children. She resides in Camanga, Tukuran, Philippines. Jocelyn own and operate a gardening business, which she has been doing for two years. She earns 3,000 PHP a month. 

Jocelyn is requesting a loan for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2011, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Jocelyn wants to make improvements on her house and raise the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Pring

texts.en:
Pring pays full attention to rice farming to generate a livelihood.  She is 25 years old and married with two school-aged children.  Her family resides in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. 

She has managed her business for seven years earns approximately USD 2.00 per day, to cover household expenses and allowances for her children.

To continually improve in her farming business, Pring would like to take out a small loan in the amount of KHR 1,000,000 to purchase farming materials and pay for labor costs. This is her second loan, which will be used to stabilize her business and her living status. 

She is very thankful to our lenders for help and support.

loans.use: to purchase farming materials and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Tofaga

texts.en:
Tofaga is a 43-year-old married woman with seven children. 

She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Tofaga has requested a loan to buy a plant sprayer, chemicals, and taro crops.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. With her profits, Tofaga hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a plant sprayer, chemicals, and taro crops.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia tiene 35 años de edad, vive en unión libre, tiene 3 hijos, y vive en el municipio de Olanchito, Yoro.
Aurelia hace 12 años se dedica al negocio de venta de comida, ella vende sus alimentos en la afueras donde hay varios negocios  ofreciendo baleadas, pastelitos de maíz relleno de carne y refrescos. Dice que se siente contenta porque vende todos sus alimentos, las personas la conocen y tiene ya sus propios clientes. Ha logrado salir adelante con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo para ayudar a su compañero de hogar con los gastos de la familia.
Con odef Dona Aurelia ha obtenido ya 10 créditos los cuales le han ayudado mucho en la inversión de su negocio y para otras necesidades que se le han presentado,  ahora esta solicitando su préstamo numero once de 10,000 lempiras para comprar insumos que necesita para elaborar los alimentos como harina, frijoles, huevos , lácteos , carnes, maseca, arroz y refrescos. Es un prestamo a corto plazo que solicita con pago bimestral, pagara una sola cuota dentro de dos meses.
Su meta es seguir trabajando en su negocio y sacar su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Aurelia is 35 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children.  She lives in the town of Olanchito, Yoro.  

Aurelia has been in the business of selling food for 12 years.  She sells her food in the outlying areas where there are several other businesses.  She offers "baleadas" (Honduran stuffed tortillas), corn dumplings filled with meat, and soft drinks.  Aurelia says she is pleased because she is able to sell all of her food to people who know her.  She already has her own customers.  Aurelia has been able to get ahead through hard work and effort so that she can help her household companion with the family expenses.  

Doña Aurelia has already obtained 10 loans from ODEF.  These loans have been a great help by allowing her to invest in her business and other needs that arise.  Now she is requesting her 11th loan in the amount of 10,000 HNL so that she can buy supplies that she needs for preparing her dishes such as flour, beans, eggs, dairy products, meat, cornmeal, rice, and soft drinks.

This is a short term loan that she is asking for with two payments over two months.   

Her goal is to continue working in her business so that her family can move forward.

loans.use: to buy flour, beans, eggs, dairy products, meat, cornmeal, rice, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
Yaneth tiene 29 años. Gracias al apoyo que obtuvo de sus padres logró comprar un terreno en el que construyó su casa a base de madera. Allí vive junto a sus dos hijos; Joseph de 6 años y Franklin de 9 años. 
Desde que termino la relación con su esposo decidió salir adelante sola, por ello empezó a dedicarse al cultivo de plantas de café. Normalmente labora en su propio campo, pero a veces trabaja como jornalera en otras chacras donde le pagan muy bien por su trabajo. Así también, ella cuenta el apoyo de peones para realizar sus propias cosechas, las cuales lleva a vender a las asociaciones recolectoras donde le gratifican un buen precio.

Ella se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado por parte de MFP, y se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago como en anteriores ocasiones. Asimismo, está satisfecha de trabajar con personas responsables y solidarias en su banco comunal.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles de este préstamo comprará más plantas de café para cultivar en sus tierras.
texts.en:
Yaneth is 29 years old. Thanks to the support of her parents, she was able to buy a piece of land and build a wooden house. There she lives with her two children: Joseph (age 6) and Franklin (age 9).

After the relationship with her husband ended, she decided to move forward by herself. For this reason, she devotes her time to cultivating coffee plants. She normally works alone in her field, but sometimes she works as a laborer on other farms since that job pays very well. In addition, she has help from workers when it is time to harvest her own crops, which are sold to the collection associations for a good price.

Yaneth is pleased to have financial support from MFP. She promises to be punctual with her payments, just as she was on previous occasions.
