Yaneth is pleased to be working with responsible and supportive people in her Communal Bank. Her loan of 1,000 PEN will be used to buy more coffee plants for cultivating on her land.

loans.use: to buy more coffee plants.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge Luis tiene 31 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y con ganas de progresar en la vida. Vive hace 10 años con la mujer que le ha dado tres hijos, fruto del gran amor que se tienen.

Su trabajo es la reparación de motocarros y vehículos menores. Ha acondicionado un espacio en su vivienda donde recibe a sus clientes. Algunas veces también lo hace a domicilio, pues es muy bueno en su trabajo. Lleva en esta actividad un poco más de 5 años y tiene la ayuda de otro joven. También tiene un motocarro, con el que hace transporte de pasajeros eventualmente, con el fin de generar un ingreso económico adicional. Esto lo hace ya casi por  2 años, y se siente tranquilo por todo lo que ahora puede ofrecerle a su familia. 
Por lo pronto, le gusta mucho trabajar como mecánico, ya que el pago que recibe es muy bueno y la clientela es constante, lo que le permite tener trabajo todos los días. Asegura que al principio le fue difícil porque no podía atender a todos los clientes, hasta que pudo contar con la ayuda de otra persona y la situación ha mejorado. Ahora espera seguir trabajando y ahorrar poco a poco para que más adelante pueda tener un local de atención más grande e implementar su pequeño taller con repuestos para la venta.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en él. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Y además le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece, ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1500) implementará su taller de mecánica con algunas llaves que le hacen falta. También comprará un motor nuevo y algunos repuestos y accesorios que necesita para refaccionar su motocarro.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis is 31 years old. He is a very hard worker and is eager to get ahead in life. For ten years, he has been living with the woman who bore him three children, which are the fruit of their great love.

He works repairing three-wheelers and other small vehicles. He has set up a space in his home to see his customers. Sometimes he also makes house calls, since he is very good at his job. He has been in this business a little over five years and gets help from another young man. He also has a  three-wheeler van, which he occasionally uses for passanger transportation in order to generate some extra income. He has been doing this for almost two years, and knowing all that he can now offer his family gives him peace of mind. 

For the time being he really likes working as a mechanic, because he gets very good pay and the customer base is steady, which allows him to have work every day. He assures us it was hard for him in the beginning because he couldn't serve all the customers, until he was able to have another person to help and the situation improved. Now he hopes to keep working and save a little so that further on he may have a larger business place and stock his shop with repair parts to sell. 

This is his second loan with MFP, so he is grateful for the opportunity and the trust deposited in him. On the other hand, he is committed to paying his installments in a timely manner. He also enjoys being a part of the communal bank he belongs to, because he has seen how responsible and supportive its members are.

He will use the amount requested (S/. 1500) to stock his repair shop with several wrenches that he needs. He will buy a new engine and some spare parts and accessories he needs to refurbish his three-wheeler.

loans.use: to stock his shop and to purchase spare parts for his three-wheeler.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for cooking condiments.

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Un is a resident from Baray district, Kompong Tom province. Cultivating crops and selling fresh fish are the main businesses and main source of her family’s income. She grows rice, bean and potatoes for sale on her farmland. And she can make a good income each harvesting season. 

Also, Un transports fish she buys from local fishermen to sells in a market for additional income. She is very busy with her daily business activities. However, she can satisfy her living needs and support her children’s education.  She is now 40 years old and has three single children, three of whom are secondary school level students.

At the present time, she is taking out a loan of KHR 1,000,000 to invest in her farming business. She will purchase rice and bean seeds, fertilizers, and pay for operating expenses. Through her effort and the help of the loan, Un hopes that she will obtain a fruitful harvest and make a good income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice and bean seeds, fertilizers, and pay for costs of the operating expenses.

loans.name: Abdul Karim

texts.en:
This is 40 year old Abdul.  He is married and has three children ages two, five and eight. He has one additional dependent, who live with him to help his wife with the house chores.  

In 2002, Abdul established his jeans, shirts, t-shirts, shoes, and shorts business. He started the business after dropping out of school to help him become self reliant. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 1,200,000SLL every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000SLL. Abdul has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional jeans, shirts, t-shirts, shoes and shorts. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 300,000SLL. 

In the future, Abdul plans to move the kiosk to a shop and to create a business for his wife. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for clothes and shoes

loans.name: Koy

texts.en:
Kuy, 38, married and a mother of two teen-aged children, is engaged in agriculture as the main business of her family.  She owns a few plots of farmland, located in Kampong Chhnang province, on which she and her husband cultivate rice crops to generate income each harvesting season. Despite their hardships, they plan to educate their children and help them to earn a degree someday. 

Due to inadequate capital to invest in her farming business, Kuy would like to borrow KHR 1,000,000 to purchase ten bags of fertilizers needed for rice production.  She hopes she will be successful in her business, expand her farmland and make a good income for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ten bags of fertilizers needed in rice production.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Lilibeth is from Upper Bayao, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 32 years old, married and has three children. To earn a living, Lilibeth runs a service transportation business. Lilibeth has been in business for 4 years and earns 3,600 PHP a month for these activities. Lilibeth is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. In 2010, Lilibeth joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from this loan to improve and/or to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun is 40 years old, married, and a loving father of five single children, all of whom are still depends and attending to school. Sun works on his farm cultivating various kids of crops to make an income, which he will use to support his family and his children’s education. 

Sun doesn’t work in this field alone, but with her wife, a good business partner, and some of his children.  Sun also goes around the commune to collect and buy firewood in bulk for trading. 

He wants to improve his business and increase his income to create a better living for his family.  He is asking for a loan of KHR 4,000,000 to purchase a couple of cows, for his farm and to transport firewood.  

Sun has successfully repaid his previous loans, and this new loan will help him in improve his businesses.

loans.use: to purchase a couple of cows, for his farm and to transport firewood.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is from San Carlos, Tukuran. She is 40 years old. Marilyn is married and has 7 children. To make a living, Marilyn owns and operates a business venture, selling food items in the local community. Marilyn has been in her business for 5 years and earns 2,500 PHP a month for these activities. Marilyn is requesting a loan of 4,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. In 2008, Marilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is married, 60 years of age, and lives in Tinotongan, Tukuran. Mila is operating a sari-sari store to earn a living. She has been in this business for 11 years, and she earns 4,000 PHP every month. 

She is requesting a loan of 6,800 PHP to purchase supplementary goods for her general store. Mila's business is very stable in her community. She joined GDMPC in 2011. Mila wishes that her business will grow more.

loans.use: to purchase supplementary goods for her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase barbed wire, plant sprayer, chemicals, taro crops, and wheelbarrow.

loans.name: James

texts.en: This is 37-year-old James. He is married and has three children aged two, 8 and 12. In 2002, James established his provisions, drinks and top-up business. He began to be self reliant after graduating from college. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about SLL 2,269,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. James has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to expand on the sale of cement. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 317,660. In the future, James plans to improve on his shop for the sale of cement. He thinks the loan can help him with a small quantity of cement.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for cement.

loans.name: Alma Reina

texts.es:
Alma Reina tiene 34 años de edad, vive en unión libre, tiene 5 hijos y vive en una aldea rural del Municipio de Gracias Lempira.
Alma Reina es muy trabajadora, tiene 4 años de dedicarse a la producción y venta de café, vende el café en oro. Le dedica el tiempo necesario a esta actividad, pues la zona donde ella vive es una zona apta para esta producción y además la venta de café esta siendo un negocio muy rentable en el país.
Doña Alma ha solicitado un quinto préstamo a Odef de 5,000 lempiras para compra de fertilizante y pago de mano de obra para el mantenimiento de la finca. Con esta inversión ella espera sacar una mejor cosecha de café dándole la respectiva asistencia a sus cultivos, y vender producto de calidad.
Su meta es seguir trabajando la tierra cultivando café, y así lograr tener una solvencia económica para darles mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y que puedan estudiar.
texts.en:
Alma Reina is 34 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has five children.  She lives in a rural neighborhood in the town of Gracias Lempira.  

Alma Reina is a very hard worker.  For the past four years she has been producing and selling coffee, as well as golden coffee beans.  She spends the necessary time that is required of this business.  The area where she lives is suitable for production and selling coffee is a very profitable business in this country.  

Doña Alma is requesting her fifth loan from ODEF in the amount of 5,000 HNL so that she can buy fertilizer and pay for labor to help maintain her farm.  With this investment, she hopes to achieve a better coffee harvest and also provide the required attention that her crops need.  As a result, she will be able to sell a quality product.  Her goal is to continue working the land by cultivating coffee so that she can achieve financial solvency and be able to provide for her children's studies and give them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a married woman with 8 children. She is 45 years old, residing in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Josephine owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for 6 years. Each month she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 6,500 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps etc. Josephine is been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Josephine wants to make improvements to her house and to finish her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps etc.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao is a 28-year-old married woman who has two young kids living under her care. She, alongside her supportive husband, operate a farming business and it is their main source of income. She has been in business for a long time.  She grows and harvests rice, potatoes, and beans.

She is taking out a loan in the amount of KHR 5,000,000 to purchase two cows for fattening for the future sale.  Mao hopes that this will help her generate additional income for the family. She will use a potion of her income to save for the future of her children’s education and her family's emergency fund.

loans.use: to purchase two cows for fattening for the future sale.

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
Pech, age 32, is a humble farmer who resides with his family in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. He owns a few inherited farmlands, on which he grows rice, potatoes, and various kinds of crops, including vegetables for sale. He is married to his wife, a good business partner, and a mother of a child who is studying in the province. Pech plans to send his child to a good university in Phnom Penh after he finishes high school. So, he works hard in the business to save some money for this. 

Pech would like to acquire a loan of KHR 700,000.  He will use the loan to hire laborers to till and prepare the land for planting potatoes. Pech hopes that his dreams will be attained in order to sustain his family's needs and educate all of his children.

loans.use: to hire laborers to till and prepare the land for planting potatoes.

loans.name: Taupou

texts.en: Taupou is 29 years old and married with three children. She owns and operates a small store in her community. She has been doing this for two years. Taupou needs a loan to buy noodles, cigarettes, snacks, bags of sugar, salt, and flour. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy noodles, cigarettes, snacks, bags of sugar, salt and flour

loans.name: Meu

texts.en:
Meu is 54 years old and a married man who has been living in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. He has four children, all of whom have independent lives and live separately with their families around the province. Meu has become a single parent since his wife died a few years ago. 

He strives to work hard in his rice field.  He is thankful.  Meu plants various crops on his farmland, including rice, potatoes and vegetables. 

As of now, he has applied for a loan of KHR 4,000,000 to hire laborers transplanting his rice and harvesting his potato crops.  He is very happy with his fruitful harvest in this season. He will use his income to reinvest in the business for expansion and he hopes to double his return in the following season.

loans.use: to hire laborers transplanting his rice and harvesting his potato crops.

loans.name: Momodu

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Momodu.  He is married and has three children aged 1, 6 and 9. 

In 2003, Momodu established his provisions and drinks business. He started the business to be self-reliant. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, he earns about 1,400,000 SLL every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Momodu requires a loan in order to buy eggs, provisions, and rice. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. 

In the future, Momodu plans to open another store at the center of town.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for eggs, provisions, and rice

loans.name: Ati

texts.en: Ati is 54 years old and married with seven children. She makes and sells handicrafts in the flea market to earn a living and has been doing this for four years. Ati has requested a loan to buy Samoan kava bowls, earrings, bracelets, necklaces, "puletasi" (traditional clothing), etc. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy kava bowls, Samoan earrings, bracelets, necklaces and "puletasi"

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch is 51 years old and married. She resides in a rural village located in the Sa Ang district of Kampong Cham province. She has seven children, four of whom are dependent on her and only two of them are still in school while the other two are workers. To make a living to support her big family, she and her husband have been planting beans and cucumbers for almost twenty years. 

Touch received her first loan from VisionFund five cycles ago and she completely paid back the loans with VisionFund. The past loans have enabled her to better support her big family and now she can earn 22,000 KHR per day from her current business. Now leading her group of three to apply for a loan with VisionFund, Touch will use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her yields and earn more income so as to set aside some money and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is 59 years old, married with four children and she's from Inasagan, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. Lolita owns and operates a business venture, a gardening business, to earn a living. Lolita has been gardening for 4 years and she earns 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Lolita joined GDMPC. Lolita is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Lolita wants to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Thaimu

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Thaimu. He is married and has three children aged 1, 4, and 7. He has two additional dependents who live with him so he can assist his younger brother with their education.  

In 2002, Thaimu established his used clothing business. The business started to help him be self-reliant after coming from the village to stay in the city. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, he earns about Le 1,580,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Thaimu has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more bales of used clothing. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 237,000. 

In the future, Thaimu plans to be able to open an outlet at the outskirts of town. When it rains the business is disturbed.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for used clothing.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Eulalia tiene 50 años. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Juan, de 60 años, y sus tres queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo de su felicidad y todos sus esfuerzos.
Ella se dedica a la atención de sus clientes en su tienda de abarrotes, la que abrió en su vivienda gracias a los ahorros de las ganancias que obtenía por las ventas de sus cosechas, siendo su esposo quien se encarga de ver la producción de sus cultivos. Su tienda empezó hace 3 años, y siempre está pendiente de lo necesario que le piden sus cliente. 

Además se siente contenta por recibir el apoyo financiero de MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago como en anteriores créditos. En su banco comunal es una socia amable y responsable. 
Con los 3,000 nuevos soles de este préstamo se abastecerá de mercadería; comprando arroz, azúcar, verduras, bebidas, papas, cereales, etc.
texts.en:
Eulalia is 50 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband Juan, age 60. They have three beloved children who are the reason for her happiness and all of her efforts.

Eulalia attends to the customers in her grocery store. She established this business in her home thanks to the savings she accumulated from all of the sales of her harvested crops. Her husband is in charge of overseeing the crop production. Her store was started three years ago and has always supplied the necessary items that her customers request.

Eulalia is pleased to have the financial support of MFP. She promises to be punctual with her payments, just as she was with her previous loans. In her Communal Bank, she is a friendly and responsible member. Her loan of 3,000 PEN will be used to restock her store with merchandise such as rice, sugar, vegetables, beverages, potatoes, grains, and other items.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is 31 years old and a married woman with one child. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Sara has requested a loan to buy tarpaulin, barbed wire, a spade, a rake and bushknives.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Sara hopes to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy tarpaulin, barbed wire, a spade, a rake and bushknives

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
This is Loida, 50, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Jun, a laborer, and is a mother of two children. Both children are in college. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Loida operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Loida hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Khoem

texts.en:
Cultivating rice is what Khoem does to earn a living, provide for her family and save for her children's education.  She has been farming for almost 17 years with the full support from her spouse. She is 39 years old and is responsible for her school-aged children, who reside in Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. 

She has requested a loan from HKL to purchase ten sacks of fertilizers to put on the rice field to create a good harvest. 

Khoem will use the extra income for her family's daily food, allowances for her children, and to reinvest into the business for expansion.

loans.use: to purchase ten sacks of fertilizers put in the rice field in order to have a good harvest.

loans.name: Ki's Group

texts.en:
Ki, 52, is a married mother of five children, three daughters and two sons. She resides in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, where crop farming is a common way to earn a living. Like other villagers, cassava planting is the main source of her family's income and she has been farming a 3-hectare plot of farmland for almost thirty-two years. 

To better support their living, her husband runs a ferry boat for fees. The main challenge for her business is the lack of working capital to grow her business. With her current business, she can earn around 9,700 KHR per day.

Ki's group consists of five members who are all female. Having completely paid back the first loan, she is now leading her group to apply for a second loan with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, for 1,200,000 KHR each. 

As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers for the farmland and use a portion of it to fix the ferry boat and buy gasoline. She hopes this loan will enable her family to grow the business and make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland and fix the ferry boat.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Rosalía

texts.es:
Rosalia tiene 23 años, es una mujer muy jovial, emprendedora y con muchas ganas de conseguir un futuro mejor para ella y su familia. Es soltera y aún no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de su madre junto a sus tres hermanos y cada uno de ellos comparte el mismo objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida.

Su negocio consiste en la venta de ropa. De manera quincenal o mensual se encarga de viajar a la capital de la ciudad para comprar las prendas al por mayor, luego las pone a la venta entre sus amigos, familiares y otras personas conocidas bajo la modalidad de crédito a plazos. Desde que se inició en este negocio, hace 4 años, ha trabajado sola y ha visto que es una actividad muy rentable porque le genera buenos ingresos que le ayudan a solventar sus gastos personales y los de su familia.
Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que le permite tener tiempo para dedicarse a sus estudios y a realizar algunas labores del hogar cuando sean necesarias. Algunas veces ha sentido que la dificultad de no saber cómo realizar los cobros hacía que no cuente con el dinero necesario en el momento preciso para renovar su mercadería; sin embargo, poco a poco fue ganándose el respeto y la confianza de sus clientes que no dudan en pagarle en el momento pactado o antes de ello. Deseas más adelante conseguir un local en el que pueda establecer su pequeña tienda de ropa.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Asimismo, se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Y además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1000) comprará mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir para vender en la temporada de verano.
texts.en:
Rosalia, 23, is a cheerful and enterprising woman who wants a better future for herself and her family.  She is single, and does not yet have children.  She lives in her mother's house along with her 3 siblings.  Each of them shares her goal of improving their quality of life.

Rosalia has a business selling clothing.  Once or twice a month, she travels to the capital city to buy garments at wholesale.  Later, she offers them for sale to her friends, relatives and other people she knows.  She makes her sales on installment credit.  Ever since she started this business 4 years ago, she has worked on her own.  She has seen that this is a very profitable activity because it generates good earnings that help her to cover her personal expenses and those of her family.

What Rosalia likes about her business is that it allows her to have time to devote to her education, and also to do some household chores when needed.  At times she has struggled with making her collections in such a way as to have the money on hand that she needs to renew her inventory of clothing.  However, she has gradually been gaining the respect and trust of her customers, who don't hesitate to make their payments at the agreed time or even sooner.  In the future she wants to have a place where she could set up her own small clothing store.  

This is her first loan with MFP, and she is very pleased to know that she has financial support, because this way she feels more certain that she will make progress with her work.  Also, she promises to comply with the payment terms of the loan.  She is very happy to belong to her communal bank, because all of the members are very responsible and cooperative.

With the sum of 1,000 Peruvian soles she requests, she will buy a large quantity of garments to sell in the summer season.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of clothing for the summer season

loans.name: Hun

texts.en:
Hun is from Peareang village, Chaong Maong, Toek Phos, Kampong Chhnang province. He is 40 years old and has three single children who attend school. 

To make a living, he devotes himself, together with his wife, to rice farming.  He has been in the business for almost 19 years and earns around USD 4.00 per day to use to cover household expenses. 

Hun is asking for his first loan of KHR 500,000 to purchase four sacks of fertilizers to sow on his rice farm.  And a portion of the loan will be used to buy two piglets to raise for future sale.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated to make improvements to his family’s house and living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase four sacks of fertilizers to sow his rice farm and to buy two piglets to raise for future sale.

loans.name: Verellin

texts.es:
Verellin es una mujer de 33 años, se caracteriza por ser amable, honesta y muy trabajadora. Lleva una relación de convivencia con Jorge, con quien tiene tres hijos.

Su trabajo es la confección y arreglo de ropa; también diseña sus propios modelos y los ofrece  en su pequeño local, aunque también pone a la venta prendas que compra de otras ciudades al por mayor. Sus clientes confían en ella, ya que su paciencia por cada uno de los detalles hace que su trabajo sea de calidad y los acabados sean siempre satisfactorios. Trabaja sola desde hace 3 años y ha visto que esta actividad le genera buenos ingresos económicos que le han permitido sobrellevar los gastos que se presentan en su familia.
Le gusta mucho lo que hace, aunque algunas veces ha sentido que no podía continuar porque no podía crear un nuevo diseño, por eso empezó a tomar cursos de capacitación en moda y eso le ayudó mucho. Con el tiempo pudo superar ese temor y ahora es una excelente costurera. 

Este es el crédito número 4 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes lo hacen posible, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, está muy comprometida, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo anteriormente. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1000) comprará hilos y tela para continuar con su trabajo de costura, también comprará ropa para venderla en la temporada de verano.
texts.en:
Verellin, age 33, is known for being kind, honest, and very hard-working.  She lives with Jorge, with whom she has three children.

Her work is making and mending clothes.  She also makes her own designs and sells them at her small place.  She also sells garments that she buys wholesale from other cities.  Her customers trust her because she is patient with all of the details so that she produces quality work and that the finishing touches are always satisfactory.

She has been working alone for three years.  She has seen that this business generates good income for her, and it has allowed her to cover the family expenses.  She really likes what she does even though she sometimes has felt that she could not continue because she was not able to create a new design.  That is why she took fashion training courses, and that helped her a lot.  In time she was able to overcome this fear, and she is now an excellent dressmaker.

This is her fourth loan with MFP.  She is grateful to those who make it possible for her to continue with her objectives.  She is very committed, once again, to making her payments punctually, as she did previously.

She is very happy to belong to her communal bank.  All of the members are very good, kind, and supportive.

She will use the requested 1,000 soles to buy thread and fabric to continue with her work as a seamstress.  She will also buy clothes to sell during the summer season.

loans.use: to buy thread and fabric to make clothing.

loans.name: Maria Loreta

texts.en:
This is Maria Loreta. She previously accessed a 9,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and for their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for an 8,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 


Maria Loreta hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
This is Arlene, 40, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Goldman, an electrician and contractor, and she is the mother of four children. She and her husband and children manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Arlene operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Arlene earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Arlene hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for cooking condiments

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 46 years old, married, and has two children. She is from San Jose, Aurora, Zanboanga del Sur. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting corn for sale. She has been in this business for 3 years and she earn 4,000 PHP a month. In 2011, Evelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Evelyn hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina is a 30-year-old woman who is married with three children. She has a small business, making ice cake. She is requesting this loan to buy cement, nails,  and iron roofing. Sina will use the loan to improve her house. Sina joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy cement, nails, and iron roofing

loans.name: Obdulia

texts.es:
Obdulia tiene 42 años, vive con su  esposo y sus cuatro hijos en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de El Tambo.
Hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de dulces y golosinas en la puerta de una escuela primaria cercana a su casa, donde atiende en las horas de recreo y salida. En época de vacaciones aprovecha las clases vacacionales que se dictan en verano en diversos centros educativos de su localidad donde vende sus productos, de esa manera evita que su negocio se estanque. Sabe repartir adecuadamente su tiempo para las labores de su casa y la atención de su negocio, el que cada día realiza valiéndose de su pequeña carreta donde traslada sus dulces. Durante este tiempo de trabajo ha visto las ganancias  de su negocio, por lo que ha decidido aumentar la cantidad de golosinas que ofrece.

Es su cuarto crédito con MFP y considera que es una experiencia positiva integrar un banco comunal, porque le permite conocer más de los buenos manejos de una economía ordenada.
Obdulia invertirá este dinero en la compra de golosinas de toda variedad y precio, además de bebidas para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Obdulia is 42 years old and lives with her husband and their 4 children in her own home, located in the town of El Tambo.

For 4 years, she has been selling candy and sweets at the entrance of an elementary school close to her home.  She makes her sales during recess and after school.  During school vacation, she sells her products at the various educational centers in her town that offer summer classes.  In this way, she can keep her business going.  She knows how to efficiently allocate her time between her housework and her business, which she operates every day using a small cart that she has to transport her sweets.  Over the time she has had this business she has seen profits, and so she has decided to increase the quantity of candy that she offers for sale.

This is her 4th loan with MFP, and she has found being a member of a communal bank to be a positive experience, because it has allowed her to learn good financial management techniques.

Obdulia will invest this loan in the purchase of candy of every variety and price, and she will also purchase drinks to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more candy for her sales post

loans.name: Malia

texts.en:
Malia is 29 years old, married, and has four children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as stationery, drinks, and snacks, which she has been doing for more than two years. 

Malia is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more supplies, such as pens, pencils, and food. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her children's school fees and to help out her extended family.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies such as drinks, stationery, and snacks.

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en:
Lisa is a 40 year old married woman with 5 children.  She has a small plantation and grows banana, taro and yams to earn a living.  She has been doing this for two years. 

Lisa has requested a loan to purchase barred wire, a rake and wheelbarrow. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Lisa hopes to start a good business.

loans.use: to buy barred wire,rake and wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Mun's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Mun is aged 36 years old and married with no children yet. She and her husband reside in the village earning a living through planting cassava as the main source of the family's income and sometimes they work for others for pay. She has been in this business for several years and she still encounters a lack of working capital to support her business. 

Mun successfully paid back her first loan with VisonFund, which has helped her better support her family.  With her current business, she is able to earn 5,500 KHR per day. To deal with her challenges, she is applying for her second loan with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, with her group members who have just been with VisionFund for this loan cycle and one year, respectively. As the leader, she wants to use her portion for labor for land preparation. She hopes to make more income so as to set aside some money for her future needs.

loans.use: To pay for labor for land preparation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Clarissa

texts.en:
This is Clarissa, 41, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Eddie, a "tricycle" driver, and mother to their children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Clarissa operates a bakery. Breads and spreads are staples in the usual Filipino cuisine, and are used mostly for breakfast and snacks. The most popular type of bread is the "Pandesal", a Filipino version of the Spanish Pan de Sal or salted bread. It is baked during the wee hours of the morning and sold steaming hot to early commuters, students and workers. Clarissa's store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy raw ingredients like flour, sugar, and butter, which she needs to continue production and expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 


Clarissa dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients such as flour, sugar, and butter.

loans.name: Haguruka Ukore /rbv Group

texts.fr:
Fréderic  fait partie du groupe Haguruka Ukore /Rbv. Le nom du groupe signifie «lève-toi et travailler». Il a 30 ans, il est marie avec 3 enfants de 6 mois à 5 ans. Son niveau d’éducation est de 4 ans de primaire.

Fréderic est agriculteur maïs. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des semences, 300kgs des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Pour faire croitre son agriculture de riz, il planifie d’acheter d’autres champs pour agrandir l’étendu de son agriculture. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait être le grand fournisseur de maïs dans la région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaire enfants et assure le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fréderic belongs to the Haguruka Ukore/Rbv. Group. The group’s name means “get up and work.” He is 30 years old. He is married, with three children, ranging between six months and five years of age. His educational level   is four years of primary school.

Fréderic is a rice farmer. This is his third loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy seeds, 300 kgs [660 lbs] of chemical fertilizers and pay the cost of labor. In order to expand his business, he plans to buy other fields and increase the volume of rice production. In the years to come, he would like to become a major [rice] producer in the region. He plans to use his revenues to pay the education costs for his children and provide for his family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy seeds, 300 kgs of chemical fertilizers and pay the cost of labor.

loans.name: Fiffawa Group

texts.fr: Le groupement FIFFAWA est formé de dix sept personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Adjouavi Edith Cyprienne est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Adjouavi Edith Cyprienne est âgée de 46 ans, et est mariée à un certain Didier. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et dont deux sont à leur charge. Adjouavi Edith Cyprienne a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Il y a trois ans,Adjouavi Edith Cyprienne vend des vêtements et du charbon de bois par le système de distribution ; ce qui permet d’assurer ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Adjouavi Edith Cyprienne achète ses produits au Bénin et au Togo. C’est la deuxième fois que Adjouavi Edith Cyprienne et les autres membres du groupement FIFFAWA sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The FIFFAWA group has 17 members who all live in the same neighborhood, in Benin.  The group's representative is called Adjouavi Edith Cyprienne and she can be seen raising her hand in the photo.  Adjouavi Edith Cyprienne is 46 years old and married to Didier.  The couple have three children who have all attended school and two of them are still in their care.  Adjouavi Edith Cyprienne stopped attending school at high school level.  She has been selling clothing and charcoal through a distribution system for three years.  This enables her to help her husband in covering their family's expenses.  Adjouavi Edith Cyprienne buys her products in Benin and Togo.  This is the second time that she and the other members of the FIFFAWA group have requested a loan from ALIDé.  The loan will allow them to strengthen their businesses so that they can better respond to their customer demand.  Their first loan was repaid correctly.

loans.use: to buy clothing and sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 47 years old and married to a welder.  She is a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She and her husband manage their own household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lolita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Lolita earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns about 400 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Lolita is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Lolita meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to study God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina tiene 44 años, es una madre luchadora que saca adelante a sus tres hijos, sola. 
Su principal actividad es la agricultura, la realiza en terrenos agrícolas arrendados, pues no tiene unos propios. Sus cultivos de papa, habas y trigo le brindan buenas ganancias en cada cosecha, pues los comercializa en la capital del país, a donde viaja. Ya tiene 19 años de experiencia y en todo este tiempo aprovechó lo necesario para brindar a sus hijos todo lo que necesitaban. También tiene dos toros, con los cuales realiza el arado de tierra, pues si alquila otros, le cobran 100 nuevos soles por día y eso no le conviene. Ahora trabajará con más ahínco para brindarles una mejor educación a sus hijos.

Este es el crédito número 14 con MFP y espera concretar sus planes con este apoyo financiero. Por otro lado, promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos. Además, le agrada ser parte de su grupo porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. 
Delfina invertirá este dinero en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus próximos sembríos.
texts.en:
Delfina, age 44, is a tenacious mother who gets her three children ahead alone.  Her main business activity is agriculture. She does this on rented farm land as she does not have her own land.  She grows potatoes, beans, and wheat.  They provide good income with each harvest.  She travels to the capital of the country to sell the harvests.  She has 19 years of experience, and in all of this time she did what was necessary in order to give her children everything they needed.

She also has two bulls, and she uses them to plough the land.  If she rented others it would cost 100 soles a day, and she does not want to do that.  She will now work with greater effort in order to provide her children with a better education.

This is her fourteenth loan with MFP.  She hopes to carry out her plans with this financial support.  She pledges to make her payments as she has done with her previous loans.  She is pleased to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people.

Delfina will use the loan to buy natural fertilizers to spread among her next crops.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Akouegnon Antoine

texts.fr: Akouegnon Antoine est âgé de 34 ans et est marié à un certain Béatrice. Le couple a quatre enfants à leur charge, dont certains sont scolarisés. Parmi les quatre enfants, seulement deux représentent leurs propres enfants. Akouegnon Antoine vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants et assure avec sa femme les charges du ménage. Akouegnon Antoine n’a pas fréquenté l’école, mais a appris la coiffure, activité qu’il exerce depuis une quinzaine d’année. De façon secondaire, Akouegnon Antoine vend de l’huile de palme qu'il produit à base de noix de palme. C’est la quatrième fois que Akouegnon Antoine sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Akouegnon Antoine is 34 years old and married to Béatrice.  The couple have four children in their care and some of them attend school.  Of the four children they care for, only two are their own children.  Akouegnon Antoine lives together with his wife and children and both he and his wife cover their household expenses.  Akouegnon Antoine did not attend school but learned hairdressing.  He has been in this business for around 15 years.  In addition, he also sells palm oil which he produces from palm nuts.  This is the fourth time that Akouegnon Antoine has requested a loan from ALIDé.  He hopes that it will help him to boost his business and better satisfy his customers.  All of his previous loans were repaid correctly.

loans.use: to buy hairdressing products and palm nuts

loans.name: Salafai

texts.en:
Salafai is a 40-year-old married woman with 5 children. She has a small plantation and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. Salafai has requested a loan to buy farming supplies such as a rake, a shovel and barbed wire.

She became a member of SPBD in 2012. With her profits, Salafai hopes to extend her vegetable garden and to help with her childerns' school fees.

loans.use: to buy farming tools such as a rake, a shovel, fertilizer and barbed wire

loans.name: Un's Group

texts.en:
Un is aged 40 years old and married. She lives with her husband and four dependent children, who are still in school, in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been farming rice on one hectare of farmland and planting cassava on two hectares of farmland for almost twenty-one years, earning around 8,500 KHR per day to spend for daily basic needs. A lack of working capital is still her main challenge in growing her business. 

Un's group consists of three members who are all females and they successfully repaid their loan with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to apply for a second loan with VisionFund to solve their challenges. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy gasoline for a pumping machine to carry water into her rice field and use a portion of it for labor. She hopes to grow her rice healthfully and increase crop yields so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy gasoline for a pumping machine

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Feagaiga

texts.en:
Feagaiga is a 29-year-old married woman with six children. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Feagaiga has requested a loan to buy fertilizers, taro shoots, rakes and shovels. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2012. With her profits, Feagaiga hopes to extend her plantation and to bulid her family a new house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, taro shoots, rakes, and shovels

loans.name: Serenidad Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado serenidad es de la ciudad de Itá, está integrado por 16 mujeres, todas ellas muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, con muchas ganas de salir adelante y trabajar. Gracias a su esfuerzo ya están en el ciclo número 12 del programa de mujeres de la fundación paraguaya.
Apolonia es miembro del grupo, y nos comenta que formar parte del grupo le ha ayudado mucho no solo a ella sino también a los miembros de su familia. Ella se dedica a la costura, y cuenta que por medio de este trabajo ha podido ayudar a su familia y darles lo que necesitan para el día a día.
Apolonia solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y ayudando a sus familiares.
texts.en:
The Serenidad group is from the city of Itá.  It has 16 members who are all very hard-working and entrepreneurial women who have a great desire to work and make progress in life.  Thanks to their efforts, they are now in their 12th loan cycle within Fundación Paraguaya' Women's Program.

Apolonia is a member of this group.  She tells us that being a member of the group has really helped not only herself but also the other members of her family.  Apolonia's business is sewing and she says that, through this work, she has been able to help her family and provide for them on a daily basis.

Apolonia is requesting this loan to buy fabric which will enable her to continue working and helping her family members.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 34 years old. Marilyn is married and has four children. 

To make a living, Marilyn runs a general store that sells a variety of food and home use products in her local community. Marilyn has been in her business for two years and earns 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Marilyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2011, Marilyn joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
This is Angela, 51, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Quintelo, a tricycle driver, and she is a mother of four children. One of her children is already working. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Angela operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Angela earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Angela hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to have a peaceful life and a life close to God.

She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products to sell

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 42-year-old married woman with three children: one daughter and two sons. Aside from her youngest son, the other two are getting education. Yasmeen's husband is a driver by profession. He drives a rickshaw and provides transportation services to passengers. He has set fares according to the destinations, and the passengers don’t argue about it.

Yasmeen herself is also a very hardworking lady. She is involved in a sewing business, and her work is home-based. She collects orders from neighboring customers and earns well by completing them on time. She has been operating her business for more than 4 years. She also provides embroidery services to her customers. She crafts beautiful embroidery designs on clothes, which helps her attract many more customers. 

Yasmeen will use the loan to purchase a sewing machine because with her current machine it takes a lot of time to sew a single dress. She will also use the loan to purchase embroidery materials such as beads, colored thread, and sketches for the further improvement of her sewing & embroidery business. She is very hopeful about her business growth after this loan investment.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and embroidery materials for her sewing & embroidery business

loans.name: Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El comité  “ Niño Jesús; Actualmente se encuentra en el segundo ciclo, y tiene 12 integrantes, ellas están muy contentas por la oportunidad que le brinda la Fundación Paraguaya, ya que por medio del trabajo en conjunto podrán ayudar a sus familias y darles lo que necesitan para una mejor vida.
Adriana es la presidenta del grupo, y nos dice que siempre se esfuerza por poder ayudar a sus amigas, ya que desean que ellas mismas puedan superarse y ser buenas microempresarias. Ella tiene una pequeña despensa en su casa, donde tiene los principales productos para poder surtir a sus vecinos. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y de a poco ir agrandando su local.
Adriana solicita el crédito para la compra de verduras, lacteos, panificados, hortalizas y demás insumos para poder surtir su negocio y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The "Niño Jesús" committee are currently in their second loan cycle.  The group has 12 members who are very happy with the opportunity they are receiving from Fundación Paraguaya because, through their joint work, they are able to help their families and give them what they need for a better life.

Adriana is the president of this group.  She tells us that she always works hard so that she can help her friends because they would like to be able to do well and become good micro-businesswomen.  Adriana has a small grocery store in her home where she stocks products that she sells to her neighbors.  Her goal is to be able to continue working and gradually expand her premises.

Adriana is requesting this loan to buy vegetables, dairy products, baked goods and other supplies that she needs for her business, so that she can continue working.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, dairy products, baked goods and other supplies

loans.name: Faavevela

texts.en:
Faavevela is a 44-year-old married woman with five children. She has a small plantation and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Faavevela has requested a loan to buy more seeds, rakes, picks, shovels and a wheelbarrow. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2012. With her profits, Faavevela hopes to pay for her childern's school fees and to save up for future plans.

loans.use: to buy seeds, rakes, gloves, picks, shovels and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Gaga

texts.en: Gaga is 34 years old and married with four children. She makes and sells Elei materials to earn a living and has been doing this for two years. Gaga has requested a loan to buy more materials, paint brushes and paints. She plans to use her profits to pay for her childern's school fees. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy more materials, designs, and more paints

loans.name: Simean's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Simean is a 27-year-old mother of two dependent children who are still in school. She and her husband are peasants who have been farming maize for eight years to make a living and sometimes they work for others for pay to better support their children. With her current business, she is able to earn around 7,000 KHR per day and she is still in a lack of capital for farming. 

This is the second loan for Simean's group of three female members who live in the same village. The first loan from VisionFund has helped Simean better support her family. Now leading her group to apply for a loan of 1,200,000 KHR each, Simean will use her portion to buy fertilizers and use a portion of it to spend for labor. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields and make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina tiene 38 años, vive al lado de sus dos hijas en una casa arrendada.
Desde hace 4 años que tiene un restaurante, donde ella misma prepara los alimentos y sus hijos la apoyan en la atención y servicio a los clientes. Sirve desayunos y almuerzos, y por la tarde descansa. Le agrada su trabajo, ya que siempre vende toda la comida de cada día, los platos que prepara son muy ricos, pues su secreto es el amor que le pone a su labor. Reconoce que en varias oportunidades se sintió cansada, ya que el trabajo es sacrificado y requiere de mucho tiempo, pero su negocio ha crecido y está muy feliz. 

Este el cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP y está muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. 
Marina invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de ingredientes para sus comidas; como arroz, azúcar, aceite, huevos y otros comestibles.
texts.en:
Marina, age 38, lives next door to her two daughters in a rented house.  She has had a restaurant for four years.  She prepares the food herself, and her children help her wait on the customers.  She serves breakfasts and lunches, and in the afternoon she rests.

Her work pleases her because she always sells all of her food every day.  The dishes she prepares are delicious, and her secret is the love that she puts into her work.  She realizes that sometimes she felt tired because it is hard work that requires a lot of time.  However, her business has grown, and she is very happy.

This is her fourth loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She is pleased to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people.

Marina will use the requested loan to buy ingredients for her food.  She will buy things like rice, sugar, cooking oil, eggs, and other food.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients to make her food.

loans.name: Mebakari

texts.en:
Mebakari is an entrepreneur who has made progress in her goal thanks to her capacity for work and love for her family, which consists of her two children. She is the owner of a beauty salon, which she began two years ago. 

Mebakari has slowly been able to expand what she offers, including manicures and pedicures.  Her customers are made up of her neighbors, many of whom are working. 

Mebakari is requesting her fifth loan from the Yehu Microfinance Trust, which she will use to purchase chemicals, hair oil, shampoos, and hair treatments. Her dream is to expand her market, but her working capital is often insufficient in order to meet her goals of prosperity.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals, hair oil, shampoos, and hair treatments

loans.name: Oruj

texts.en:
Oruj is 52 years old, married, and has one child. He is involved in the agriculture business, selling meat and milk products. 

Oruj is requesting a loan for 1,000 AZN, which he will use to buy construction materials to repair his home.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to repair his home.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 40 years old and is married with five children. She lives in Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She operates a sand and gravel business and earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month. Merlyn has been a member of PMPC for five years.

Merlyn is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan to finance her sand and gravel quarry. In the future, she hopes to purchase delivery trucks for her business.

loans.use: To be used in financing her sand and gravel quarrying business

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rope making business in the Philippines. Fe has been in this business for three years. Fe earns additional income from food vending.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her rope making business.

Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her rope making.

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
This is Kristine, from Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines, She previously availed herself of a PHP 9,000 loan that she used to purchase merchandise and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a PHP 20,000 loan to buy more merchandise and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she can offer the better and more items she sells will result in better profits. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Kristine hopes to grow her business and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise and products for her direct-sales business.

loans.name: Charily

texts.en:
Charily is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell. 

Charily has been in this business for 20 years. Charily earns more income from raising pigs and farming vegetables.

Charily has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Chou

texts.en:
Chou is 46 years old and a married woman with five single children, living in a peaceful village of Baray district, Kompong Tom province. Three of her children are still student and completely depend on her support while the other two are now working in a garment factory as sewing staff. Agricultural business is the main part of her family. She and her husband work together at the field, growing rice, corns, and some kinds of green vegetables for their livelihoods. Typically, they are able to earn a good income each harvesting season. And they use this income to spend on daily sustenance, buy home use products, allowances for her children.

In this coming season, Chou will start growing corns but due to the shortage finance, she is now seeking for a loan of KHR 2,000,000 to purchase seeds for growing and pay for the process of planting her corn crops. She is very happy with the support in her business and thankful to all of you. This loan will have a good impact to her business and she hopes to obtain a fruitful harvest from this investment.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for growing and pay for the process of planting her corn crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is married and has five children, who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Pamela is 42 years old.

Pamela has an agricultural supply retail business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy more feed, vitamins, and other agricultural supplies to sell.

She has been in this business for 26 years. Pamela would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more feed, vitamins, and other agricultural supplies to sell.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma lives in Likoni, Mombasa. She works every day because her dream is to have a store that is well known in her town. In order to do this, she sells household consumables at her retail shop to her neighbors and passersby. With this, she has managed to save and invest in another business that has provided the opportunity to generate new income. 

The lack of working capital is Mwanajuma’s biggest challenge to her dreams. She has turned to Kiva credit for her second loan with Yehu Microfinance Trust. With her Kiva credit, she will buy household consumables, including wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar, which are in high demand in every household. Her loan should be successful because her sales are based on customer orders. What she buys has a fast turnover, which causes her working capital to turn quickly and therefore increase her profits. Choosing good customers would increase the recovery of her capital and thereby her earnings.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.en: Saturnino lives in Santa Cruz, Kapatagan, Philippines. For five years, he has operated a transportation services business to support the needs of his child. He gets an income of 5,000 PHP a month from this business. For a 60-year old father, there’s nothing that can make him happier than to see his child successful in school. Saturnino wants to borrow 5,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to repair the transport vehicle used in his business. He joined GDMPC in 2011. His plan for the future is to improve his business.

loans.use: to repair her transport vehicle used in his business

loans.name: Divino Niño Group

texts.es:
Descripción	El Comité Divino Niño actualmente está en el tercer ciclo, trabajando arduamente y tratando de sobrellevar cualquier inconveniente que pueda surgir. Son muy unidas y trabajadoras y desean poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa de mujeres de la fundación Paraguaya.
Isabel forma parte del grupo, y cuenta que se dedica a la venta de joyas de todo tipo, como ser anillos, cadenas, pulseras, y demás clases. Se define a sí misma como una persona muy trabajadora y con muy buena pasta en las ventas, por lo que le va muy bien. Sueña con poder tener algún día su propia joyería y de esa forma tener mayores ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
Isabel en miras a ese sueño trabaja y se esfuerza, es por ello que solicita el préstamo, para la compra de joyas de plata, de todo tipo, con lo cual podrá tener mayor variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes, y también atraer a más.
texts.en:
The 'Divino Niño' (Divine Child) committee are currently in their third loan cycle and working hard, trying to overcome any problems that may cross their paths.  They are very united and hard working and would like to reach the top level of Fundación Paraguaya's Women's Program.

Isabel is a member of this group.  Her business is selling all kinds of jewelry such as rings, chains, bracelets, etc.  She describes herself as a very hard-working person who has an aptitude for sales which means that her business is doing very well.  She dreams of some day owning her own jewelry store so that she can make more income with which to help her family. 

Isabel works hard with a view to fulfilling her dream.  She is requesting this loan to buy all kinds of silver jewelry which will enable her to have a wider range available to sell to her customers.  This will also help her to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy jewelry to sell

loans.name: Marion

texts.en:
Marion is married and has four children; two are attending school. She owns rental houses; her potential customers are tenants. She has been in the business for two years. She hopes to expand her rental houses in the future. 

Since she joined Yehu Microfinance Kenya, she has known how to manage her business well because she has been trained in business management. She needs a loan of 12,725 Kes. to pay for her medical insurance coverage which covers her and five  family members, to be renewed annually.

loans.use: to pay for her medical insurance coverage

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is married and has one child who attends school. She lives in Likoni, Mombasa where she works at her green grocery shop. For the past two years, she’s been selling vegetables, potatoes, and onions to support her home. 

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan because she wants to strengthen her business more each time and plans to use this loan to buy sacks of potatoes, vegetables, onions, and fruit at a much more special price than usual because she has the capacity to buy at wholesale prices with her Kiva loan which will make the investment successful. This is why she’s very competitive when she sells the produce and earns more each time.

loans.use: to buy sacks of potatoes, vegetables, onions, and fruit

loans.name: Jojit

texts.en:
This is Jojit, 38, resident of Bacoor,Cavite city, Philippines. She is married to Jecon, a driver. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jojit maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. The dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing in as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy merchandise items and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Jojit hopes that her business will continue to be successful. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products needed in her business

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman and has one child who attends school. She lives in Likoni, Mombasa where she works at her beauty shop. For the past two years, she’s been operating her salon to support her home. 

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan because she wants to strengthen her business more each time and plans to use this loan to purchase chemicals, oils, shampoos and towels at a much more special price than usual because she has the capacity to buy at wholesale prices with her Kiva loan which will make the investment successful.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals, oils, shampoos and towels

loans.name: Maria Group

texts.es:
Este comité llamado MARIA, surge mediante la gestión de una de las miembros, quien con las ganas de ayudar a sus amigas y vecinas se acerco a la fundación para saber más, y es así como surge el grupo. Tiene 12 integrantes  en donde todas tienen una pequeña actividad a la cual se dedican por más pequeña que sea.
Maria, es una de las miembros, y comenta que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo arduo ha podido salir adelante y crecer.
