She is applying for her first loan of KES. 20,000 from KADET LTD. She plans to add more variety of fruits and fresh vegetables and expand her work stall. 

The anticipated profits will support her expansion plan. Her future plans are to own residential houses.

loans.use: To purchase assorted fruits and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia lives in Samburu with her five children aged between 1 and 18 years old. She dreams of a promising future in which she is able to provide her little one with the potential for success. Her children are the motivation behind her work selling greengrocery items, selling vegetables, fruit, onions and tomatoes. Her business is open on weekends and holidays. It is located in her home and she sells for cash to passersby in her area as well as to neighbors, family members and friends. They are familiar with the products that Rukia sells and are loyal to her business. 

Rukia's goal is to achieve sustainable growth and, in this way, improve her family's income. Her biggest challenge is to build up enough working capital to be able to grow her business. With the loan, she wants to purchase a motorcycle to help her distribute products to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to help her distribute products to her customers.

loans.name: Mahsatoi

texts.ru: Махсатой трудолюбивая и добрая женщина, она замужем и на воспитании имеет двоих детей, одну дочку, она родилась в 1994 году, а её брат родился в 1989 года. Махсатой занимается куплей –продажей скота. Она начала свой бизнес с 1992 года . А так же она работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Получает зарплату 890 сомони. Зарплата не хватает в содержании семьи. В бизнесе ей помогает муж. Скот приобретает с местного скотного рынка Янгиобод. Ранее она кредитовалась в групповом займе для  закупа  КРС, чтобы расширить свой бизнес. Она обратилась в «Имон Интернешнл» и уже 7-й цикл как она кредитуется. В настоящее время она обратилась за займом в размере 4000сомони для ремонта дома. Она намерена закупить на полученный займ блочный кирпич,  песок, цемент для фасадной штукатурки дома и для устройства кладки стен цемблока.
texts.en: Mahsatoi is a hardworking and kind woman.  She is married and raising two children: one daughter, born in 1994, and her brother, born in 1989.  Mahsatoi is involved in buying and selling of livestock.  She started her business in 1992.  She also works at the dekhan farm.  She earns a salary of 890 somoni, which is not enough to support the family.  Her husband helps her with the business.  Mahsatoi buys livestock at the local "Yangiobod" market.  She was previously part of a group loan to purchase cattle in order to expand her business.  She then came to "Imon International" and has now been obtaining loans here for the 7th cycle.  Currently, Mahsatoi is requesting a loan in the amount of 4000 somoni to repair her house.  She intends to use this loan to buy block bricks, sand, cement for the facade plastering of the house, and to buy equipment for laying walls cement blocks.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Emprendamos El Futuro Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “EMPRENDAMOS EL FUTURO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nelly ella es conviviente y tiene 35 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de venta de artesanía, la socia hace trabajos de artesanías como cocinas de arcilla, platos entre otros trabajos, ella lo vende en forma ambulatoria y lo ofrece en el diferentes lugares donde vende artesanía, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer los trabajos de artesanía como arcilla, pegamentos, pinceles y pinturas.
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de carteras, negocio de venta de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de cabinas de librería y negocio de venta de ropa.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These people belong to the “EMPRENDAMOS EL FUTURO” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Nelly is a member of this group.  She is 35 years old, lives with her partner, and has one child.  Her business is selling handicrafts such as clay stoves, dishes and other items.  She makes her sales as an itinerant vendor in different places where handicrafts are sold.  Nelly works from 8.00am to 6.00pm and this is how she provides for her child.  Nelly's dream is to expand her handicrafts business.  She is requesting this loan to buy materials for making handicrafts such as clay, adhesives, brushes and paints.

The other members of this group work selling purses, groceries, stationery and clothing.

Nelly is grateful to those who will take part in helping her to achieve her dream in this way.  She pledges to make her loan repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy materials for making handicrafts (clay, adhesives, brushes and paints)

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is 44 years old.  She is married and has two children, a son and a daughter.  She lives in Ho Chi Minh City with her husband, who is a driver for hire, and her children.

She has run a general store from her house for four years.  She sells milk, beverages, stationery and confectionery.  She intends to use her loan to buy a variety of products to sell including eggs, sugar and sanitation items.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will enable her to both improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products to sell including eggs, sugar and sanitation items.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 62 years old and married to Dinah who also helps in the upkeep of the family through subsistence farming. He supports a family of ten people; they were blessed with nine children aged between 10 and 32 years. Joel runs a business buying and selling green tea leaves and has been in operation for a period of five years earning a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

He is servicing his third loan of KES. 30,000 from KADET LTD, after successfully repaying his previous loans. He intends to use the loan to purchase more stock of green tea leaves for resale.

 The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and the remaining amount to provide for the needs of his family. His hopes and dreams are to venture into large-scale tea farming.

loans.use: To purchase green tea leaves for resale.

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom has requested a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the improvement of her son’s rickshaw transport business. With the loan investment he will replace his rickshaw body and that will allow him to secure his business asset and provide better transport services to his passengers.

He is a very hardworking person and Kalsoom is hopeful that the loan will be productive one for him. She has three other children who remain at home. She is a great mother and takes good care of her family. She is confident about her family’s better future.

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw body for rickshaw transport business

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is a 40-year-old married woman.  She lives in Ho Chi Minh City with her husband and four daughters.  For two years she has run a meat shop, selling meat to people in her community.

Huong is requesting a loan in order to purchase better quality meat at competitive prices from wholesalers.  She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers as well as to attract new customers. 

She also hopes that, through this loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money to leverage against any future difficulties her family faces.

loans.use: to purchase better quality meat to sell.

loans.name: Tukei

texts.en:
Tukei is 35 years old, married and supports a family of six. For the last two years he has worked his farm, including raising sheep to sell. He earns a monthly income of 47,000 KES.

This will be Tukei’s second loan from KADET LTD. He is requesting 100,000 KES, with which he plans to buy sheep to fatten and resell later during peak season.

Tukei’s anticipated profits will be invested in his farm. His ambition is to have a happy life for both himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy sheep to fatten and resell.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan, Sakina bought sacks of charcoal for resale. Since then, her business has expanded and she plans to purchase a boda boda (motorcycle) to use in supplying her goods to her customers. Now she is applying for a new Kiva loan, because she has a vast area of customers to supply products to, as she has an established clientele, and Sakina's working capital is insufficient to meet the growth in demand.

Her Kiva loan will be successful because she will respond to demand by buying a motorcycle for transportation for her business. Sakina tells lenders that her Kiva loans have been very useful to her. She says thank you, and may they continue helping her.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her goods transport.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Francisco tiene 67 años de edad, es casado, vive con su esposa  y un hijo. Él es agricultor desde muy niño, aprendió con su papá ya que ejercía la misma actividad. Debido a que en su momento solo se pensaba en trabajar la tierra y no en estudiar. Así creció don Francisco y hoy manifiesta que se siente muy feliz de ver crecer su milpa. 

Él compra y vende en el mercado más próximo; para llegar ahí tiene que trasladarse a grandes distancias en vehiculo, luego se le presenta otra dificultad como lo es el acceso a su casa, por que debe trasladar los insumos que compra en el lomo de un caballo y por su edad ya se le dificulta ese ajetreo. 

El préstamo que solicita a Fundación Campo, es para comprar los insumos agrícolas y para pagar el alquiler del terreno donde cultivara. Con el préstamo tendrá la facilidad para pagar principalmente el alquiler del terreno y de esta manera garantizar el lugar donde cultivar satisfactoriamente. Además, garantizara el alimento para su familia; pues comenta que aunque sus recursos económicos son limitados, la ventaja más grande en su situación actual es tener la cosecha para su sustento diario. También, sus proyecciones a futuro es tener un terreno propio para cultivar y que su hijo continué trabajando como él lo ha hecho hasta hoy.
texts.en:
Sr. Francisco, 67, is married.  He lives with his wife and son.  He learned farming from his father when he was just a boy.  At that time, working the land was considered more important than going to school.  That's the way it was for don Francisco and he says now that he is just happy to tend his crop.

He buys and sells at a local market.  He has to travel a long way by vehicle to go to and from the market and the extra distance to his house is also difficult.  He has to carry the supplies he brings on horseback, not an easy thing for a man his age.    

Don Francisco is applying to Fundacion Campo for a loan, part of which he will use to buy supplies for his farming business and part to pay rent on the land where he grows his crop.  The investment will make it easy for him to pay the rent upfront and thereby guarantee a good spot for planting.  The investment will also ensure that he can feed his family.  He tells us that though his financial resources are limited, the great advantage of his situation is that he can grow the crops he and his family need to live from day to day.  He wants to buy a farm of his own in the future so that he can grow his crops on his land and have something to leave for his son.

loans.use: to pay expenses for his farming business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and medical bills. For the past ten years she has run a grocery shop.

With her previous Yehu loan Susan bought soap, detergents, wheat flour, maize flour and beans, thus increasing her working capital slightly. Now she is applying for a 40,000 KES from Yehu because she has a growing clientele and Susan's working capital is insufficient to meet demand.

Susan plans to buy more stock for her grocery and to install a water tank from which she’ll sell fresh water. She tells the lenders that her Yehu loans have been very useful to her. She says thank you, and may you continue helping her.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her grocery and to install a water tank from which she’ll sell fresh water.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 28 years old and married to John. Together they have one child aged three-years-old.

She sells computer games, CDs, and other related materials, a business she has been running for the last five years.

Lilian has applied for a loan to buy a generator and a P3 machine. She hopes that once she invests this loan she will get better returns and even be able her to expand and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy a generator and a P3 machine.

loans.name: Floriana

texts.en:
Floriana is married and lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. She operates a water selling stall, selling fresh water to her neighbors and passersby. 

She is focused on improving her personal life and satisfying her customers' needs. At present, she is using her Kiva loan, which is her first loan with the Yehu Microfinance Trust, to start another business of buying and selling firewood. She will buy bundles of firewood for resale. She needs to purchase firewood for her business to better respond to her customers and also to be able to sell to them and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy bundles of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Houssein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 43 years old, married but still doesn’t have any children.

Houssein has owned a coffee shop since 2010, offering different types beverages. He has a sufficient experience in this field, a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting  a $2400 loan to pay the annual rent for the store. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide  better life conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for the store.

loans.name: Adilia

texts.es:
Adilia tiene 61 años, es una mujer emprendedora, honesta y muy trabajadora. No tiene ninguna pareja hace mucho años, sin embargo tiene tres hijos que ya son mayores. Vive en su casa propia al lado del menor de sus hijos llamado Sedny. Ambos comparten el día a día de trabajo, esfuerzo y lucha por seguir adelante.

Su actividad principal es la venta de alimentos, principalmente carne de animales silvestres como venado, tapir, tortugas, majas y gallinas de chacra, lo complementa con la venta de plátanos y frutas de la región. Antiguamente criaba estas especies en su propia chacra y de ahí se abastecía, pero ahora las compra de los pobladores del campo o comunidades nativas. Realiza esta actividad hace 20 años, lo hace con mayor énfasis cuando en la ciudad se celebra alguna festividad o acontecimiento importante. Así también vende ropa usada y productos de perfumería hace 2 años, de manera eventual. Todos estos trabajos le generan buenos ingresos y le dan tranquilidad económica.
Lo que le gusta de su labor es que le permite tener contacto con las personas, le da vitalidad y mucha energía al estar en constante actividad física y sobre todo se siente feliz porque puede generar sus propios ingresos económicos para continuar solventado sus gastos.

Este es el crédito número 7 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Asimismo se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo anteriormente. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1500) comprará gallinas de chacra, carne de tortuga y de otros animales silvestres; también plátanos por racimos y algunas frutas.
texts.en: Adilia is 61 years old. She is a very hard-working, entrepreneurial, honest woman who has not had a partner for many years. However, she has three children who are all now adults. Adilia lives in her own home alongside her youngest son whose name is Sedny. Every day the pair both work and make efforts to make progress. Adilia's main business is selling food, mainly meat from wild animals such as deer, tapirs, turtles, paca and farmyard hens. In addition, she also sells bananas and regional fruits. In the past, she would raise these species on her own farm and thereby supply her own business with animals. Now, however, she buys them from people in the countryside and those living in indigenous communities. She has been in this business for 20 years and works extra hard when the town is celebrating a festival or important event. Adilia has also been selling used clothing and perfumes for two years on a casual basis. All of these businesses make her good income and provide her with financial peace of mind. What Adilia likes about her work is the fact that she is in contact with other people. Being physically active all the time gives her a lot of energy and vitality. Above all, she feels happy because she is able to make her own income and thereby continue covering her own expenses. This is Adilia's seventh loan from MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support because it makes her feel more secure as she makes progress in her work. For this reason, she pledges once again to make her loan repayments on time as she has in the past. She is very happy to belong to her community bank because all the members of the bank are very responsible and supportive. Adilia will use the 1,500 she has requested to buy farmyard hens, turtle meat and other wild animal meat. She will also buy bananas by the bunch and some other fruit.

loans.use: to buy wild animal meat and other products to sell

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es:
Ángela tiene 33 años, es una mujer sencilla, muy amable y trabajadora. Está separada de su esposo, con quien tiene tres hijos de 14, 9 y 4 años. Junto a ellos, vive en la casa que construyó con su ex esposo, ahora es propietaria del terreno que más adelante será distribuido en partes iguales a cada uno de sus hijos. Por ahora, solo se esmera a diario para ofrecerles todo lo necesario. 

Su trabajo es la venta de bebidas típicas de la región, cada uno de sus refrescos son elaborados con las frutas más frescas que consigue en el mercado principal de la ciudad. Trabaja durante 12 horas al día en su puesto ubicado en una esquina muy comercial de su zona. Inicialmente vendía en la puerta de su casa, más adelante lo hizo por toda la ciudad llevando sus baldes con refresco en una carretilla, pero ahora tiene su puesto gracias a un convenio con la Municipalidad de su distrito, y ahora vende mucho más que antes gracias. Desde niña se dedica a esta actividad y ya lleva 20 años haciéndolo, ha trabajado siempre sola. Y aunque ahora le va muy bien, reconoce que al principio tuvo muchas dificultades, pues no sabia preparar muy bien los refrescos; sin embargo, ahora se ha vuelto una experta y sus deliciosas bebidas son consideradas las mejores de su sector. Está muy contenta porque la rentabilidad de este negocio le permitió realizar muchos cambios y mejoras en sus condiciones de vida. Le gusta mucho lo que hace, le agrada conversar con sus clientes y de esta forma conocer sus preferencias, gustos de sabores. Para más adelante desea tener una tienda o una fuente de soda donde pueda vender mayor variedad de refrescos y helados de frutas regionales.

Este es el crédito número 3 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes lo hacen posible, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, está muy comprometida, una vez más, con cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, como lo hizo anteriormente. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios entre sí.

El monto solicitado (S/. 1500) lo invertirá en la compra de las frutas y demás ingredientes que necesita para continuar vendiendo sus refrescos. También comprará helados de frutas regionales y una congeladora pequeña de S/. 500 para conservarlos.
texts.en:
Ángela is 33. She is a modest woman; very friendly and hard-working. She is separated from her husband, with whom she has three children, ages 14, 9 and 4. She lives with them in the house she built with her ex-husband. Now she is the owner of a piece of land that someday will be divided in equal parts among her children. For now, she just does her daily best to provide them with everything they need.

Her work is selling traditional drinks of the region. Each one of her fruit drinks is made with the freshest fruit that she gets at the city's main market. She works 12 hours a day at her stand, located at a corner in her area, that has a lot of commercial activity. To begin with, she used to sell at the door of her home, but later did so all over the city, carrying her fruit drink containers in a cart. But now she has her stand, thanks to  an agreement with the municipal authority of her district, and now sells much more than before. 

She has worked at this livelihood from a young age, and now has been doing it for 20 years, always working alone. And even though now it is going very well, she acknowledges that at the beginning she had many difficulties, as she didn't know how to prepare the fruit drinks very well. However, now she has become an expert and her delicious drinks are considered the best in her part of the city. She is very happy, because the profitability of this business has allowed her to make many changes and improvements in her living conditions. She really likes what she does. She enjoys talking with her customers and that way knowing their preferences and tastes when it comes to flavors. 

This is her third loan with MFP, so she is grateful to those who make it possible for her to continue toward her goals. Moreover, she is very committed to once more making her installment payments on time, as she did previously. And she is very happy about belonging to her communal bank, as all the members are good and friendly, and supportive of one another. 

She will use the amount applied for (1,500 nuevos soles) to purchase fruit and other ingredients that she needs to continue selling her fruit drinks. She will also buy ice creams made from the fruit of the region, as well as a small freezer to store them, for 500 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To buy fruit and other ingredients for making her fruit drinks.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is from Iraq. She is thirty years old, married and has three children.

Since 2010 Rana has worked as a seamstress from her home. She makes, repairs or alters clothes such as suits, coats and trousers for women and children. She understands her customers and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation and is well known in her neighborhood.

Rana is requesting 1200 USD from CHF through its youth loan program. With it she will buy a sewing machine. She is aiming to increase her profits and provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice lives in Samburu, Kenya and has a family business selling groceries such as beans, rice, sugar and peas. Her business started two years ago. She is gradually making progress attracting customers, mainly in the neighborhood. Now she is applying for her first Kiva loan though Yehu Microfinance, because she needs to grow and to do that she needs to find suppliers from whom she can buy in volume and on a cash basis, as they offer a better price. This is the reason for this Kiva loan, the second loan that she has taken from Yehu Microfinance Trust. She will use this loan to buy sacks of rice, beans, peas and sugar. Her investment will be successful because she will get discounts that will increase her profits right away, and also benefit her customers. Her goal for the future is to have her own place where she could operate a big grocery store.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, beans, peas and sugar.

loans.name: Djranudo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DJRANUDO est formé de quatre personnes qui sont des amies et résident dans le même village. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Ablan Séverine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Ablan Séverine est âgée de 49 ans et est  mariée à un certain Jean. Le couple a un enfant, scolarisé. Ablan Séverine vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Il y a une quinzaine d’année que Ablan Séverine mène comme activité, la vente produits divers à son domicile.  Ablan Séverine s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire, Ablan Séverine sollicite pour la cinquième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les quatre crédits obtenus précédemment ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
DJRANUDO is a group of four people who are friends and who live in the same village. The group’s representative is Ablan Séverine, seen with her hand raised in the photo. Ablan Séverine, age 49, is married to a man named Jean. The couple have one child who goes to school. Ablan Séverine lives with her husband and their child, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. 

Ablan Séverine has been selling various goods from her home for about 15 years. She buys her merchandise at a market in Benin.

To achieve customer satisfaction and to increase her revenue, Ablan Séverine is seeking a fifth loan from ALIDé. All four previous loans were correctly repaid

loans.use: to buy various products for resale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 58 years old, married, and blessed with four children aged between 27 and seven years. John runs a hides-and-skins business in Marigat Town. He has been in this business for the last 20 years. From this business he gets an average income of Kshs. 20,000 a month.

Joseph has taken out a loan of KES. 70,000 from KADET LTD. This is his fourth loan, after successfully paying off his previous loan.  He will use the loan to purchase more hides and skins for resale. With the anticipated profits he intends to pay school fees for his children and expand his business. 

His future plan is to start a new business in order to diversify his sources of income and also give the best education to his children.

loans.use: To purchase hides and skins for resale

loans.name: Jose Rolando

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en el negocio, él comprara productos como queso, arroz, frijoles, aceite, detergentes, entre otros que son necesarios para poder ofrecer a los clientes, este préstamo  será una gran ayuda para José, porque va a surtir el negocio.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a realizar la compra de mercadería, y ofrecerla a sus clientes, dándole una mejor aceptación y proveyendo lo necesario a su familia.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan so that he can invest in his business. He will buy products such as cheese, rice, beans, oil, detergents, and other necessary items to offer to his customers. This loan will be a great help to José because he can continue to restock his business.

His previous loan helped him to buy merchandise to offer to his customers. This helped him gain greater recognition and he was able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy cheese, rice, beans, oil, and detergents.

loans.name: Emprendedores De La Juan Antonio Rios Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Emprendedores de la Juan Antonio Ríos” está conformado por 18 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales  se encuentran; confección, feriantes, venta de artículos de cumpleaños, peluquería, almacén. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Independencia ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Nicole, presidenta del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el primer lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste un pantalón de color azul, encima lleva puesto un chaleco de color café, usa un cartera de color café, y su cabello lo usa tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la confección, específicamente a la confección de ropa de mujer, desde hace 3 años. Comenta que trabaja en su taller establecido en su casa, de lunes a sábado y su horario de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
Su mercadería usualmente la compra en diferentes distribuidoras de ventas de telas en su misma comuna, ya que los encuentra a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará gran variedad de telas para la confección de ropa de mujer.
Sus metas son tener la posibilidad de comprar más maquinarias para su taller, como maquinas overlock, cortadora, bordadora, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Nicole vive junto a su esposo y su hija pequeña de 5 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral son seguir creciendo y trabajar para grandes tiendas y a nivel personal tener su casa propia.
Nicole está muy agradecida y contenta del crédito y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza. Además comenta que se siente muy cómoda con las reuniones y grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que existe generosidad y  un cálido ambiente familiar.
Independencia es una de las 34 comunas que componen la ciudad de Santiago (capital de Chile), ubicada en el sector centro-norte. Surgió a fines del siglo XIX como un sector tradicional de la ciudad. Su eje principal es la Av. Independencia, por la cual pasaba el antiguo Camino del Inca, puerta de entrada por el norte, a la ciudad de Santiago. Dada su amplia población indígena, en Independencia se encuentra el Centro Cultural Indígena de Chile. Cuenta también con importantes construcciones históricas, entre ellas 6 monumentos históricos de Chile.
texts.en:
The 18 members of the Emprendedores de Juan Antonio Rios community bank operate various businesses that include clothing manufacture and sales, retail sales, hairdressing services, etc.  All the members live in the Independencia neighborhood of Santiago.  
Nicole, standing on the far left in the photo, is the president of the community bank.  She operates a clothing business.  Specifically, she has been making and selling women's clothing for 3 years.  She says that she works in a space that she set aside at home for the business.  She works from Mondays to Saturdays, with no set hours.
She tells us that she normally buys fabric from distributors in her neighborhood because she can get the best price there.  
She will use this loan to buy a range of fabrics for making women's clothing.  
For the future, she would like to buy specialized sewing machines--overlock, cutting, bordering, etc.--that will allow her to expand her business and, in turn, her income and quality of life.
Nicole lives with her husband and 5-year old daughter.  Her work-related goals are to grow her business and sell to large retail buyers.  Her family-related goal is to buy a house. 
Nicole says that she is grateful for the support she's received from Fondo Esperanza.  She adds that she likes her community bank very much because there's an air of generosity and mutual support that she values.
Independencia is one of 34 "comunas" of Santiago (the capital of Chile).  It is a north-central neighborhood of the city and dates from the XIX century.  Its main street is Av. Independencia, the main road in to Santiago from the north and along which once passed the old Camino del Inca.  Because of its large indigenous population, Independencia is home to Chile's Centro Cultural Indigena.  Many historic buildings are located in Independencia, as well, including 6 national monuments.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of fabric for making women's clothing.

loans.name: Rasoul

texts.en:
Rasoul is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married and has two children. Rasoul is a hair dresser for men and has owned a barber shop since 2009. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2,100 loan to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop

loans.name: Sikukuu

texts.en: Sikukuu lives in Likoni, Kenya. She is the mother of five children who are between 5 and 17 years old. Sikukuu works at the market, selling clothes and shoes. With this activity she generates income to support her household. She started learning this occupation precisely when she got married to her husband, a businessman. This business has allowed her to attain economic independence and to support the children’s well-being and to provide professional education so that they can be successful in the future. With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en: Albert is currently applying for a Kiva loan. He plans to use the funds to buy florescent lamps for his electrical business of fixing florescent bulbs in family houses. He needs to make purchases in large volume to earn good discounts so that his offer will be competitive. His goal for later on is to attain a good market position, to hire employees and to dedicate himself to running his business. With the loan, he wants to purchase electric bulbs for his business.

loans.use: to purchase electric bulbs for his business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana tiene 52 años, hace muchos años que es viuda. Tiene dos hijos que ya son adultos y cada uno tiene su familia. Vive sola en su casa propia, la que pudo conseguir luego de mucho trabajo al lado de su esposo. Eventualmente recibe la visita de sus hijos y nietos, son los momentos en su hogar que la llenan de mucha felicidad.

Su trabajo es la confección de ropa, con suma paciencia elabora las prendas que sus clientes le solicitan o también de manera particular, las que ella misma diseña y pone a la venta en un pequeño espacio dentro de su vivienda. Cada uno de los modelos que confecciona son vendidos en poco tiempo por la variedad, creatividad y el toque personal que le agrega a sus creaciones. Se dedica a este trabajo más de 30 años, siempre ha trabajado sola y afirma que nunca tuvo algún reclamo por parte de sus clientes. Ahora, desde hace unos meses ha incursionado en la venta de cerveza. Ambas actividades le permiten generar sus propios ingresos y no depender del dinero de sus hijos. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo de costura es que puede plasmar en una prenda su inspiración, así se siente útil, y espera pronto construir un taller mucho más grande y destinar un espacio únicamente para la venta de sus creaciones.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes lo hacen posible, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, está muy comprometida, una vez más, en cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo anteriormente. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 300) comprará tela e hilos que necesita para confeccionar más prendas.
texts.en:
Ana is 52 years old and has been a widow for many years. She has two adult children who have their own families. She lives alone in her own house, which she was able to get after lots of hard work alongside her husband. Occasionally, her children and grandchildren come to visit; those are the moments at home that fill her with great happiness.

She works making clothing. With great patience, she produces the garments that her customers request as well as one-of-a-kind garments that she designs and offers for sale in a small space in her residence. Every style that she creates is sold quickly because of the variety, creativity, and personal touch that she adds to her creations. She has done this work for more than thirty years; she has always worked alone and points out that she has never had any complaints from her customers. 

Now, in the last few months she has branched out into the sale of beer. Both activities allow her to generate her own income and not depend on her children's money. What she likes about her sewing work is that she can express her inspiration in a garment, which makes her feel productive; she hopes to soon construct a much larger workshop with a space set aside especially for the sale of her creations.

This is Ana's second loan with MFP, and she appreciates those who make it possible for her to continue toward her objectives. On the other hand, she is very committed to making her punctual loan repayments once a month, like she did last time. She is very happy to belong to her communal bank, since all the members are very good, kind, and supportive.

With the amount she has requested (300 PEN), Ana will buy the fabric and thread that she needs to create more garments.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Nancy Violeta

texts.es: Nancy  es  una persona  muy trabajadora  ella  se preocupa   por  el bienestar de su  familia y por  acondicionar  su  vivienda, ella se acerco a la institución ya  que  desea colocar   piso  de  concreto  afuera de su  casa para que  de esta  manera  no entre  tanto polvo a  su vivienda,  esta  muy  contenta  de habernos  encontrado  ya  que  su   hogar  tendrá  una  mejor imagen por  lo que  agradece  el  apoyo  para  la realización de su proyecto.
texts.en: Nancy is a hard-working person whose main concern is her family's welfare.  She approached us because she wants to build a concrete entraceway to her house that will help her keep out the dirt that flies in now.  She says that she was very pleased to have found us because her house is more comfortable thanks to the work that she has been able to do with past loans.

loans.use: to build a concrete entranceway.

loans.name: Afzana's Group

texts.en:
Afzana sells goats and sheep by growing them up. She purchases them in their younger age, gives them good food so that they become healthier and then sells to butchers and during the EID season. Her husband does a job. His income is not enough, so Afzana started her business few years ago.
She has given birth to 6 children. 3 of them are studying in the local school.

Afzana has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further expansion of her business. with the loan investment she will buy goats and sheep in a larger number that will allow her to earn more profits by selling them particularly during EID.

Afzana is very experienced in her business and confident about her business future.

loans.use: to buy animals for animal selling business.

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa is a single mother and has one child who is three years old. She lives in Samburu, Kenya where she makes a living by running a retail shop (a small store that carries a wide variety of goods). Her business is selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She has gained her customers little by little from neighbors in the surrounding area where she lives. This is her principal market. Her greatest wish is to have a well-equipped retail shop to develop her business more comfortably. Her greatest challenge to growing her business is the small space that she has. 

Her shopping is done daily and her transportation expenses increase the cost of her products. For this reason she needs to buy in greater quantity and decrease the frequency of her shopping so she can qualify for volume discounts and be more competitive. This is why she has turned to Credit Kiva, for her second loan with Yehu Microfinance Trust. With this loan she will buy supplies of food items, bundles of wheat flour, sugar and maize flour.

loans.use: to buy supplies of food items, bundles of wheat flour, sugar and maize flour.

loans.name: Phao

texts.en:
Phao is 35 years old. He is married and has two children. He lives with his family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife supports the family by sewing clothes at home. He runs a mechanic shop to earn a living. 

Phao started his business ten years ago. He intends to take a loan to gradually expand his business by buying more equipment and materials for making and processing products. He hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more equipment and materials for making and processing products.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung, 51, is married and has no children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a bricklayer.

Dung has been sewing clothes at her house for three years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more sewing materials to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying more sewing materials.

loans.name: Chimedtseren

texts.en:
Chimedtseren is a 51-year-old, married, Mongolian man who lives with his family in a ger (a traditional Mongolian felt tent). He has three children aged 11 to 22 and his wife works as a chef at the biggest restaurant of Mongolia's most famous hotels. 

Chimedtseren is a specialized excavator machinist, but he supports his family by operating a business making folding doors. He employs one worker, who will help him to make more folding doors. The summer season sees mostly family managed housing projects, so his folding doors become popular throughout the outer ger districts, where there is a lack of basic infrastructure. 

He is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) to purchase metals and other necessary tools. With his business profits, he bought a truck, which he uses to carry his raw materials, such as metals. He also plans to expand his yard. His elder daughter has a new born baby, so his long term aim is to give his children and grandson safe and comfortable living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more materials to make folding doors.

loans.name: Goichak

texts.en:
Goichak is 27 years old. She lives in a small village with her family: her husband, Tabriz, who is worker in construction, two children (3 and 6 years old) and her mother-in-law. The family runs an agricultural business. They have 3 hectare of land, where broom is grown. After harvesting, Goichak and her mother-in-law make brooms and sell them on the local open market. In addition to the agricultural business, Goichak is busy with trading. She purchases clothes and shoes at wholesale markets and sells them in nearby villages. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,100 Lari.

Goichak requested a loan for the cultivation of her agricultural land. After properly done seasonal work, she hopes to get a greater harvest of broom and her sales will increase. Along with the above mentioned, Goichak will use a small part of  the loan for purchasing additional clothes and shoes to increase the turnover in her trade business. As a result of these activities, the income of the family will increase and they will be able to repair and replenish the house with furniture. This will improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to cultivate her agricultural land and sow broom.

loans.name: Dunia

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is a youth client, aged 26 years, married and she has one child. She lives with her husband’s family.

Dunia is a seamstress and she works at home. She has been in this field since 2010. She makes, repairs, or alters clothes such as suits, coats and trousers for women and kids. She has a good understanding of local customers and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation and she is well known in the surrounding areas.

She is requesting $1200 as youth loan to purchase a sewing machine. She is aiming to increase her profits and to provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Sahib

texts.en:
Sahib is 47 years old and married with two daughters. He is a foreman, but his primary business is serving people with lunch and dinner in his café. He has 15 years of experience. He decided to start his own business because his income as a foreman was not stable and very low.  Now he runs his business and serves people with daily meals in his café.  

People in Azerbaijan like to have lunch in national-style cafes and eat national food, as well as spending time with friends in the evening drinking tea with homemade jam. Sahib's place doesn’t look very attractive, but his food is delicious and that’s why his café is full of people. His mother helps him and cooks in his café. 

His monthly income is 300 AZN and he would like to increase it. For this purpose he applied for 1500 AZN. He will use this loan to renovate his café. This will be his third loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to renovate his cafe and buy new furniture

loans.name: Paz Y Progreso - 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento PAZ Y PROGRESO está  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varón la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Rosmery tiene 45 años y es casada con 3 hijos que son de las edades de 16, 25 y 22 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de comida en un puesto de venta que se encuentran en la zona de Tacagua,  Este préstamo es el su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Rosmery va a utilizar este préstamo  para la compra de sillas mesas y otros para abrir su restaurante y así brindar mayor comodidad a su clientela,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo para la compra de muebles y utensilios para abrir su restaurante, la Sra. Rosmery  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y ella va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando utensilios y electrodomésticos para seguir mejorando su restaurante  para brindar a su clientela más comodidad, la Sra. Rosmery es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en: The PAZ Y PROGRESO community bank has eight members: seven women and one man.  Sra. Rosmery, 45, is the president of the group.  She is married and has 3 children who are 16-, 25- and 22-years old, respectively.  Sra. Rosmery operates a food stand in the Tacagua neighborhood.  This loan will be her first.  She will use it to buy tables, chairs and the other things that she needs to operate a restaurant business.  She is appyling for a loan because she wouldn't have enough money to buy what she needs for the business without one.  Sra. Rosmery faces various challenges that include competition from other similar businesses.  She plans to use her future profits to add other things she needs--kitchen supplies, appliances, etc.--so that she can continue improving and growing the restaurant.  Sra. Rosmery is a hard-working person.  She says that she is grateful to you not only for herself but also for other members of her community bank, many of whose businesses are the sole source of income for their families.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, etc. for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Jackeline

texts.es:
Jackeline tiene 28 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora. Su pareja desde hace 7 años es Víctor, de 30 años. Tienen dos hijos; Hugo de 7 años y Virginia de 3 años. Viven en su casa propia, la misma que adquirió con ayuda de su esposo luego de muchos años de esfuerzo y trabajo.

Ella se dedica a la venta de comida rápida, principalmente pollo broaster. Realiza este trabajo todos los días, para ello se levanta temprano para ir al mercado a comprar los ingredientes necesarios y a partir de las 5 de la tarde sale a vender en la vereda de su casa. Algunas veces lo hace dentro de su casa, esto depende del clima, ya que algunas veces llueve, esto le ha permitido mantener fieles a sus clientes que saben que siempre los atenderá cualquier día y bajo cualquier situación. Es una vendedora muy alegre y carismática, por eso también que su público la ha colocado dentro de sus preferidas, esto sumado a la sazón exquisita que tienen sus platillos. Aun recuerda cuando se inició (hace 5 años) y vendía muy pocas raciones, pero con mucho esfuerzo logró obtener más clientes y sus ventas se incrementaron. Adicionalmente, obtiene dinero extra de la venta de hielo y bebidas, lo que le resulta difícil a veces para movilizar las pesadas cajas de cerveza. Para más adelante espera construir un local más grande donde pueda brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes.

Este es el crédito número 7 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Asimismo se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo anteriormente. Y además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios entre sí.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 3000) comprará los ingredientes para continuar con su negocio; implementará su local con la compra de algunas sillas y mesas; y así mismo adquirirá varias cajas de gaseosa y cerveza para estar preparada para la temporada de verano.
texts.en:
Jackeline is 28 years old and is a very friendly and hardworking woman.  She’s been with her husband, thirty year old Victor, for seven years and they have two children, seven year old Hugo and three year old Virginia.  They live in a home that they own and that she acquired with her husband’s help, after many years of hard work.

She sells fast food, primarily broasted chicken.  She does this every day and rises early to go to the market to buy the necessary ingredients and she sells from a window in her home after 5:00 pm.  Sometimes she does it from within her home when it rains.  This has allowed her to maintain loyal customers who know that she will always serve them, any day and in any situation.  She is a very happy and charismatic saleswoman and this is why her customers prefer her; this and because of the delicious seasoning on her dishes.

She remembers when she began (five years ago) and only sold a few portions, but with a lot of effort she was able to get more customers and her sales increased.  She also makes extra money selling ice and drinks, which is sometimes difficult for her because she has to move the heavy cases of beer.  In the future she wants to have a bigger place where she can provide better service to her customers.

This will be her 7th loan through MFP and she is happy to know that she has financial backing and this way she feels more secure in getting ahead with her work.  She is also committed, once again, to be on time with her payments, as before.  She is glad to be part of a communal bank because all of the members are very united and responsible.

She will use the 3,000 PEN to buy ingredients to continue with her business and will set up her place with some tables and chairs and also buy some cases soft drinks and beer so that she is ready for the summer.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and ingredients.

loans.name: Mikpamahu 3 Group

texts.fr: MIKPAMAHU 3 est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres sont des amies, vivant dans le même quartier et exerçant les mêmes activités. La représentante du groupe, Véronique (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 36 ans. Véronique est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Louis. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés dont deux restent à leur charge. Véronique, pour subvenir à ses besoins, produit de l'huile de palme et de vin de palme (à base de noix de palme), qu'elle vend depuis treize ans environs par le système de distribution. Véronique s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans le but d’agrandir son activité et pour être plus compétitif sur le marché, Véronique désire augmenter le stock de ses produits ; ce qui lui permettra d’accroitre son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu. Pour cette raison, Véronique sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MIKPAMAHU 3. Les quatre crédits consentis ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
MIKPAMAHU 3 is a group of four people who are friends living in the same neighborhood and practicing the same activities. The group’s representative is Véronique, seen with her hand raised in the photo. Véronique, age 36, is married to a farmer named Louis. The couple have three children who go to school, and two of them are still in their care. 

For the past 13 years or so, Véronique has been earning a living by making palm oil and palm wine (from palm nuts) for sale through the distribution system. She buys her supplies in a region of Benin.

Véronique wants to replenish her stock to expand her business and become more competitive on the market. This will allow her to bolster her sales and revenue. To that end, she and the other members of the group MIKPAMAHU 3 are seeking a fifth loan from ALIDé. All four previous loans were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy palm nuts to make oil and wine for sale.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar  is a single man who lives in the Samburu, Kenya. He works selling households consumables, in his retail shop, to his neighbors’ and passersby. He also recharges mobile phones batteries which provides him with another source of income. 

Omar's goal for the future is to have a wholesale outlet and a warehouse to distribute to other vendors. Right now, he is applying for a micro-loan, a financial loan from Kiva through Yehu Microfinance to purchase a boda boda (motorcycle) to start a transportation business. This business will allow him to earn additional income. As this happens, his dream is to establish a motorcycle selling shop and guarantee a successful future in his business.

loans.use: to purchase a boda boda (motorcycle) for his transport business.

loans.name: Phi

texts.en:
Phi, 39, is married and has two children: one son and one daughter. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife earn an income running a general store in front of their house. 

Phi started this business 17 years ago. He sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in his community. He is requesting a loan to expand his business. He will be buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock his store and to better satisfy his customers.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock his store.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is a 32 year old man from Kisumu City, situated in the western part of Kenya. He is married to Irene who is a housewife. They have a one year old child.

Kennedy sells music and Video Compact Discs (CDs), a business he has been doing for the last 14 years. He makes a monthly income of KES 6,000. At the moment, he is taking his first loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy more movie and music discs. He will use the profits to repay the loan.

His dream is to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: to buy more movie and music discs.

loans.name: Nancy Lizethe

texts.es: La  señora  Nancy es  una persona responsable  y  muy  trabajadora la  cual día  con día  se  esfuerza  por  acondicionar  su  hogar,  en este  momento  ella  requiere  de nuestro  apoyo  ya  que quiere construir una  barda  enfrente  de  su  domicilio , ve  en el crédito la posibilidad   de  que  su  hogar  se  encuentre  protegido, y   así cuando su   hija  salga  a jugar  al patio  no corra  peligro  y  le  sufra   algún accidente, es  por ello que agradece  el  apoyo  brindado para la realización de  su proyecto.
texts.en: Sra. Nancy is a responsible and hard-working person.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to build a fence in front of her house, a house that she works hard to maintain and improve.  She sees the loan as a way to ensure that the house is safe and protected.  She has a young daughter and she wants her to be able to play in the front without worrying that she might run in to the street.  She is grateful, she say, for this chance to complete the project.

loans.use: Construcción de barda.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
For the past seven years Albert, a 34-year-old single man with no dependents, has been running a retail shop that brings in a monthly income of KES. 8,000. Having repaid his previous loans, he is requesting his sixth loan from KADET LTD to purchase cooking fat, sweets, sugar and rice for resale. He plans to use the anticipated new profits to repay his loan and develop his business by increasing his rice and sugar stocks.

Albert's hopes and dreams are to make more business investments and become a renowned businessman in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cooking fat, sweets, sugar and rice for resale.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence has 7 children, aged between 20 and 39 years old. She lives in Samburu, Kenya. She generates her own income by selling fruits and vegetables in her stall. 

She started her business approximately 12 years ago. As a mother, head of the household, her biggest challenge is to provide for and meet the needs of her two children. They are still under her care until they achieve their dream of becoming successful people. Her children are the impetus for her to continually work. 

Florence's joy and dynamism help her to succeed in her business, but she needs to increase her business capital to achieve her goal of generating more income. This is why she is requesting her 1st Kiva loan with Yehu Microfinance Trust. She will buy sacks of fruits and fresh vegetables for resale with the loan funds. She needs disposable income to stock up on more products and to offer her clients more selection. This will result in the success of her investment and will be the advancement she needs to be able to achieve her dreams in the future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fruits and fresh vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan, 39, resident of Manila, Philippines. Her husband is Roque, a vendor, and a mother to her child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Susan operates a garlic retailing business. What she basically does is buy garlic products from wholesalers, repacks them and sells them with a profit. Her regular customers are neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP30, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of garlic products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Susan hopes to have to grow her business and dreams to be able to give all her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of garlic supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is married and lives in Samburu with her husband. Riziki's business is selling of fresh vegetables and fruits from home to her neighbours and passersby. She started her business seven years ago, with a small amount of capital; she started buying fruits and vegetables and reselling them. She is supported in this business by her husband.

Riziki's business has gradually grown and now her main customers are not only neighbours but also restaurant operators. This helps her business' growth as they always refer new buyers to her. Riziki's main challenge is having enough working capital to buy more fruits and vegetables for resale to increase his income. For this reason, she is requesting a Kiva loan to buy sacks of fruits and vegetables and to invest in a charcoal selling business. This will help increase her income, upon which her family depends.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fruits and vegetables and invest in charcoal selling.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married and has two children.

Mohamad works in the car repair business, and has operated a small garage since 2000. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

Mohamad is requesting a loan of $3,000 to buy a specialized machine for his work. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he can provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a specialized machine for his work

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata is a 36 years old widowed lady from Kisumu City, situated in the western part of Kenya and is currently taking care of her two children aged nine and four years.

Consolata sells household products, a business she has been doing for the last 10 years, and makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. At the moment, she is taking her second loan from KADET LTD., which she will use buy more items like basins, utensils stock and other items. She will use the profits to educate her child.
 
Her dream is to have a big business in Kisumu.

loans.use: To buy more items like basins, utensils stock and other items for sale.

loans.name: Mapenzi

texts.en:
Mapenzi lives with her husband Joseph and their three children in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Mapenzi operates a poultry business, selling to restaurant operators and neighbors. She started her business as a way to contribute to the household income. She was a farmer, and she sells farm produce. 

Mapenzi's greatest challenge is that she does not have enough working capital to respond to the demand in a growing market. She needs to be prepared for these times by having enough chicks to rear to impact her market and to have good sales. Therefore, Mapenzi has turned to her first loan with Yehu Microfinance Trust and Kiva. Mapenzi will use her loan to buy chicks and chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice, 30 years old, is married and blessed with three children aged 10, 8 and 5. She has been selling herbal medicine for 12 years and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000

Beatrice has requested a first loan of KES 15,000 to purchase more herbal medicine to sell. The profit she earns will be reinvested in her business. Beatrice hopes to empower other women through her business performance.

loans.use: To purchase herbal medicine to sell.

loans.name: Hung

texts.en:
Hung is a 59-year-old married woman. She lives with her daughter and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Hung and her husband run a general store and a business providing internet services in the front of their house. 

Hung is requesting a loan to expand their business by buying more household items and many kinds of soft drinks to stock their store. She will also buy equipment for their internet shop. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. 

She also hopes that, through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to buy more household items and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her store and to buy equipment for her internet shop.

loans.name: Vicente Guerrero Group

texts.es:
Vicente Guerrero es el nombre de un grupo integrado por cuatro mujeres emprendedoras, ellas decidieron darle este nombre a su grupo ya que es el nombre del lugar donde se reúnen para realizar sus pagos. Cada una de estas mujeres tiene una actividad económica Silvia y Mirna venden zapatos por catalogo, Gloria vende ropa de manta y cosméticos y por ultimo Paulina tiene un pequeña tienda de abarrotes. El grupo está ubicado en una región productora de azúcar y su gente se dedica a la siembra y cultivo de caña.   

Gloria tiene la edad de 24 años, estudió la universidad y es soltera; desde hace mas de 5 años decidió iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio ya que piensa que se obtienen más ingresos siendo su propio jefe. Ella vende ropa de manta (blusas, faldas, vestidos, servilletas) que compra en la ciudad de Oaxaca, se trata de ropa típica de dicha región. Además, vende cosméticos por catálogo; sale a ofrecer a sus clientes y conocidos sus productos de casa en casa. "Se vende bien y cuando no traigo algún producto, me hacen pedidos y los surto, me gusta mucho vender de ambulante porque conoces mucha gente y se vende más". Gloria está contenta con su negocio y con el paso del tiempo ha logrado hacer muchos clientes lo que le ayuda a incrementar sus ganancias. Gloria invertirá su crédito en la compra de variedad de ropa de manta (blusas, faldas, bestidos, servilletas) y cosméticos para continuar realizando sus ventas. Lo que más desea es continuar realizando sus ventas en un futuro y que su negocio prospere para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Vincente Guerrero is the name of an integrated group of four enterprising women.  They decided to give their group this name because it is the name of the place where they meet up to make their payments.  Each one of these women has a job: Silvia and Mirna sell shoes from a catalog; Gloria sells clothing made of manta (a natural unbleached cotton) and cosmetics; and, lastly, Paulina has a small grocery store.  Their group is located in a sugar-producing region where its people make a living through sowing and cultivating sugarcane.

Gloria is 24-years-old, studies in the university, and is single.  Five years ago she decided to start working in her own business since she thought that she would earn more being her own boss.  She sells clothing made of manta (like shirts, skirts, dresses, and cloth napkins), which is typical for the region, that she goes out to buy in the city of Oaxaca.  She also sells cosmetics from a catalog.  Gloria makes her sales by going from house to house to offer her products to customers and acquaintances.  She said, "sales are good, and when I don't bring a product they place orders and I supply them.  I quite like selling in the streets because I meet many people and I sell a lot."  She is happy with her business and with the passage of time has managed to get many customers, which helps her increase her earnings.  

Gloria will invest her loan in the purchase of a variety of clothing made of manta (shirts, skirts, dresses, and cloth napkins) and cosmetics in order to continue making sales. She hopes that in the future she will continue making sales, that her business will prosper more, and that she will thus have a better life.

loans.use: to buy natural unbleached cotton clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Meherrem

texts.en:
Meherrem is 28 years old, married with two children. He raises fruits and vegetables in his garden and has been doing so for the past 2 years. He is a very experienced farmer and has deep knowledge of the land and how to operate it. He was not able to find job for several years and than decided to start his own business. 
 
Meherrem usually raises seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them for profitable price in the central bazaar. Fresh fruits and vegetables are very popular and in high demand because people prefer to eat them every day and consider them very healthy. One of the favorite national dishes, dolma, is made of fresh eggplants, peppers and tomatoes. His monthly income from this business is 200 AZN. This is only one source of income in his family.

Now Meherrem would like to invest more capital in his business and purchase seeds and fertilizers. For this purpose he applied for 1,500 AZN. This is only one source of income in his family. He hopes this loan will improve life of his family. This will be 3nd his third loan and he has good credit history.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
El Señor Martin tiene 41 años, está casado hace 13 años con la señora Cristina de 32 años, el matrimonio tiene dos hijos que son la razón del esfuerzo de la pareja.
El señor Martin se dedica a la venta de productos agrícolas desde hace 25 años,  siendo soltero empezó a trabajar en esto, luego se casó formando su propio hogar, continuó en el mismo ramo . Comenta que tiene una moto en la que hace entrega de sus productos agrícolas. Tiene una clientela bien formada que siempre compra de él los productos que vende, pues son de muy buena calidad.
Martin solicita el préstamos para la compra de mandioca en cantidad para sus ventas diarias, comprará también frutas y verduras, para  ofrecer a todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
Martin is 41 years old and has been married for 13 years to his wife Cristina, 31.  The couple has two children who are the reason for their hard work.  Martin has made a living selling agricultural products for the past 25 years.  He began this work when he was single, and after marrying and setting up his own home, he continued in the industry.  He has a motorcycle that he uses to deliver his products.  He has a well-established base of customers that always buy products from him because of their good quality.

Martin is asking for a loan to purchase cassava for his daily sales, and he will also be purchasing fruits and vegetables to offer to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase cassava and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai, 44, is married and has two sons. Her husband earns money by making iron doors. Mai supports her family by sewing clothes at her house. She started this job to cover her expenses and to raise her two children. Mai and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Mai is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying sewing materials to increase her business turnover. She hopes that this loan will enable her to expand her business activities and to have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a 48-year-old widowed woman. She has 10 children whose ages range from 5 to 28 years. Pamela describes herself as religious and humble.

For the past 12 years, Pamela has operated rental houses where she provides rental accommodation. Her business is located in a conducive location and her primary customers are the general public. Pamela describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use this KES 20,000 loan to pay for the renovation of her rental houses. Pamela's business goal is to add more real estate in Kisumu within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be financially stable.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of her rental houses

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman who lives with her husband and five children who are between the ages of 19 and 5 years.  Because of her need to generate income so that she could improve her family’s standard of living, Mwanasha began her business, selling fish.  Her main clients are members of the neighboring community.  

Mwanasha is requesting a second loan through Yehu Microfinance Trust, an organization she has been a part of for three years.  Joining Yehu Microfinance Trust made it possible for Mwanasha to set up her business in a comfortable environment.  She will use the money to buy bundles of fish for resale.  Having more fish on hand will enable her to increase her opportunities to sell in the market by allowing her to capture the attention of new buyers and meet the demand of new customers that have been referred to her.  This loan will help her make a successful investment by enabling her to buy supplies in quantity, which will allow her to buy at a discount for paying in cash and for buying in large volume. 

Mwanasha and her husband are very satisfied because, working independently, they have been able to provide for their children’s education.  They dream of watching them become successful because they are definitely the engine of their lives.

loans.use: to buy bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose, 36 years old, is a widow and the mother of two children, 10 and 6. For the past 10 years, she has sold clothes, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000. Rose has requested a first loan of KES 20,000 to purchase two bales of men’s shirts and another bale of jeans to sell. She will use the profit she earns to help her venture into another line of business. Rose's hopes are to succeed in life as well as educate her two children.

loans.use: To purchase men’s shirts and jeans

loans.name: Erkin

texts.ru: Эркин мужчина 48 лет.Женат,имеет 3 детей.С юных лет занимается откормом и купле продажей скота.Очень хорошо разбирается в сфере животноводства.Имеет около 40 поголовья скота .А также имеет 1,5 га земли,где выращивает лук и кукурузу.Он очень ответственный,добросовестный человек.Его семья полностью занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур.Более 8 лет является потенциальным клиентом.На полученный кредит хочет приобрести семена для посева лука и кукурузы.Он надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Erkin is a man of 48 years. He is married and has three children. From a young age he has been engaged in fattening and reselling livestock. He understands the area of livestock breeding very well. He has around 40 heads of livestock. Further, he has 1.5 hectares of land, where he grows onions and corn. 

Erkin is a very responsible and fair man. His family is all engaged in growing crops. He has been a potential client for more than eight years. For the loan received, he wants to purchase seeds for sowing onions and corn. He hopes for your support.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for sowing onions and corn
